179001.name: Armored Core: Verdict Day
179001.description:
The storyline is set in a future world wherein three factions are fighting over natural resources. In online multiplayer mode, which is the main focus of the game, players select a faction and battle players from the others, either in teams or by forming their own team of artificial intelligence-driven mechs. Mechs can be customized with different weapons and skills, and the behavior of AI mechs can be customized as well. The persistent world is reset when one faction dominates the others or when the season ends.

Source: Wikipedia, "Armored Core: Verdict Day", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179002.name: Wildeman
179002.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new Borderland line of Third Imperium books focusses on a single subsector within the Trojan Reach, allowing referees to rely on adventures and sourcebooks that fully scope the region, meaning he can get on with the business of running his campaign!

The Wildeman system is one of the main entry/exit points to and from the Borderland. Its high-quality Highport sees a great deal of traffic, most of which passes straight through. However, there is more to the Wildeman system than the Highport. In addition to the mainworld there are two less-than welcoming semi-habitable worlds in the system.These worlds both hold their own mysteries for those daring to venture there.

179003.name: Best of Future Wars (Volume 1 - 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Alternate Rules for Building Mechs in Battletech
How to Kick Goliath Where it Counts
The Development of the VHE Shell
Welcome to the Best of Future Wars
You Know What Drives Me Crazy?
179003.description:
User summary:

Collects the best articles appearing in Issues #1 - #18 of the magazine.

179004.name: & (Issue 7 Map Supplement - Winter 2013)
179004.description:
User summary:

The FireForge Map Pack to accompany & Magazine Issue 7

Black and white, graphed.

Elevation - gate level, forge level, caravan level, barracks level, leader's level, storage level, caravan level (repeated)

179005.name: Burgs & Bailiffs: Warfare Too
179005.description:
From publisher blurb:

Middle Age battles were some kind of extremely hard-core live RPG that went on 24 hours a day. Fight a baron and die of septicemy.

Warlord: A Moldvay Class
Warband: Abstract skirmishing for Redwald
Battlefield Encounters
In Battle
After the Battle
The Cost of Castles
Goedendag & Franziska

179006.name: Das goldene Spiel mit den zwei Punkten
179006.description:
The players have to move 4 pawns from their starting spaces to the star in the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a six-eyed die and a special die.

If the player rolls:


a pawn: the player can bring a pawn from his house into play on the ring indicated by the eye-die.
a golden arrow the player can move a pawn forward as indicated by the eye-die.
two golden arrows the player can move a pawn forward about twice the rolled eyes.
a black arrow the Player has to move a pawn backwards.
a golden dot the player can move all pawns from the ring indicated by the eye-die to the center star.
a black dot the player has to return all pawns from the ring indicated by the eye-die to his house.

179007.name: Tumo-n
179007.description:
Tumo-n is a game of piling up monster cards. The board starts with the largest monster (size 5, two cards) on the board, and players take turn putting a monster on the pile. You can't put a bigger monster on a smaller monster, though, and little monsters won't be able to hang on to a small ledge. Special actions may also give you an advantage.

As soon as one player is unable to play a monster from their hand, they lose the round. The game is won by the first player to win three rounds.

179008.name: Scions of Sin: Tiefling Archetypes
179008.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come to the Dark Side!

Everyone’s favorite downtrodden anti-heroes and over-the-top villains, tieflings carry within them the touch of the lower planes. Whether it’s a subtle hint of brimstone, glowing red eyes, or full-on red skin and goat hooves, no one expects a tiefling to be a nice guy. Unfortunately, while this can make for a fun character flavorfully, the mechanics of being an untrustworthy tiefling can work against the players of tiefling characters interested in Charisma-heavy classes.

This book aims to give players who want the fact that their character is a tiefling to be more mechanically relevant a way to make that happen, while also providing support for tiefling characters of a variety of classes that don’t typically make much mechanical sense for tieflings. Included are the hell’s troubadour, a bard archetype with a special infernal instrument and the ability to banish souls to hell, the tiefling terror, a bloodrager archetype that unleashes the frightening side of the tiefling’s ancestry, the underworld oracle, an oracle archetype that grants the tiefling a variety of divinatory powers from their connection to the underworld, the blood rebel, a paladin archetype for tieflings who cast aside their heritage, and the abyssal corsair, a swashbuckler archetype for canny and cunning combatants.

179010.name: Big Basket and Small Basket and...
179010.description:
User summary
大きなつづらと小さなつづらと (Ookina Tudura to Tiisana Tudura to) is 'Big Box And Small Box And More' according to the publisher.

There are three closed baskets on the table - one is full of gold, one has a little gold, and one is empty. You must choose one to place in front of you, but beware! If you're greedy and take the big basket, and another player chooses your basket as well, you'll get nothing!

Big Basket and Small Basket and... is a bluffing game played in a number of rounds equal to the number of players. Each round, the first few players secretly choose a single basket card from the cards remaining and place it in front of them. The remaining players then choose a basket to peek into - the big basket gold gets stolen easily, the little basket has a little for everyone, and the empty basket rewards the holder. The winner is the player who collects the most gold.

rpgissuearticle: Movement Rules for Players Using Hex Movement

User summary:

The Ganesha Games Irregular Webzine

179014.description: The second Rim Space Expansion set for Firefly: The Game, Kalidasa adds a massive star system to the 'Verse with loads of new opportunities for adventure and profit. No sector of space is safe as the long arm of the Alliance reaches out beyond the central planets with the addition of the Operative's Corvette. Every region of the 'Verse becomes more dangerous with the addition of new Nav Cards for Alliance Space, Border Space and Rim Space. Two new Contacts, including the twin brothers Fanty & Mingo, provide new work opportunities for ambitious crews, especially those willing to get their hands dirty. The bustling port of Beaumonde offers exciting new gear and supplies for captains of all sorts. The bounty of the Rim also flows back to other Supply Planets with new crew, gear and ship upgrades appearing on other worlds. Finally, new Set Up cards, new Story Cards, and a host of surprises await the bold.
179014.name: Firefly: The Game – Kalidasa
boardgameaccessory: Firefly: The Game – Customisable Ship Models II
Firefly: The Game – The Whole Damn 'Verse game mat
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0097 Expansion Round Up - Roll, Imperial Assault, Firefly
The Game Pit - Episode 56 - The Bumper Review of 2015 (with Top 5s)

179015.description:
Ard Rí is a 2 to 5 player strategic competitive card game, designed for players ages 14 and up. Average game-play time is 30 to 90 minutes. A simplified introductory version is also available for children ages 5+.

In the game, players take on the role of ancient Gaelic warlords and compete among each other to collect the most wealth in order to force the other players to acknowledge them as the ARD RÍ (i.e. the High King).

Play progresses through the seasons of the year, with each season providing players with the opportunity to engage in specified actions. For instance, Cattle are added to a player’s wealth in Spring, with Warriors flocking to banners in the Summer. Wealth is acquired from the wilds during the harvest time of Autumn, with the Harvest Feast of Samhain occurring at the end of that season. At the Harvest Feast, players are required to feed those Warriors they wish to remain under their banner. Winter is a time of hunting, raiding, and politicking, when fortunes can change in a heartbeat.

Play continues until one player accumulates enough wealth or warriors to force the issue and cause the others to acknowledge them as High King.

The game has been heavily influenced by the history and mythology of the ancient Celts, and the advanced version of the game incorporates the mythology into the game-play.

The game uses our Celtic Myth playing cards as game components, with one deck being sufficient for a 2-player game, two decks being recommended for 3 to 4-player games, and all three decks being recommended for 5-player games.
179015.name: Ard Rí

179016.description:
User summary:

Europa is a continental European zine with content for a wide variety of military, fantasy, and science fiction games, including Dungeons and Dragons and Diplomacy.

Reviews
Articles
Sample pages from Pathfinder: Occult Adventures Hardcover

179019.name: Arduin II
179019.description:
User summary:

Both volumes of the Compleat Arduin published in a single volume.

Material between two-volume set and this book is essentially unchanged.

179020.description:
La bataille de Jemmapes: les Soldats de la République Volume I covers the battle fought on 6th november 1792 between a french army led by General Dumouriez, and an Austrian army under the command of the Duke of Sachsen-Teschen.

This battle, that occurred two months after the battle of Valmy, was one of the most important victories of the French army during the french Revolution and forced the Austrians to evacuate Belgium. Nonetheless, they came back in march 1793 after a defeat of Dumouriez's army at Neerwinden.

This game, published by Vae Victis n°122, is the first game of the serie "les Soldats de la République” ("Soldiers of the Republic"), that will cover the main battles fought during the French Revolution
179020.name: La bataille de Jemmapes

179022.name: Luminosity
179022.description:
User Summary

An action puzzle game that requires to to close off areas of the map from different types of enemy drones, you are damaged if enemies hit the lasers that you use to seal off areas. Collect different power ups to help you complete your task.

179023.description:
Snowdonia: Card 31 of 30 is a promo pack of six cards that were printed-on-demand for the UK Games Expo 2015:


Card 31 -- Four versions; each is a variation of "keep your train for points/trash your train for stuff" with a different weather icon on the back (Sun, Rain, Fog and Snow). Choose which version you want to add to the contract deck. Do not use the snow/dynamite one unless also playing with dynamite!
London Jack -- London Jack is played as a train and costs nothing to buy. Put your third worker on London Jack. It is free to activate your worker on London Jack, but he can only be assigned to the Stock Yard (A) or Surveyor Move (G) actions - he can only fetch or go walkies!
Hot Air Balloon --The Hot Air Balloon is played as a train. When bought put 4 rubble from supply on the balloon. When you take the Surveyor action, you may put a rubble from the card into your personal stock to have your Surveyor move an extra station. If the Surveyor moves beyond the last station, put him on the balloon and score +8 points in addition to points for the last station at the end of the game.


Only 160 copies were printed initially, but more will be available for Spiel 2015!
179023.name: Snowdonia: Card 31 of 30

179024.description:
Promo card for the Bears! dice game.

This promo allows the player of the card to convert one of your paired sleepers into a runner.

It is being given away as part of ordering the Bears! promo pack and can also be acquired at conventions from Fireside games.
179024.name: Bears! Alarm Clock

179025.description:
Includes 15 new cards: 1 Rules Card, 13 Gambits, 1 Base.

The gambits in this set function differently than the original Gambits, including entering play hidden. Some actions / bonuses trigger when revealing the Gambit, most have an additional function when scrapping.

Gambits are dealt face down to players at the beginning of the game. You can choose a number of Gambit cards each player will get, or you can give some players less Gambit cards as a handicap. The extra (unclaimed) Gambit cards are set aside in a face down pile. Secret Outpost is kept separate and not shuffled in with the Gambit Cards or the Trade Deck.

Players keep Gambit cards face down in front of them until they choose to reveal them. Gambit cards never go to the trade deck, your hand or personal deck. They have silver borders to make it easier to keep them separate from your other cards. Players may reveal Gambits at the start of the or during their Main Phase.

This pack contains:
1 Rules Card
1 Secret Outpost Base Card
13 Gambit Cards:
1 Acceptable Losses
2 Asteroid Mining
1 Black Market
2 Exploration
1 Hidden Base
2 Rapid Deployment
1 Triumphant Return
1 Two-Pronged Attack
1 Veteran Pilots
1 Wild Gambit
179025.name: Star Realms: Cosmic Gambit Set

179026.name: Siralim
179026.description:
User Summary

Siralim has light roguelike elements and the ability to summon and customize creatures which you use to fight. Dungeons are generated randomly as well as the quests.

179027.name: Mörkrets Hjärta
179027.description:
Mörkrets hjära (Heart of Darkness) is the third and final installation in the adventure series Ärans väg (Road of Honor). Every part in the trilogy can be played separately.

(from back of book, transated from Swedish)

179028.name: Maktens portar
179028.description:
Maktens portar (Gates of Power) is the second part in an adventure trilogy for expereinced characters. Every part can be played separately. The adventure is created for Drakar & Demoner, but can as well be played with Expert Drakar & Demoner.

(from back of book, translated from Swedish)

179029.name: Väsen i Chronopia
179029.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six books in one! Everything you ever wanted to know about creatures in Chronopia. Melkastor's "The Chronopian People" Brundusier, Chariber, Faltrakier, Fryvier, Ice-Barbarians, Kader, Maraijputter, Night-lander, Red Corsairs, Sabraner and Sun-folk. The Lysandrian Beastlord's "Chronopian Beasts" Everything from sekudor to para-ostridges to frost-bears. Kastor's "Sewage Guide" Everything about the Chronopian sewage beasts, from cestodites to goblins. "A little book about Sword-swingers" Everything about the warriors in Chronopia. From mercenaries and gladiators to weapon masters. "In the Shadow of Chronopia - a travel in the true reality" Everything about Chronopia's dark underbelly, street gangs, thieves, assassins, muggers and beggars. What more can one ask for? Laurentius' "The Emperors Men" Mapping of hte hardest to map I.e. agents, carnifexes, chronomages, divinators, timelords, clockmakers, the city guard, warlords, the black guard, nightdevils, judges, white angels and of course the servants and bureaucrats.

179030.name: Metal Quest
179030.description:
Metal Quest is set in unknown number of years after the end of modern human civilization. The survivors clustered into villages and began to live among the ruins, and those who fought the monsters and robots outside became known as hunters. You are one of them. Your job is to complete quest, trade and upgrade your vehicle in order to defeat monsters and outlaws and collect bounties on them.

ALL YOU NEED TO PLAY
6 or more six sided dice, pencil, paper (for recording Gold and monster’s Armour) and a cutting tool.

OBJECTIVE
The objective of the game is to collect as many Bounty Point as possible before the game ends.

GAMEPLAY is divided into 3 phases:
1. UPKEEP
2. MOVE
3. ACTION

UPKEEP. During upkeep you unflip your player card. If doom counter is activated (i.e first boss token are drawn). Roll 1 die, if the result is 1 move the doom counter forward 1 step.

MOVE. You move your character 1 step anywhere except diagonally. Whenever you move, you must draw 1 encounter token and resolve it usually Combat encounter, whenever you win or not put the encounter token face up next the the encounter pile. If you skipped this phase, no encounter card are drawn.

ACTION. During this phase you may resolve your quest or make 1 Town Action (if you are in town). Each solved quest gives 1 Bounty Point.

DOOM COUNTER. When the first boss a drawn, the doom counter is activated, put the green skull token on the first circle of the doom counter. During upkeep player will roll 1 die; if the result is 1, move the token 1 step forward. If the token reaches the black skull, the game end with all player minus 10 BP.

END GAME TRIGGER. The game ends when:
(a) The Doom counter reaches the skull area which also means
everyone did not manage to defeat the boss or bosses or
(b) Someone manages to defeat all the boss.

BOUNTY POINTS At the end of the game. Total up your Bounty points (BP). Each quest is 1 BP, each boss is 5 BP, every 10G you got you received 1BP. The Doom Counter reaches the skull area minus 10 BP. The winner is player with the most BP.

179031.name: The Simpsons: Don't be a Donut!
179031.description:
Don't be a Donut is a quick and easy to play card game featuring the whole cast of Springfield. This fast paced card game is easy to learn and is almost impossible to put down!

To play, shuffle all the cards and deal 6 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards face down in a DRAW pile in the centre, than turn over the top card of the DRAW pile. The first player has to match that card either by number or colour i.e. if the card is a red "3" the player must thrown down a red card or any other colour "3". If a player cannot go they must keep taking the top play until they have a card they can play. Donut cards can be played at any time as long as the background colour matches the existing colour in play and Krusty cards are wild cards and can be played at any time to change the colour of play. The first player to play out all their cards and shout "Don't be a Donut" wins.

A more advanced play for older children involves scoring and several rounds are played. A game is won by the first player to score an agreed number of points (usually 150). This game is great entertainment for children and because it is presented in a small box makes a perfect travel game. Game includes 54 jumbo sized cards.

179032.name: Tanikawa Koji no Shogi Shinan II
videogamedeveloper: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
179032.description:
User Summary

A Shogi game that's partially meant as a teaching tool.

179033.name: Assassin's Creed: Anthology
179033.description:
Assassin's Creed: Anthology is a collector's edition consisting of the main games in the Assassin's Creed series prior to Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.

Packaged in a special presentation box, the anthology includes Assassin's Creed, Assassin's Creed II, Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood, Assassin's Creed: Revelations, and Assassin's Creed III. The games are contained in a steelbook, with three discs; Assassin's Creed and Assassin's Creed II, Brotherhood and Revelations, and Assassin's Creed III.

The anthology contains all downloadable content for each respective game. Assassin's Creed II contains the DLC on-disc, as it is the "Game of the Year" edition. The other games contain redemption codes that access the DLC from the internet.

In addition to the games, the Anthology also contains five A4 art prints.

Source: Assassins Creed Wikia, "Assassin's Creed: Anthology", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179034.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil – The Joker Super Villain
boardgameexpansion: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Forever Evil
179034.description: Promo initially distributed at the 2015 Origins Game Fair. The text of this oversized Super-Villain Character card reads "Once during each of your turns, you may destroy a Villain you have played this turn. If you do, draw a card and ATTACK: Each foe gains a WEAKNESS."

179035.description:
User Summary

A compilation of popular games released by Ocean in 1988 for the Spectrum, Amstrad CPC and Commodore 64.

Crazy Cars was only available in the Spectrum and Amstrad CPC versions and The Last Ninja was only available in the Commodore 64 version.

179039.description:

179040.name: Miracle: The Battle of Midway
179040.description:
Miracle is Two Generals Games' game on the Battle of Midway.

There are 16 counters (game pieces) representing different kinds of aircraft, ships and even weather for each of the two players. As in the original battle, however, the kinds of units (game pieces) that each player has is different.

Since Miracle does not use dice, it may resemble Chess or perhaps Stratego to you. But both those games are abstract, while this is a strategic simulation of an historical battle from the point of view of the two overall commanders: Admiral Yamamoto for the Imperial Japanese Navy, and U.S. Navy forces sent by Admiral Chester Nimitz. Plus the sides are exactly equal in both Chess and Stratego - here each player has assets and liabilities based on the historical situation. For example, the US has fewer aircraft carriers than the Japanese, but has the unsinkable (but unmovable) Midway Island airbase.

Like both those games previously mentioned - and unlike most wargames - we do not use dice or any other random generator. This means the game emphasizes each players skills in strategy and in tactics to attain his own goals, or at least deny the other player his.

Miracle takes place on a water- and smudge-resistant vinyl map small enough to fit in a notebook. We even supply a ziplock plastic bag for the pieces and a resealable plastic cover for the map, making this a very portable game. The rules are short - two pages - and they're online at all times in case you forget to bring a printed copy. An entire game can be played in 35-45 minutes or less. It's quite possible to play a game during lunch, finish it, and switch sides and play it again.

It's easy to learn the rules and quick to play, but the game plays subtly and mistakes are costly. Take care with your forces! As in the original battle, the slightest mistake can cost you the outcome!

rpgissuearticle: Fantastic architecture: Before the doors of Cadwallon

179044.name: Air Raid Pearl Harbor
179044.description:
User Summary

This World War II naval simulation game puts you in command of American and Japanese forces in December 1941. The American forces have been placed on alert due to a breakdown in negotiations with Japan. Attacking Japanese task forces are indeed steaming across the Pacific, planning to launch attacks on locations unknown.

The game starts on a strategic map covering an area of the Pacific Ocean encompassing Hawaii, Midway and Wake. The game switches to tactical battle displays for surface combat and air strikes. Play options include: selecting a date for the attack (from December 1st to 12th), selecting custom task force groupings for your ships, and adjusting the starting locations of your task forces.

The game encompasses carrier air operations, land base bombardment and capture, submarines, and weather (wind, rough seas, and fog). Each game turn constitutes two hours.

179045.name: Robot Dash
179045.description:
Theme: Robots racing through security rooms to be the first to reach "Master Control" and win.

Set-up: Characters are selected and the remaining deck is separated into a Main Deck, the "Master Control" goal card, Shieldpass cards, and the Dice Deck. The Main Deck is shuffled and the first thirteen cards are placed face down on the table in a cross, with one in the center and three leading out on each spoke. Each player chooses one of the spoke ends to start on. The goal card is placed face up as a fourth card at the end of one of the unchosen spokes. One card from the Main Deck is then dealt to each player and the card at the end of the spoke they each chose is flipped face up, revealing the first room they must move through.

Game-play: Players take two actions per turn from an assortment of actions including drawing new cards, using special rooms to fabricate protective Shieldpass cards, place a new room from their hand into an empty spot adjacent to one or more cards, check a neighboring face down room, or move from room to room. To move from a room without spending cards, a player must either have a Shieldpass attached that matches either the Security clearance of the room (Theta, Sigma, or Omega) or the attack type of the room (Fire, Ice, or Bolt). Alternatively, a player may elect to "crash" a room by discarding cards from their hand to draw cards from the Dice Deck in order to equal or overcome the number at the top left of the Security Room they are in. Once a room is crashed, it no longer hinders any player for the rest of the game. The first player to move their robot character to the goal card and spend an action there wins the game.

The game also serves as an alternate art poker deck, and has a one-to-one correspondence with a standard deck. Rules for playing a free version, by using a standard deck of cards are also available.

179046.name: Skilletan
179046.description:
User summary:

A city sourcebook for Fifth Cycle. Skilletan is described as a "third cycle city" that "survives on a constant supply of excavated artifacts." Includes a players' section with general overview and GM's section with secrets. There are 23 individual NPCs and 26 generic ones, 107 locations, a foldout map. Two new professions and nine new skills, plus adventure seeds.

179047.name: Cults Attempt Hokypoky
179047.description:
"An unauthorized third-party parody expansion compatible with Cards Against Humanity allowing you even more horrible combinations for you and your horrible friends to chuckle at.

You will want the Cards Against Humanity base set at the very least to play. Go. Give them money. It's worth it."

Theme and game-play is identical to Cards Against Humanity, just additional card options to revitalize your play experience.

179048.name: Small Town Secrets
179048.description:
Theme: "Every small town has its secrets. When a murderer is loose, and everyone is suspect, you never know what will be uncovered. Is the Quarterback dealing drugs? Does the town Doctor have Mafia ties? Is the FBI Agent assigned to the case actually the killer? Only by making use of your investigative team to find the evidence can you beat your opponent to the truth."

Game-play: Deck building game that uses a built in scoring mechanic that may slim your deck each turn. Scored cards have either positive or negative values, and can be played to reduce an opponent's score. In addition to buyable cards to make your deck stronger, there are also Secrets that star outside the deck, and give powerful effects once activated. Each player also has a single Dark Secret that can give a massive amount of points toward winning the game.

Goal: The first player to reach the point total on the "Premise" wins the game. Premise cards included have 10, 20 and 30 point goals, though the 10 point goal tends to be an hour long game by itself.

179049.name: FlapThulhu
179049.description:
Flap through the horrible gates of R'lyeh and unleash the Madness to open a portal to the eldritch dimension... or will the madness take you?

New in version 2, you can now beat up lesser monsters as you fly through a disgusting cave. You can also unleash and play as a new horrible beast.

Features:
- Flapping
- Fighting
- Madness

Source: The Publisher Website.

179050.name: PuzzleBits
179050.description:
A whimsical puzzly thing, with bits that go boom.
Place the colorful pieces in the right spots to complete a puzzle. If you succeed, the puzzle will explode into tiny bits, which then recombine into a new challenging shape!

– 500 puzzles!
– Hundreds of unique, brightly colored, piece shapes.
– Playful animations and soundtrack.

Source: The Publisher Website.

179051.name: Titansgrave: The Ashes of Valkana
179051.description:
Publisher Blurb

"A world of fantasy and science-fiction, inspired by things like Thundarr the Barbarian, the Heavy Metal movie, and On A Pale Horse. In our world, called Valkana, magic and technology exist side by side, so our wizards can cast mighty fireball spells against cyborg lizardfolk who are wielding swords. Valkana is a broken and wounded world, a post-apocalyptic land of science fantasy that is so much fun to create and explore."

(Source: http://wilwheaton.net/2015/05/valkana-is-a-broken-and-wounde... )

You watched the show; now play the game! Titansgrave: The Ashes of Valkana is Wil Wheaton’s new tabletop RPG show on Geek & Sundry. It introduces an original science fantasy setting that mixes high magic and hi-tech. Written by a stellar team of award-winning designers, this companion book for the Fantasy AGE RPG gives you background info on Titansgrave, and all the adventures you saw on the show. The adventures include new encounters and options that will let you make the story your own. So grab your blaster and ready your spells. Titansgrave needs heroes!

(Source: http://titansgraverpg.com/)

179052.description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Hamburg each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.
179052.name: CityProGame Hamburg

179053.description:
Using the Napoleonic version of the March into Battle system, this game portrays the Battle of Waterloo in a furious, fast moving three turn game. Part of a planned group of four mini-games on the battles of the Waterloo campaign, with Ligny, Quatre Bras, and Wavre.

In this system, units not just take physical losses but will become ineffective from fatigue and disorder long before they run out of men - unless you, in command, can manage them effectively and maintain their edge.

Map scale: 1km per hex
Unit scale: divisions, 1000 men per strength point
Time scale: 3.5 hours per turn
179053.name: La Belle Alliance

179054.name: Legione Nera
179054.description:
From the back of the book:
Questo supplemento contiene:
20 supercriminali pronti per l'uso,
Dettagli di Ambientazione,
Uno scenario introduttivo,
Spunti d'avventura, basi segrete, cultisti fanatici, alieni e minacce soprannaturali che renderanno le vite dei vostri eroi un vero inferno.

English translation:
This supplement contains:
20 supervillains ready for use,
Details of the Setting,
An introductory scenario,
Hints of adventure, secret bases, fanatical cultists, aliens and supernatural threats that will make the lives of your heroes a real hell.

179055.name: Steam & Fog
179055.description:
From the publisher website:
Il gioco tratta un'ambientazione definita gothic steampunk, in pratica una versione alternativa dell'Europa del XIX secolo (in particolare Parigi) dai toni molto cupi e oscuri, abitata in gran parte da umani, ma dove non è infrequente imbattersi in corvi parlanti, lupi mannari, serial killer e ombre assassine.

The game's setting is gothic-steampunk, an alternative Europe of the nineteenth century (especially Paris, very gloomy and dark, inhabited largely by human, but where it is not uncommon to come across ravens that speak, werewolves, serial killers and murderous shadows.

179056.name: Exiled in Eris
179056.description:
Exiled in Eris is a role-playing game of swords and blasters, robots and monsters. In Exiled in Eris, you play the part of an artifact hunter, an adventurer searching for lost treasures among the ruins of a bygone age. Artifact hunters come from many backgrounds. They can be learned scholars, intrepid explorers, roguish scoundrels, or greedy tomb robbers. Think of characters like Indiana Jones, Laura Croft, and Conan of Crimmeria.

Exiled in Eris is a game that combines tropes from Planetary Romance, Sword and Sorcery, and the Wild West. It is equal parts Flash Gordon, Conan the Barbarian, Indiana Jones, and the Magnificent Seven. It is a game about ancient ruins filled with riches beyond imagining and artifacts of great power. It is about evil empires ruled by despotic dictators and alien overlords scouring the land of its resources. It is about wild frontier towns filled with intrigue and deception. It is about the noble struggle for freedom and for honor.

179057.name: The City in the Mirage
179057.description:
The City in the Mirage is an adventure scenario for Exiled in Eris by Christian Conkle.

This scenario is designed for a party of four to six adventurers of first or second level.

The characters are hired by a noted scholar to accompany him on an expedition into the heart of Eris to find and explore what he believes to be a lost Aeonian city, rendered invisible by some powerful artifact. The story then follows the journey over the desert by airship, a visit to the small Erisian town of Sweetwater, a perilous overland trek, a surprise ambush in the middle of the night, and the exploration of the ancient ruins of the invisible city and the dangers lurking therein.

179058.name: Giantslayer Poster Map Folio
179058.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stand up to the powerful giants of the Pathfinder campaign setting wherever they may be with the Giantslayer Poster Map Folio. Seek high adventure while battling gigantic foes or map your party's progress through the mountainous regions of the Inner Sea with these three massive poster maps designed for use with the Giantslayer Adventure Path.

These huge, lavishly illustrated poster maps depict locations found in the Giantslayer Adventure Path. The first map explores the human town of Trunau (the setting for the first Giantslayer adventure), surrounded on all sides by the orc-infested Hold of Belkzen. The second map shows the Mindspin Mountains, where the rest of the Adventure Path's action takes place. The third map is a player-oriented illustration of the frost giant training camp of Skirgaard, which your players can use to plan their assault on the settlement in the fourth volume of the Adventure Path!

Whether you're looking for a rough-and-tumble town under threat from orcs or a mountainous giant settlement, these beautiful maps are the perfect resource for the Giantslayer Adventure Path or any fantasy campaign.

Cartography by Robert Lazzaretti and Ben Wootten.

179059.description:
Movie Mashup
You are screenwriters for the filmstudio Galactic Pictures, which is looking for the next blockbuster.
It's on you to write a spectacular script as fast as possible!

In the first part of the game you have to gather ideas (cards) for your story, but beware the demands of the studio and the audience! Some genres (card-colors) are highly in vogue, others are simply not. And of course each story should contain lead characters, a supporting character, an item, a villain and a setting! The more precise your script sticks to this demands, the more points it will get.

In the second part of the game it's time to create a short, convincing and exciting story out of your story elements. Tell your storys, give points to each other and in the end one story will become the new blockbuster!


German description:
Filmvisionäre und Drehbuchautoren gesucht!
Das Filmstudio Galactic Pictures braucht einen neuen Blockbuster und hat euch damit beauftragt, so schnell wie möglich die Handlung für einen großartigen neuen Film auszuarbeiten.

Im ersten Teil des Spiels sammelt ihr Ideen, die in Form von Karten auf dem Tisch liegen. Dabei müsst ihr jedoch die Vorgaben des Studios einhalten: Welche Genres (Kartenfarben) liegen gerade im Trend? Und was kommt beim Publikum im Moment gar nicht an? Darüberhinaus sollten von Hauptfiguren, über Nebenfigur, Gegenstand, Bösewicht und Schauplatz alle wichtigen Elemente einer Geschichte enthalten sein. Je genauer die Story diese Vorgaben einhält und den aktuellen Trends entspricht, desto mehr Punkte bringt sie ein.

Im zweiten Teil des Spiels geht es darum, aus den zuvor gesammelten Story-Elementen eine kurze, schlüssige und spannende Geschichte zu ersinnen und sie einander zu erzählen. Dann werden verdeckt Wertungschips für die Geschichten der Mitspieler verteilt und alle Punkte addiert. Die Story des Spielers mit den meisten Punkten schafft es auf die Leinwand und verspricht: Großes Kino!
179059.name: Großes Kino!

179060.description: A single card that was included in the Spielbox 03/2015 issue
179060.name: Dixit: Spielbox 03/15 Promo Card

179061.name: MLB 15: The Show
videogamehonor: 2016 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
179061.description:
MLB 15: The Show is a Major League Baseball video game developed by Sony San Diego and published by Sony Computer Entertainment. It is the tenth entry of the MLB: The Show franchise, and was released on March 31, 2015, for the PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation Vita.

Matt Vasgersian, Eric Karros, and Steve Lyons return as commentators. Mike Carlucci returns as public address announcer.

Source: Wikipedia, "MLB 15: The Show", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179062.name: OpenQuest Adventures
179062.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book is an eighty page collection of scenarios and articles designed to show how OpenQuest can be used for different flavours of fantasy gaming. Within its pages you’ll be able to visit Ancient Rome, enjoy a short dungeon crawl, experience the horrors of a small hell and even the joys of the original D100 adventure setting Glorantha!

This book contains the following:

Deep in the Hole

In the settlement of Spearing, the Governor’s son has gone missing in a nearby ruined fort.
A short and deadly Dungeon adventure and small settlement for the characters to rest up between adventures.

Gloranthan Runes for OpenQuest

Runes are the building blocks of the Mythic World of Glorantha.
In this article you will learn how to use Gloranthan Magic with OpenQuest.

The Tomb of the Empty Emperor

The villainous Lunars have ridden to the city of Zonos, a vast ruined tomb of the Empty Emperor of Dara Happa.. It’s up to your plucky heroes Solar Heroes to prevent them raising this Chaotic God from the dead.
An alternative “What if” take on Classic Glorantha, and an example of how to handle Epic adventures.

Non Semper Erit Aestas

AD 68. The Emperor Nero is dead. His Generals are in revolt and rebellion is brewing in the Rhine.
How to use OpenQuest in a Historical Fantasy setting, in this case the Ancient Roman Empire.

The Road to Hell

The Villainous noble Jerick Ionos has been exiled from the Empire, he’s escaped and headed down the old Imperial Road into the wilderness. Dare you take the Imperial coin to track down this Villain?
An Other World adventure, set in an evil pocket Hell, where all is not what it seems. Villains are heroes and heroes are villains.

179063.name: Tales of Berseria
179063.description:
User Summary

The protagonist will be a female pirate named Velvet. The theme of the game is supposed to revolve around pirates.

179064.name: Guesstimaster
179064.description:
Become the Guesstimaster in this fast-thinking game, by Acabo Games. Challenge your mind, use powers of deduction and guesswork to come up with answers for the toughest of questions!

Invite up to 3 friends, either test your wits against each other or join forces and use your knowledge to make educated guesses on facts about the wider world. Even if you relinquish the lead, you can impact the game in your favor: steal your opponents’ points, make them reveal their answer first or swap places with them!

Three categories of questions (Market, Technology and Mindplay) require varied knowledge and excellent guesstimation skills to obtain mastery. Get your neurons firing and earn the title of the Guesstimaster!

Example questions:


How many people have visited the Eiffel Tower since its construction in 1889?
How many red blood cells does an adult human have on average?
How many cups of coffee are consumed in the U.S. every day?

179065.name: Invasion
179065.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever since H.G. Wells published War of the Worlds in 1898, the stories about invaders from other worlds have become a staple of the science fiction genre. Numerous real-world panics have been created by people who were terrified by the idea of aliens coming to our planet with evil intent. Certainly there are also many stories about aliens who are peaceful, tolerant, and wise; these being come to Earth with benign intentions, and often it is the humans who are the villains. Still, it is easy to understand why the prospect of encountering another species is so frightening. What if they are not benevolent? What if their society is not the epitome of advanced culture and enlightened values? In otherwords, what if they are just like us: flawed, violent, and willing to take what they want by force?

Human history is riddled with examples of contact between formerly isolated cultures. Rarely are these events a meeting of equals, and rarely have the less technologically advanced cultures escaped assimilation, enslavement, or genocide. If one is aware of the Roman conquest of Europe and the European conquest of the Americas, then how can one ignore the possibility that our first contact with another world will be with an alienconquistador? Can we be sure that our other worlds visitors will not be greedy, violent subjugators in the model of Columbus and Cortez?

179066.name: Against the Goblins
179066.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Adventure
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 1-3
A foreboding dream of impossible foes; goblins with control over fire, disease, and death, leads to a tiny village on the edge of the wilderness threatened by three goblin tribes united by chaos and a legacy of hate.

Against the Goblins is the first of a series of full size adventures compatible with the Swords & Wizardry rules.

179067.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 66 - Jun 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Hazard: Tornado!
Raconteurs’ Rest: A Compact Model, Part 3
The Prep Room: Scratchable Game Maps
Up Close and Personal: Cassius Belli
179067.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #066: June 2015

Cover: Ian Stead

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

179068.name: Winged Cavalry
179068.description:
From publisher blurb:

Letters from the Flaming Crab is a monthly series of Pathfinder-compatible supplements. Each Letter focuses on exploring a different topic to give gamemasters and players new, exciting options that can be dropped into any campaign.

Welcome to our first issue: Winged Cavalry! Our team of writers brings you the master of aerial combat: the wind warden, an alternate class for the cavalier. And 4 orders for the wind warden: the order of the feather (pegasus), order of the hunt (pteranodon), order of the spire (magic carpet), and the order of talon and mane (griffon). In addition, we have a few advanced flying maneuvers in the book. "Do a barrel roll!"

179069.name: The Karza, Children of the Loomqueen
179069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Why Drow?
Since “ancient times” when a dark subterranean race incited giants to attack the lands of men, the evil breed of elves known as drow has been a favorite adversary of tabletop adventurers, seen with a mix of fear at their eldritch power and the temptation of their myriad treasures and magical secrets. One is always seen as virtuous against the drow, and the necessity of opposing them gives a sense of heroism to many stalwart players. The scale of their society and machinations ensures that they will be a solid challenge that will never lack for twists and turns.

On Porphyra…
The drow are as much a Landed (not native to Porphyra) race as dwarves or mâlites. The restrictions of past scenarios do not apply, and each sect of drow, though somewhat physically and psychologically similar, come with different loyalties and raisons d’etre, unchained to one another. Drow serve many, wildly different masters on the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra, and struggle to survive after being dragged from their worlds of origin- anything goes now, with the drow… so make sure you don’t miss out.

This volume focuses on the subset of drow known as the Karza who are the children of the loomqueen, Karzerothrine.

179070.name: The Kingpin
179070.description:
From publisher blurb:

I have a cunning plan! - Baldrick, from Blackadder

A master of cunning, the kingpin guides anyone willing to heed his plans to triumph after triumph. Kingpins often end up as leaders and many become masters of gangs, guilds, or armies. Others become prized advisors, officers, or the power behind the throne. The kingpin trades battle prowess for a myriad of tricks and deeds of cunning, allowing his gang to perform acts of daring no others could do.

The Kingpin is a new 20-level base class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

179071.description:
The Great Dinosaur Rush — or the Bone Wars, as it's otherwise called — was a period of incredible advancement in paleontology (i.e., the discovery of fossils).

In The Great Dinosaur Rush, players compete to grab bones from the best dig sites, and build new dinosaurs for prestigious museums, gaining notoriety in the process by stealing bones, sabotaging dig sites, and otherwise impeding your fellow paleontologists.

The game is played over turns, each with two main phases: dig and build. During the dig phase, players collect different-colored bones from dig sites and perform actions. Some dirty actions give players secret notoriety tokens. Notoriety adds to players' scores at the end of the game, but having the MOST notoriety SUBTRACTS from the score! During the build phase, players create their dinosaurs from the bones they collected, maximizing them to score points in various museum categories: length, size, height, ferociousness, etc.

You'll have to play dirty if you want to win — just not too dirty!
179071.name: The Great Dinosaur Rush
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 93 - Legacy...Other Games
Episode 81- Inis, Renegade Game Studio Contest, and Geek Out Volume 2
GenCon 2015 - APE Games
The Good The Board and The Modified: Episode 86 “Variants”
Vox Republica 099: The Spirit of Spirit Island
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 33
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 46!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 47!!! ft Chris and Joe from Cardboard Architect
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 50!!! Featuring a Patrick Hillier review of Elder Sign, AnnaBeth and her Story Cubes and Kerensa joins me again!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 51!!! ft Patrick Hillier, AnnaBeth and Kerensa
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 52!!! The Anniversary Episode featuring EVERYONE!!

179072.name: Summoning Rooms
179072.description:
From publisher blurb:

Summoning Rooms is a set of printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contains: 3 small battlemaps depicting summoning rooms and chambers, with arcane symbols and portals.

Uses: Ideal for quick encounters, or as secret rooms in dungeons or castles. Summoning rooms can be used as chambers for ancient rituals, the summoning of demons, mystical ceremonies or teleportation devices.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

179073.name: Volton
179073.description:
From publisher blurb:

He stands a solitary vigil against forces outside the law!

In 1942, a 16-year-old Joe Kubert received his first professional solo assignment from Holyoke Publishing--the new superhero series “Volton.” He drew (and possibly scripted) four episodes, which appeared in the pages of Catman 8 – 11, before he moved onto other projects... and a career that spanned seven decades and saw him develop into one of the greatest talents to ever work in comic books.

Volton is the first complete collect of these earliest known superhero works of Joe Kubert, and his fans can get an indepth look at his still-powerful storytelling style before he found the one that was uniquely his own. In addition to the classic comics, the book contains an addition to NUELOW Games’s OGL Modern d20 Superpowers rules, which fit smoothly into any OGL Modern or d20 Modern game since it uses the existing feats and talent trees system. The four feats and energy tree presented in this book gives you the tools needed to create characters like Volton and other heroes who channel and electricity and other energy.

179075.name: Briranor
179075.description:
From publisher blurb:

The proud, but chaotic people of Briranor are driven by art, and their own personal passions. With the help of their elven allies they rose from barbarism to become the most prolific artisans among the human cultures of Celmae. But their fondness for creativity is not their only strength. Their world renowned cavalry, The Behir Riders, are feared throughout the West.

Included Within:

The country of Briaranor; a complete kingdom featuring five major settlements with detailed stat blocks
Four New Gods
New Domains and Subdomains
The Behir-Rider Prestige Class




And much, much more!

179077.name: The Hollows They Delve Will Swallow Them All
179077.description:
From publisher blurb:

A high plateau. Overlooked by crags, its aurorae play over a garish scrubland of mineral-rich rock riddled by the warrens of burrowers and quarried by settlers of a league of rival towns.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted plateau as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including inhabitants, towns, settler activity, burrows and the rock.

The towns could be detailed using Events: Goings-on Seen or Heard of in the Olde Worlde Settlement as well as Pseudohistorical Buildings on 2+ Dice, and the settlers developed using Character: More or Less Promising Olde Worlde Adventurers, all of which are part of the main bundle. The burrow networks could be simplified or extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle, most obviously The Vermian Maze.

179078.name: Basic Dungeon Tiles: Expansion Set V
179078.description:
From publisher blurb:

This booklet expands upon the existing Basic Dungeon Tiles range with the introduction of 17 pages of printable stair tiles.

Note that these tiles are intended for use with 28mm miniatures (on a one inch grid), and are compatible with all the other tiles in the Basic Dungeon range.

179079.name: Kamimusubi
179079.description:
User summary:
カミムスビ (Kamimusubi) is a middle-ware game, to be used with other Trading Card Games (TCGs). This game is intended to let cards fight each other. You can play Kamimusubi as a stand-alone game, but by adding other TCG's cards as an extension deck, it is possible to produce a variety of play. The cards which are lying idle in your house get ready to fight for a battlefield never seen before. Let's create the strongest deck with your TCG cards!

You play a card from your hand and pay cost and send a character to the battlefield, like in the card game "San Juan". When you pay higher costs for your character, you can put an expansion card on the top of a character card, thereby transform a character itself into an expansion card.

Kamimusubi is a 2-player game and has 36 cards in the deck. Players let characters fight, and the winner is the first player to cause direct damage on their opponent five times.

The game uses artwork by the designer but also free artwork from an open source video game, ジュエルセイバー (Jewel Savior). The publishers of the video game wanted the widest possible use for their work, so turned it into open source. The artists for the video game are listed on their website.

Publisher's summary:
カミムスビは「異なるＴＣＧ同士を戦わせることを目的とした、ミドルウェアゲーム」です。
これ単体でも遊ぶことが出来ますが、他のＴＣＧのカードを拡張デッキとして追加することで、多彩な遊び方を生み出すことが可能です。
あなたの家に眠るカード達がまだ見ぬ戦場を求めて張り切っています。
目指せ、ＴＣＧ界最強のデッキ！

サンファン方式で、手札を捨ててコストを支払いキャラクターを戦場に出します。キャラクターはさらにコストを支払うと拡張カードを上に乗せることが出来ます。それによって拡張カードに変身します。
そして、キャラクター同士で戦闘を行い、先にプレイヤーへ5回直接ダメージを与えた方が勝利します。

179080.name: One Knight Games Core System
179080.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you need a game for just one night, One Knight Games provides everything you need. From reading the rules to making characters to playing the adventure, everything is geared towards having it all happen in a single night.

The adventures of One Knight Games contain story, maps, and descriptions of encounters – everything you need to run the adventure. However, they do not tell the GM what to say during an encounter, not do they dictate how to run said encounters. These things are given to the Gamemaster to decide.

179081.name: The Silver Henge
179081.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure and Intrigue!

The Old World: Peace has broken out all across the vast Bezian Empire, and adventuring work has dried up along with it. However, in the hinterlands of the Empire, there is always work to be found . . . for those willing to get their hands a little dirty.

The Silver Henge: In the northern reaches of the Bezian Empire, the Imperial Army is struggling against the Druids of the Old Faith. The Druids have made themselves a trial to the Empire. They are constantly inciting resistance amongst the locals, absorbing wealth and tribute that the Empire feels is rightfully theirs, and protecting criminals (of a political sort). Not to mention the Druids' open defiance of the True Religion, which the church abhors. The Empire has had enough, and it intends to put an end to the Druidic faith, once and for all.

This first issue of One Knight Games offers a full nights worth of fun, everything you need to run a fast, fun game with little effort and very little pep time.

179082.name: Golden Lies
179082.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure & Outlawin' Gamblers and Gunslingers

The Old West: After the Civil War ends, a group of former soldiers quickly finds themselves at the end of their means. Their meager pay-out from the war doesn't last long, and herding cattle and sheering sheep is seasonal work. Eventually, then, these former soldiers begin to supplement their incomes with various acts of outlawry, using the skills they learned during the war. It isn't long after that before they become a gang of Outlaws in truth.

179083.name: Gelly Rain
179083.description:
From publisher blurb:

Futuristic Cycle Racing and Drama!

Gelly Rain: The Kid's Parent was a famed Cyclon racer, but died on the track in a ball of flames. Instead of selling the racing seat back to the sponsor company, though, the family held the seat open for the day when the Kid would come of age and could race the seat in the Parent's place. It has meant facing the anger of the sponsors, who don't like leaving a racing seat open for so long – a seat that they're paying good money to sponsor. And it has meant years of grinding poverty while the family suffered under seat rental fees and the dead Parent's racing debts. Yet, they somehow managed. ...And now, the Kid has come of age and has taken up the Parent's old seat. This is the Kid's first race.

179084.name: The Lonely Fortress
179084.description:
From publisher blurb:

A recent uprising amongst the local tribes of the far north has upset the careful string of alliances that the Bezian Empire has worked so hard to forge. The uprising was, of course, put down harshly and easily by the Imperial Army. But the peace has been broken. Without the Imperial Peace, the locals tribes have resumed their perpetual infighting. And one of those tribes has decided to built a fortress on its border in order to aid in their defense. ...A fortress, in Imperial territory, occupied solely by one of the conquered tribes. That is something that the Empire cannot allow.

179085.name: Changeling
179085.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Face of Change

“Some call me a Changeling for my ability to alter my appearance at-will. I have a gift most people would kill to have, but being able to change shapes isn’t always fun and games. Sometimes I feel like I don’t even know my own identity anymore, and many of my kind suffer from severe personality disorders.

I use control animate powers to alter my physical form and I’m adept at changing the shape of others, too. Anything made of organic material is fair game as long as it wouldn’t kill me to touch it. I once knew another changeling who tried to save his own life by turning a bear into a billy goat. Too bad for him the beast mauled his face before he had time to transmute it. If he was smart he’d have just turned himself into a bird and flown away, but sometimes it’s hard to think like that under pressure.”

Psi-punk Archetypes: Changeling is all about people with the ability to alter living material at-will using the control animate psychic power. This supplement provides further insight into the archetype and offers suggestions for skill selections, Gifts, Faults, and Gear that would be useful to any changeling.

179086.name: Dead End Gulch
179086.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Old West: After the Civil War ends, a group of former soldiers quickly finds themselves at the end of their means. Their meager pay-out from the war doesn't last long, and herding cattle and sheering sheep is seasonal work. Eventually, then, these former soldiers begin to supplement their incomes with various acts of outlawry, using the skills they learned during the war. It isn't long after that before they become a gang of Outlaws in truth.

Dead End Gulch: Due to a little "misunderstanding," a couple of the Outlaws have ended up thrown in jail and sentenced to hang for crimes that they didn't commit. 'Course they got a number of crimes that they did commit which would see them hanged, too, if'n those around these parts knew about 'em. But that's all beside the point to the Outlaws' way of thinking, and the injustice of this here trial and hanging sore outrages the Outlaws' sense of Justice. And they're not about to let the Law get away with such shenanigans.

179087.name: Shammy Spark
179087.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cyclon: High-speed cycle racing on the ever-changing plasti-tracks of the Cyclon. It's high-speed thrills and danger in the deadly motorcycle racetracks of the future. Racers may live the high life, but it can all evaporate in an instant in a burst of fire and smoke. The fire and smoke of a deadly wreck.

In this series of Adventures, two of the Players will be playing “story characters.” Each story character has a single rule that must be obeyed during character generation. One of the Players will be the Kid. The only thing the Kid character must be is young. And a second Player will be the Parent's old racing Partner. The only thing the Partner must be is on the same team as the Kid. Other than that, the Players have full control over who these characters are, from name to sex to chosen skills. Also, the Kid has a few added benefits in return for having the character's age dictated.

The Parent of the Kid is a famed Cyclon racer. One day, though, the Parent dies on the track in a ball of flames. The only things most dead racers leave to their family are debts and the lease on the racing seat that they rented from the racing company that controls their cycle. In that situation, most families sell the racing seat back to the sponsor company, using the proceeds to pay off the debts, and then live of the remainder. But, this family decides to hold onto the seat until the Kid comes of age and can race in the Parent's place.

Shammy Spark: The Kid's Parent was a famed Cyclon racer, but died on the track in a ball of flames. The Kid has come of age and now races the Parent's old racing seat. But Cyclon racing is an expensive proposition, especially for newcomers like the Kid. Somehow, the Kid is going to have to contrive to scrape together the funds necessary to keep racing, renegotiate a contract with hostile sponsors, and fend off a bunch of racers who would rather see the Kid fail. ...That Kid had better be clever. Or else exceedingly lucky.

179088.name: The Temple of Bronze
179088.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Old World: Peace has broken out all across the vast Bezian Empire, and adventuring work has dried up along with it. However, in the hinterlands of the Empire, there is always work to be found . . . for those willing to get their hands a little dirty.

Temple of Bronze: Though the Druidic faith has been outlawed and driven out of all Imperial-controlled lands all across the Bezian Empire (for the most part), on the far northern fringes, one of the Drake tribes is stubbornly still practicing the Old Faith. Worse, there are rumors that these Drakes have revived some of the practices of a disgraced cult that split off from the Old Faith long ago. The practices of that cult include kidnapping and human sacrifice. The Empire wants this vile cult wiped off of the face of the earth before the cult can impose their foul beliefs upon any other citizens of the Empire.

179089.name: Larceny and Old Lace
179089.description:
From publisher blurb:

After an unfortunate confluence of events, the Outlaws have found themselves out of means in a little town farther to the east (thus, closer to civilization and the Law) than they'd ever like to be. But, thing is, they do have a possible way out of their jam, 'cause they've got themselves something along the lines of a treasure map.

Regrettably, though, the treasure seems likely to be lying somewhere inside the home of an old widow woman who has no idea that she's sitting on a fortune. If the Outlaws want that money (and they sure ‘nough do), then they'll need some time to search out that treasure while keeping the poor widow woman none the wiser…not to mention all of them other folk who've come sniffing around for the money.

179090.name: Showboat Run
179090.description:
From publisher blurb:

Showboat Run: If a racer pushes his cycle to get out in front early, it usually means he's going to lose the race. But doing just that is what the sponsors want. A racer who races like that is called (derisively) a showboater. ...The Kid's Parent was a famed Cyclon racer, but died on the track in a ball of flames. The Kid has come of age and now races the Parent's old racing seat. Yet, the Kid has been struggling with the endless expenses of Cyclon racing, and is now drowning in debt, with seemingly no way out.

And then, the sponsors come to the Kid with an offer...

179091.name: The Golden Tomb
179091.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Golden Tomb: The Bezian Empire survives on loot it prizes off the various peoples it has conquered, and one of the sources of that loot is raiding the tombs of the conquered people's ancient kings. On the far northern fringes of the Empire, the Imperial Army has latched onto a prize prisoner, one who may know the location of the burial mound of one of her tribe's greatest kings – a tomb that is rumored to be filled with riches beyond the dreams of avarice, including a famed chariot of gold.

...Now, if only the army can “convince” the prisoner to lead them to the loot.

179092.name: End of the Line
179092.description:
From publisher blurb:

End of the Line: Enough is enough. The Outlaws are getting on a bit these days, they've lost too many friends over the years to a hail of gunfire, and the Law's been doggin' them ever closer every year – they want outta the life. But they don't want to end their days coughing up their lungs in some mine or factory somewheres, neither, so they decide to quit outlawin' after making one last big score. And the big score they hit upon making is truly big: the army pay train. It's maybe the richest stash of cash any wheres in the West. But, of course, it's also the most heavily guarded.

179094.name: Death Whine
179094.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death Whine: The racing season is nearly over. Somehow, newly arrived to racing, swamped with debt, disliked by the sponsoring company and the other racers – somehow, the Kid has persevered and has nearly finished a full year of racing. Even better, the Kid has started to become a Star. Yet, as the racing season prepares to climax in the Grand Cyclon, the Kid happens to learn who it was that killed the Parent in a “racing accident” all those years ago. What's more, the murderer's identity hits all too close to home.

The Kid is entering the final race of the season. But is the Kid going to seek to win the Grand Cyclon and become a Star racer? Or is the Kid entering this race only to get revenge?

179095.name: Chariot of Gold
179095.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chariot of Gold: The Bezian Empire has been looting its conquered territories of all of their treasures for many generations now, all without too much incident. A little insurrection here, a little rebellion there, all easily put down. But local resentment has only built over the years with each incident. Until, on the far northern fringes of the Empire, the Imperial Army looted the burial mound of one of the most honored kings of that ancient land, a looting that included a sacred artifact – a chariot of gold.

So now, there is bloody revolt. And the leader of that revolt is riding a golden chariot, wrested back from the hands of the Empire. A chariot that has become a symbol of all that the Empire has done to their people over the years, and of all that they are going to do to the Empire in revenge.

179096.name: The Book and the Law
179096.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Book and the Law: The (now former) Outlaws have settled into their lives as rich folk in a settled town. They've even each become an important personage of their town, one of the movers-and-shakers. And it starts to look like this is how they're going to be whiling away their latter years.

Only, while the Law has cleaned up just about all of the old gangs of the West, a couple of young and much more violent gangs have risen up to take their place, and one of those gangs starts ridin' into the Outlaws' adopted town.

So, the Outlaws have to decide if they want to intervene. But if'n they do, they're likely to be exposed as the outlaws that they are. Which is especially true after a few of the townsfolk call in a marshal to help rid their god-fearin' town of this vile gang. However, if the Outlaws don't intervene, then the plans of this marshal seem all too likely to see the town shot to hell and back. Not to mention, all the gunplay might attract the scrutiny of the Law, which could see them exposed anyways.

Which leaves the Outlaws between a rock and a hard place.

179097.name: In Service to the Law
179097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Once, there was a famous band of outlaws who did the impossible – they ripped off the army's pay train, and then they went and disappeared afore anyone could hunt them down. Them Outlaws haven't been heard from in donkey's years, and many folk have gone and forgotten them. ...But not the Law. The Law has never forgotten 'em. And at last, after all these years, they've managed to nab themselves a member of that gang. It took a bit of “convincing”, but that former gang member has agreed to help the Forces of Law track down the rest of the old gang. So, the Forces of Law, along with the one betraying member of the gang, go on a ride to hunt down the old Outlaws at long last. Hunt 'em all down wherever they're hid.

179098.name: Apocalypse Prevention, Inc. 2nd Edition
rpgissuearticle: Indy Game Scene: Apocalypse Prevention Inc.
179098.description:
Publisher blurb:

Welcome to Apocalypse Prevention, Inc., thwarters of catastrophes, enders of end-of-world scenarios and defeaters of doomsday plans.

Join the fight to protect Earth by enlisting in API, a worldwide company whose only mission is to stop anyone or anything who wants to harm our world. Humanity doesn’t fight this battle alone, as monsters and demons have given up their lurking to serve the alongside the company. This is their home too!

Each API agent (20 playable races) is armed with the tools for the job. Some become adepts, followers of traditions teach 18 Paths of customizable magic. Some go under the knife to enhance their body with one of over 30 Cyberware implants. Some master combat training from one of 10 types of Fighting Styles. Most agents wade the waters between these three extremes, taking advantage of the almost limitless combinations of powers at their disposal.

Powered by the the Dynamic Gaming System 2.0 (DGS2.0), every mission is filled with excitement and drama, and every battle is immersive! All you need is 1d20 and an imagination to jump into the action. Includes plenty of character creation options, antagonists to battle and an in-depth view of our modern world through the eyes of Apocalypse Prevention, Inc.

179100.name: Slasher Flick: Killer Collection
179100.description:
This book collects Casting Call, Horror Island, Deleted Scenes and Special Features into one digest-sized print product.

- From Publisher Website

179101.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 3 - Automne 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Errata du Grimoire de Vision Ka 2
La Société Astronomique du Feu Purificateur
179101.description: Actualités; Projet Magister; Aides de jeu; Grimoire; Parallèles et Dèlires; Concours d’Invocation de Kabbale; Concours de Synopsis; Les Héritiers de Babel; T-shirts Nephilim; Projet Constellation; Scénario; Inspirations

179102.name: Fifth Cycle Gamescreen with The Whispering Temple
179102.description:
User summary:

Game screen. Player-facing side has an illustration on the center panel, with spell listings for the Colleges of Physical Magic and Scholarly Magic on the side panels. GM-facing side has tables for combat, magic, etc.

Comes bundled with The Whispering Temple, "A Fifth Cycle adventure for five to eight beginning characters." This is a booklet with a 9-page adventure (encounters, map, and stat blocks), a 1-page blank hexgrid for combat, two double-sided character sheets, a sheet for recording spells, a sample "Archaelogical Charter" (entitling the adventuring party to take loot provided they share it with the local Duke and perform other services), encounter sheets for tracking minor opponents, personality sheets for recording major NPCs, and two spell tree diagrams.

179103.name: Damraz's Page
179103.description:
Gork stuff handouts is a series of images created by myself that I believe could be used as handouts for your party when you want to add that extra touch of Umphf to loot or clues.

The first batch being released is a series of pages designed to look like spellbook pages or scrolls with mystic texts and diagrams. On this batch is also a book cover image and by combining the pages with the cover you could make a complete book handout.

- From Publisher's website.

179104.name: Gorash's Page
179104.description:
Gork stuff handouts is a series of images created by myself that I believe could be used as handouts for your party when you want to add that extra touch of Umphf to loot or clues.

The first batch being released is a series of pages designed to look like spellbook pages or scrolls with mystic texts and diagrams. On this batch is also a book cover image and by combining the pages with the cover you could make a complete book handout.

- From Publisher's website.

179110.name: Gork Stuff: Handouts Page 1
179110.description:
Gork stuff handouts is a series of images created by myself that I believe could be used as handouts for your party when you want to add that extra touch of Umphf to loot or clues.

The first batch being released is a series of pages designed to look like spellbook pages or scrolls with mystic texts and diagrams. On this batch is also a book cover image and by combining the pages with the cover you could make a complete book handout.

- From Publisher's website.

179111.description:
This micro game consists of just five cards: 1) Criminal; 2) Detective; 3) Witness; 4) Bystander; and 5) Suspect. It reimplements "Criminal Dance" (犯人は踊る), which is a game of deduction, bluffing, and outguessing.

Each player is dealt a card that represents his/her identity. One of the extra cards is put in the center, face down. The card in the center determines which card is the real culprit: it can be the highest numbered card or the lowest. Each player now has a chance to exchange his/her identity card with another player. This exchange is done by pointing another person (or the card in the center). If there are more than two players wanting the same card, both players simply lose his/her opportunity to exchange. If there is only one player who wants a specific card, he or she just takes it. After this exchange, everyone reveals his/her identity, and depending on the card in the center, one player is declared as the real criminal and eliminated from the game. Play continues this manner, until there is only one player remaining, who becomes the winner of the game.
179111.name: Criminal Dance Poker

179112.name: Armoured Clash
179112.description:
Armoured Clash is a game designed to recreate massed armoured battles in the alternate Victorian super science fiction world of Dystopian Wars.

Not for the faint hearted, these rules and fast and furious, allowing the very largest and most epic world changing battles from this alternate history to be brought to your gaming table.

In Armoured Clash, full brigades of gargantuan tanks perform vast advances on deep defensive lines, capture entire cities or raze towns as they wrestle across the continents of a war-torn world.

Each commander has at their disposal full regiments of steam powered armoured vehicles; all comprised of dozens of colossal iron monsters and thousands of men. These mammoth creations are supported by great zeppelins and other, more esoteric, flying machines, destructive long range artillery and anything else the finest scientific minds of the era can conjure to wage their war.

Commanders are able to customise their brigade to the task at hand and match their preferred way of fighting through their choice of battalions.

Armoured Clash is a standalone, comprehensive game, ideal for playing out the greatest land battles depicted in the Dystopian Wars history, from the entirety of the Second Battle of Waterloo as described in Storm of Steel to Operation Bear Trap featured in this book.

The rule system is suited to any style of play, from highly competitive tournament games to campaigns of linked scenarios between friends.

Prepare your forces, make your battleplan, and ready yourself for the Armoured Clash!

179113.name: Woerdens Familiespel
179113.description: A variant to the classic Monopoly game. In honour of the city Woerden in the Netherlands.

179114.name: Businessgame Utrecht
179114.description: Play on the citymap, try to start your companies in the city. But the competitions shows no mercy. Every player try's to get there imperium as close to the city center as possible, but the room is limited. Who does the least concessions and becomes the best business man in town.

179116.name: A Grog's Life: Love, Loss, and Secrets in the Covenant's Shadow
179116.description:
From the Score:

Nasty, Brutish, and Short


grog: Strictly, a warrior or guardian employed by a covenant of wizards for protection from mortal or mundane threats. Practically, various servants and assistants at the lowest level of import on the covenant grounds. They are known for their mortality.


Amid the magic of medieval Mythic Europe, where shadows run deep and profound mysteries lure even the greatest wizards into danger, you are the line of defense between mortal perils and the magi. Your body - and perhaps your courage, training, and steel, but definitely your body - is meant to keep the swords and arrows and fangs of the world from breaking the flesh or concentration of your wizardly betters. While the most prestigious among you may carry shields to protect the magi from harm, some of you protect them from cold and hunger and the schemes of the mortal world outside the covenant.

A covenant is like an abbey for a community of wizards. It's made up of masters and apprentices, books and laboratories, and includes all the servants and staff that keep the place in order. Like you. Your covenant dwells in something like a hidden castle in the countryside, near a village and a more traditional, martial castle.

The world, out there, teems with wolves and monsters and fay tricks and angry rivals and suspicious priests. Wizards dare to learn about magic and the world despite all the risks to life and limb - your life and your limbs.

The common folk don't trust wizards. Anyone who's not a wizard is probably common folk. You're common folk. But you count on wizards for food and shelter and a purpose in life.

Right?

179117.name: A Covenant on Fire: Diabolism, Jealousy, and Revenge in Mythic Europe
179117.description:
From the Score:

The Fires of Reason

The wizards of Mythic Europe dare to seek knowledge and wisdom in a perilous medieval world that wants them dead. The Church, the laity, the fay, and Hell itself seek to snuff out or abuse the magic of the Order of Hermes - the order of wizards to which you belong. For sanctuary against these threats, wizards gather together in castle-like covenants to study, experiment, and strive for a better world. Think of them as collegiate communities, castles of wisdom fortified against the world without.

Your covenant, Mistle Lake, failed at the wisdom part and burned down. Only one wizard survived - a young man called Veritius - and he lays dying in a nearby abbey. Now the local church’s Inquisitor has come calling for answers from that lone soul whose testimony might shed light on the affairs of the covenant. So Veritius tells the Inquisitor the tale - or, at least, a version of the tale - of the covenant's downfall. He may be delirious, vengeful, hopeful, seeking absolution, or looking to cover someone's tracks.

We hear Veritius' tale from his sickbed, safe in a monastery, as he relates it to the Inquisitor. See the next pages for ways this wrinkles play to create a unique fiasco.

This fiasco is all about hindsight, perspective, and the nature of truth in a sordid world of zealotry and heresy. Also, lies.

179118.name: Obedience
179118.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powered Armor and Vigilantes!

Mecha Combat in a Dystopian Future!

The Ultrapolis: The Ultrapolis is a city that dwarfs all other cities ever to exist. Not everyone who works in the Ultrapolis lives in the Ultrapolis, though.
