Many live just outside the Ultrapolis, in the Sticks. The Sticks has largely been abandoned by the Powers that Be. Police and rescue departments never much even enter the Sticks anymore. And that is where the Vigilantes step in, filling the void that the absence of the authorities has left, standing the line against crime and chaos through sheer force of will. That, and all of the mecha technology that a secret wealthy benefactor can buy.

Obedience: A hacker has taken over several industrial robotic builder vehicles and is visiting destruction upon the Sticks. Dozens have already been killed, and the body count is climbing fast. The local authorities have no ability to stop these robots, and the authorities of the Ultrapolis couldn't care less what happens to a few blocks in the Sticks. Thus, the only ones with the power and the will to stop these robots are the Vigilantes.

...But, is the newly formed team ready for such a challenge?

179119.name: For the Emperor
179119.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroism and Glory!

Last Stands: The Adventures of the Last Stands do NOT share a common story. The only thing that they have in common is that someone somewhere is making a final stand. These are epic adventures of individuals who are sacrificing themselves for a cause greater than them. Few will survive, maybe none. But whether they survive or not, these individuals will become legends.

For the Emperor: On the eve of victory over the barbarian horde, the Emperor is betrayed, attacked by those sworn to protect him. Only a few of the Imperial Guard remain loyal. Those few, surrounded on all sides by traitors, must fight to secure the imperial family. Somehow, at least one of the imperial family must survive this woeful day. These loyal few will ensure that this happens, though it cost them their lives.

179120.name: Falling to Ruin
179120.description:
From publisher blurb:

A few dozen stalwart souls stand at the edge of the ruin of Haggard Keep. Ahead lies the horde of the Fen Hag, their pennons and campfires and fell magics filling the entirety of the valley below. Behind are the refugees, the last people of the kingdom who are not already enslaved by the Hag, fleeing for their lives. All that stands between that army and the refugees is these sorry few. There's no one else left. It is a death sentence, of course. None of them are coming out of this alive. But they are the only chance that the refugees have. They need to give the refugees time. Time enough to escape. And they will buy that time with their very lives.

179121.name: Against the Ancients
179121.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Ancients – creatures of incredible and wondrous power. The war against the Ancients in nigh unto being lost. The elder races are fallen, their last remnants put to full flight. The human civilization is nearly crushed. And now, the Ancients approach Durin, the last defense that humanity has to offer. The remnants of the elder races have joined the humans there, to put forth one final stand against the might of the Ancients.

179122.name: Homogeny
179122.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some of the sons and daughters of the ultra-rich have been acting strangely, prone to public outbursts and irrational behavior. All such events have been hushed up neatly, both in the public and in the press, to the point where few even know that anything unusual has occurred. Yet, that only serves to leave everyone unprepared for the moment when the first of these favored sons and daughters loses whatever tenuous hold they had upon reality, sending them over the edge into a violent, psychotic rage. A violence that their gene-sculpted and heavily augmented bodies quickly turns all too deadly. The local authorities are too ill-equipped to handle such heavily augmented individuals. Which means it is up to the Vigilantes to stop these rampaging monsters.

179123.name: Conformity
179123.description:
From publisher blurb:

Identity

Warning: They are Watching.

So reads the latest tag showing up on walls, vehicles, and hacked computers all over the city. No one thinks much of it, and the tags soon get lost amidst the constant noise of the Ultrapolis. But, Identity soon goes beyond simple tagging. Their demand: all monitoring devices by the government and corporations will be turned off permanently, or there will be consequences. And then they demonstrate their power as hundreds of banks are robbed simultaneously all across the Sticks. The local authorities are unprepared to handle such a large-scale threat to the banking system, much less hunt down the hackers who caused it to happen. If the hackers are to be hunted down and stopped, it will be up to the Vigilantes to do it.

179124.name: Air Alliance
179124.description:
You are the owner of an airline company flying all over the world.
You carry the world's passengers, flying from airport to airport with the airplanes of your own company.
You can get many landing rights at the airports at the ECONOMY CLASS.
Though the action is slower, you can get higher points in the FIRST CLASS.
It is a chance to show your skill to operate the airplanes efficiently and find the best cruising course based on the changing PASSENGER CARDS at the baggage claim!
However, your company does not offer service at every airport. To outsmart your rivals and to best satisfy your passengers, it is going to be necessary to apply a code sharing system with other airlines or alliances.

In Air Alliance übernehmen die Spieler die Rolle des Managements einer Fluggesellschaft und schicken Flugzeuge und Passagiere um die Welt. Dabei müssen die Spieler abwägen zwischen der Economy-Class, die es leichter macht eine Landeerlaubnis zu erhalten und der First-Class, die zwar viele Punkte bringt, aber unflexibel ist.
Auch das Gepäck der vielen Passagierkarten muss geschickt organisiert und Transportiert werden.
Nur wer dies alles geschickt handhabt, hat das Zeug zum Topmanager!
Allerdings besitzt die eigene Fluggesellschaft alleine nicht alle Flughäfen. Um die Konkurrenz zu überholen und die meisten Passagiere um die Welt zu befördern, muss man Codesharing betreiben und Allianzen gründen. Eine Air Alliance.

Vous êtes le propriétaire d’une compagnie aérienne internationale. Vos avions emmènent des voyageurs d’aéroport en aéroport, partout dans le monde. Déciderez-vous de miser sur la classe économique, ouverte à tous les aéroports, ou sur la première classe, certes plus délicate à bien faire fonctionner, mais tellement plus gratifiante ?

MOVIE : https://youtu.be/m1kmePK7jSw

179125.name: Luck of the Blue
179125.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chariot Racing and Intrigue!

Win the Brass Ring

The Roman Coliseum: There are four chariot racing teams that run the arena – the Red, the Blue, the Green, and the Purple. Those who race the arenas are owned by the coliseum, bought and paid for. The only ways out are death, old age, or, once in a great while, being awarded the brass ring – the ring of freedom. Win enough races, and you too might win that brass ring. ... At least, that's what the overseer says the morning of every race. But nothing in the coliseum is ever so simple.

The Luck of the Blues: The Blues have a lot of luck – all of it bad. Only, a lot of that ill luck has to do with the fact that the Emperor favors the Greens, and his manner of favoring the Greens is to insist that the Greens always win. The Greens have won every race in every coliseum in the Empire for years now. Which means only the Greens have a chance of winning their freedom. It is enough to drive a racer mad...and it has done just that. One of the Blues is about to rebel, and try to win. He is going to do it, even if it ends in the Emperor ordering the death of all the Blues of that arena (which is what the Emperor did to the last team to beat the Greens).

179126.name: Green with Envy
179126.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Emperor of Rome has long insisted that his favored team – the Greens – wins every race in every coliseum all across the Empire. However, political troubles have turned the Emperor's eye away from the more distant coliseums, and a few honest races have since been run in distant parts of the Empire. And with honest races, it happened: for the first time in many years at the coliseum of Alexandria, the Greens lost a race. Of course, the Greens did not take the sudden change in their fortunes well, and they have sent to Rome for one of their most famous racers, bringing him in to put these Blues back down in their place.

179127.name: Jupiter
179127.description:
From publisher blurb:

You thought to enslave mortals? To betray the gods, and your family? NO, Hecate, your reign of evil ends now!" Jupiter (PL 11) is a powerful goddess who was raised by a mortal human family when she wandered out of a woodlands with no memory. It was only when struck by lightning that she discovered the truth, that the gods had been betrayed by Hecate, and many were still lost, and only Jupiter could save them! Seeking to use her power to do good, and burdened with the duty to save her people, Jupiter serves as one of the strongest of heroes, the Goddess who bears the Thunderbolt of Zeus!

179129.name: Gunslinger
179129.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject – is about the Gunslinger, the wielder of the strange and wonderful weapons known as guns.

The feats inside this volume:

Gritty Aim - Grit can make it easier to bypass some armor
Gritty Experience - Having grit now make you a bit more effective in many areas
Gritty Nimbleness - The gunslingers grit now makes it easier to dodge
Gritty Wisdom - Hard learned lessons add to the Gunslingers grit
Improved Damage - Minimum damage from your weapon is now increased
Improved Repair Costs - It's now cheaper to repair that weapon of yours
Improved Targeting - Increase the odd of getting a good result when targeting

179130.name: "L" is for "Lost Worlds"
179130.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore Lost Worlds

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at various "lost worlds" and fantastic settings in superhero worlds, including a series of tables for randomly creating lost world settings for your Icons adventures, including:

Locations from Hidden in Plain Sight to Underwater or Underground
Contents from Hazards to Treasure and Weirdness
Inhabitants from Aliens to Dinosaurs and more
What conceals the lost world, and what causes it




Endless potential lost worlds of adventure await!

179131.name: "K" is for "Knacks"
179131.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Knack for Getting the Job Done

This entry in the Icons A to Z series looks at the option of expanding the game's attributes with knacks, minor special abilities in-between specialties and powers. It includes:

A look at knacks and how to create them, including how to incorporate them into Icons hero creation.
Over two dozen sample knacks, from Animal Empathy to Whirlwind Attack!
Knacks and Qualities
Using knacks as stunts
Using knacks to create "genre rules" for an Icons series.

179132.name: Old School Ranger (Ranger Archetype)
179132.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another new Old School archetype. This issue focuses a new archetype for the ranger, taking it back to its roots. Although some of the new iconic ranger abilities are not touched, some were rolled back and built upon the original concepts found in previous gaming editions. Two new feats are also included.

179133.name: Planetouched Feats IV
179133.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planetouched Feats IV brings you 11 mythic feats for your planetouched paragons of mysteriously blended ancestry, from the tainted tieflings to the shadowy fetchlings and the jann-blooded suli! Unleash your planetouched power with feats from Shadow Walker to Grasping Tail and Gloom Sight to Armor of the Pit!

179135.name: The Necessary Conditions for John H. Watson
179135.description:
In ワトソンの条件 ("The Necessary Conditions for John H. Watson"), the players are assistants to a famous Victorian era detective, searching out clues in order to capture criminals.

In this anime-styled worker placement game, there are two phases, the plot and action phases. In the plot phase, players place their action tokens one at a time clockwise then counterclockwise. In the action phase, tokens are moved to one of two actions adjacent to the token, possibly taking the action from others. Players will collect clues and money to let gain renown or discover keys, which allow them to catch one of the three criminals at large.

The game is over when someone has caught the mastermind, or after 10 rounds. The player with the most renown wins!

179136.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 4 - 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Concours de synopsis: Les Codex des Mondes Cybergnostiques
179136.description: Actualités et rumeurs; Dossier Babel; Parallèles et délires; Grimoire; Concours; Aide de jeu; Scénario; Projet Contellation; Goodies; Les Héritiers de Babel; Cartes de Kabbale

179137.name: Flea Market: Three for the Road
boardgamecompilation: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #18
179137.description:
"It's not easy being three"

Setup:
Place the Three for the Road token by the board.

Gameplay:
If at any point you are the first player to control three sequentially numbered items you win the token. This token can't be cashed in or removed in any way.

Game End:
The game ends immediately when any player reaches $45. This token is worth $7, so if you ever have this token and $38 or more, you win.

179138.name: Dice of Destiny
179138.description:
Dice of Destiny is an extraordinary, intense and fun board game for 2 to 6 players. The race is going on incredible diverse terrain with many obstacles. Among them are a waterfall that you can fall in, an angry bees, quicksands that you can stuck and many others.

There are six characters and at the beginning of the game each player can choose one of them. The characters have special skills that affect the gameplay - increase pickpocketed gold, allows you to push other players back or just helps you to run faster.

Throwing the Dice of Destiny, which is 12D with different special symbol on every side, affects the other dice values and defines which and how many of them will be thrown. The special symbols on the Dice of Destiny can give useful opportunities for the player. Additionally there are 6D dice - a wooden ones that are for moving and a golden ones for earning gold.

The goal of every player is to collect and keep big fortune and finish the race before anyone else. Roll The Dicе of Destiny to see what expects you in the next throwing.

The combination of unique characters, the result from the Dice of Destiny and the variety of the map obstacles makes the game extremely fun for young and not that young players.

179139.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 5 - 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Un peu plus près de la Lune
179139.description: Un peu plus près de la Lune; La Quête des Simulacres Imparfaits; Les Effets-Dragon; L’Histoire de l’Orichalque; Tutelle; Le Golem sur le Seuil; Rouhei Kouzar; Inspis

179140.name: Der Schattenmarschall
179140.description:
[from the back of the book]
Mendena has fallen, Tobrien belongs to the Empire again. But what was the price for this victory? In the hour of Rohaja's triumph duke Helme Haffax reveals himself in Perricum and announces that he had taken the fortified city.

But what plans cherishes the brilliant strategist? Why is he in the proximity of Rondras main temple and the sword of swordslooking for, being the carrier of Belhalhar's splinter?

While all sides battle through the streets of the port city, the heroes must win as much information as possible. Because soon it becomes clear: Perricum was just the beginning! Soon Haffax' troops back off to the the west and start the long and bloody march toward the capital. It is left for your heroes to reveal the true motivation of the shadow marshal and to oppose the duke and his allies, when it comes to nothing less than the fate of the Middle Empire.

The Shadow Marshal is the final volume of the two-part campaign to the former arch marshal, duke Helme Haffax, which began in Die verlorenen Lande. It's all or nothing - for the duke, the Empress, the empire and, not least, for your heroes.

179142.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 6 - 2004)
179142.description:
User summary:

L’histoire des sciences obscures; La Pavane des Eléments; L’Allomorphose; Royaume Selenim à Gunkanjima; Les Semeurs de Givre; Le fruit de Jade; Concours Plan subtil: Horror Show (scenario)

179144.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 7 - 2004)
rpgissuearticle: L'Amérique du Sud - Quête de la Chaîne d'Or
179144.description:
User summary:

Histoire invisible; Ocnantapen; Quête de la Chaîne d’Or; Revelation Now; Yoga; Ville occulte; Et In Agartha ego

179145.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 8)
179145.description:
Special scenario edition

Les Ombres de la Chimère; Le tableau du Maître flamand; Odeur de sainteté; Chartres, ville occulte; Virgo Pariturae

179146.name: Silicone-2
179146.description:
User Summary

There is an uprising of robots that the player will have to quell.

179147.name: Vision-Ka (Issue 9 - Sep 2010)
179147.description:
User summary:

Vision-Ka returns for a final issue after a multi-year hiatus, with a new rédacteur en chef.

Mètis; Histoire de l’Alchimie; Alchimie Révélation; Focus d’Alchimie; Spagyrie; Arkhémia; Projet Exode sidéral

179148.name: Martial Law
179148.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A survival game with choices.

179149.name: Scott Joplin Melody Dicer: The Music Making Game
179149.description:
Compose ragtime music by rolling two dice, one small, one large. The number on each dice corresponds to a musical card (cards that have a few musical notes on them).

When five sets of two cards are laid out they can be played like sheet music by anyone with a piano, organ, guitar, woodwind, brass, or string instrument. Instruments not included!

Players can then select the best composition among all the songs created.

179150.name: Bloody Message
179150.description:
Gork stuff handouts is a series of images created by myself that I believe could be used as handouts for your party when you want to add that extra touch of Umphf to loot or clues.

The first batch being released is a series of pages designed to look like spellbook pages or scrolls with mystic texts and diagrams. On this batch is also a book cover image and by combining the pages with the cover you could make a complete book handout.

- From Publisher's website.

179152.name: The Carven
179152.description:
From publisher blurb:

You were formed long ago by a legendary wizard. Now your race has come into its own, and some travel the world in search of adventure. You are one of those travelers. You hope to gain knowledge, martial skill, and perhaps some magic items to bring back to benefit your people. You’ve also become intensely curious about the natural-born races, so you seek out their friendship along the way.

This supplement allows your players to play a Carven, a wooden race much like robots. Inside you’ll find:

A full character class description (including new special abilities), for use with old-school games including LABRYRINTH LORD
Helpful charts to take your Carven from level 1 to level 10
Suggestions for incorporating Carven into your campaign
Pregenerated characters at first and third level. Just print and play (or use them as NPC’s)

179153.name: Gambler
179153.description:
From publisher blurb:

KNOW WHEN TO HOLD ‘EM

Cards, dice, games with little fantasy figures. You live for them. Nothing sets your heart racing like the chance to earn some quick gold pieces. Along the way you’ve learned a lot about reading people, conning people, and sneaking away from a bad deal or two.

Or seven.

Lately you’ve heard there are even greater challenges to be had adventuring. How can you resist seeking out this new source of thrills (and income)?

Inside you’ll find:

A full character class description (including new special abilities), for use with Old-School (OSR) games including LABRYRINTH LORD
Helpful charts to take your Gambler from level 1 to level 14
Suggestions for incorporating Gamblers into your campaign
Pregenerated characters at first and third level. Just print and play (or use them as NPC’s)

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
179154.name: Feast of the Preserver
179154.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feast of the Preserver is a survival horror adventure designed for a group of 5 to 8 characters of levels 3 to 4.

“Welcome traveller to the quaint village of Barrowton. You’ve arrived just in time for the annual Endfast Feast!”

Something is amiss in the isolated village of Barrowton. Only courage, skill and a lot of luck can aid the adventurers in facing the horror that has taken hold of this once idyllic place. Can the adventurers save the village from a terrible fate or will they become the Feast of the Preserver?

Features:

Mystery and excitement compatible with Goodman Games Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG but easily converted to other systems
40 pages of blood chilling suspence and horror
Beautifully rendered isometric maps by Brian Van Hunsel
New evil magic to destroy or be destroyed by

179155.name: Naval Resupply Yard
179155.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a Naval Yard, designed to resupply small capital ships with persihables and ammunition.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

179156.name: Dreams In The Tunnels
179156.description:
From publisher blurb:

2007. The Olympics will be arriving in the ancient city of Beijing in a year’s time. In the meantime there is a legion of administrators, workers, corporations and government officials working to make the city presentable before the flocks of tourists descend. One of the most ambitious projects, spanning the last 6 years, has been the expansion of the oldest subway system in Asia.

A tower block collapses after a subway tunnel is dug through several danger zones that should never have been approved. All the official connections check out but there are complaints among the workforce of blackouts, strange dreams and migraines. Strange radio frequencies have been recorded throughout the city around the time of the accident. Somewhere in the newly built tunnels an old dreamer has made its nest. Through its subtle influences it aims to construct a great glyph beneath the city but until then it sleeps. Unlike those whose dreams it visits...

This scenario is ideal for 2-5 investigators and is set in modern day Beijing. The scenario is system free, though guidance is provided on running all characters and encounters. The adventure focuses on player interaction and puzzle solving and should be enjoyable for any group looking for an investigative game, especially as a one-shot.

Recommended Systems: Any system designed to emulate a real-world/urban fantasy setting should be able to run this scenario with few issues. Atlas Games' Unknown Armies, White Wolf's World of Darkness and Chaosium's Call of Cthulhu all work well and Pelgrane Press' GUMSHOE system would work to emphasise the investigative elements.

Content Warnings: Due to the nature of Horror games, this product contains discussion of hallucinations and body horror.

179157.name: Umbra
179157.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash the fury of the umbra base class upon your foes (or upon your players). The umbra is a master of shadows, able to call upon powerful spell-like abilities called shadowmancies to obfuscate himself and confound his foes. The umbra can zero in on an enemies’ shadow and sunder it, causing horrendous wounds upon his target. With his shadowball ability, the umbra can conjure shadows into a ball of pure energy to strike his foes.

Enemies beware, for an umbra hides in every shadow.

A new base class brought to you by ARMR Studios. Included in this book are feats to compliment the vindicator base class, as well as favored class options.

179158.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Hero Box 1
179158.description:
5 new Survivors to add to your zombie-killing party (including their miniatures and ID cards), and 2 more plastic dashboards, each with 8 colored plastic trackers and color base, allowing you to add two more players to your game!

Heroes include:
Glynda Battlestout
Julian
Sylvia Samedi
Tucker
Arnaud

179160.description:
The Game of 8 Ball, Cards & Beer!
Welcome to Side Pocket Pool! Enter the Side Pocket pub, grab a drink and rack'em-up for a game of 8 ball.

Balls!
Play with a full set of 16 plastic pool balls with seven reds, seven yellows, the black ball and the white cue ball.

Cues!
Yes two of the finest cues are provided for players. They just happen to be playing card size!

Tables!
The games box doubles as a 3D pool table. Three extra 2D pool tables are also included:- there is a green, a blue and a training table.

Cards!
A five card hand containing reds, yellows and white balls of varying power which can be played on their own or combined to create shots.

Players!
Play One vs One, team up for Two vs Two or even One vs Two.

Frames!
Enough beer is provided to play the best of 3, 5 and 7 frames. The winner of each frame wins a Beer card.

The player with the most beers wins! Enjoy your stay in the Side Pocket pub!
179160.name: Side Pocket Pool

179161.name: Variant Rules
179161.description:
From the Introduction:

For this month's Unearthed Arcana, we're showing off a few variant rules that you can use in your campaigns. A few of these options should look familiar to players of earlier editions of the D&D game, as some have been presented as variants in those prior editions.

179163.name: Dragon Warriors Players Guide
179163.description:
From the publisher:

RETURN TO LEGEND

Are you a roguish knave who has pilfered this book and even now crouches in some dark alleyway, wondering where best to fence such a rare treasure?

Or are you a wily hunter who braved some monster-haunted underworld in the wild woods, and found this very book in a chest of buried treasure?

Or perhaps you are a devout priest, in which case you are doubtless hastening to the nearest fire to consign this book to the flames, for you have peeked within and seen the wealth of lore concerning sorcery and demonology!

The Players Guide to Dragon Warriors contains these three new professions and much more besides! Inside, you’ll find treasures including:


Organizations and sworn fellowships
A miscellanea of essays on Living in Legend
Secrets of arcane lore
New secondary skills, weapons and armours
Demons! Demons! Horrible demons!
Better yet, spells to contain and banish demons!


This book is designed for use with the Dragon Warriors roleplaying game.

179164.name: The Archmage's Octavo (Issue 1 - July 2014)
179164.description:
User summary:

Dravid's Tower, magical research, etc.

Published 2-up, landscape layout, pages 2 blank, issue pagination starts at 1 on PDF page 3

179165.name: The Archmage's Octavo (Issue 2 - Jul 2014)
179165.description:
User summary:

Keroth's Bridge (aka The Jester's Mud Pie) - a Swords & Wizardry adventure for 5th-7th level characters

Published 2-up in landscape; 12 pages on 6 PDF pages

179166.name: Shadowfist: Netherworld
179166.description:
Netherworld was the first expansion to Shadowfist. This booster-only set included cards from the first five factions and also fleshed out the Monarchs and Jammers, though they would remain the less well-rounded of the seven. These cards also bear the gold foil Ting Ting logo.

The set contains 136 total cards. 46 rares, 40 uncommons, 48 commons.

Each pack has contains 12 random cards which include 1 rare, 3 uncommon, and 8 common.

179167.name: Lost Idols
179167.description:
Hello and welcome to Lost Idols! In this fast-paced collecting card game, you are one of several hunters looking for the Lost Idols of Tiki Island. The first person to collect all six wins. Good luck and happy hunting!

Each player starts with the same six-card hand. One each of numbers 1-6. The remaining cards, including the Wild Card, are shuffled and placed face down as the draw deck.

At the beginning of each round, each player chooses a card to play. When a player has chosen, they will place that card face down in front of them to show the other players they are ready. Once all players have chosen a card to play, each player flips their card over to reveal what they have chosen. Highest card wins the round. When players reveal their hand, the winner keeps their card face up in front of them. The remaining cards go into the discard pile. At the end of each round, all players draw another card from the draw pile so everyone has six cards in their hands at the beginning of each round. When there are no more available cards in the draw pile, reshuffle the discard pile and use as the new draw pile.

Sound easy? Not so fast!

There are some special rules when playing the game.


Number 1 card always beats a Number 6.
A number 3 card gives you the ability to choose to keep your number 3 card or trade for your opponents 1 or 2 card.
Wild card always wins the round and can be played as any number of players choosing.
If two or more players play the same number card, they cancel each other out. If there are only 2 players, neither player wins and the next round is played.

179168.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Marc Simonetti. The survivors include:
Cadence
Antha the Witch
Redcap Rodney
Lady Grimm

Marc Simonetti (born in 1977 in France) is a French concept artist/ illustrator. 

Best known for his work on GRR Martin's books "A song of Ice and Fire", and his Iron throne, he's also illustrated some of the most well known fantasy and SciFi novels, such as the Discworld by Terry Pratchett, The Royal Assassin trilogy by Robin Hobb, or Terry Goodkind's "Sword of truth", or Frank Herbert... 

He's also worked for many video games companies such as Activision, ubisoft, EA, Square Enix and King Isle Entertainment. He's also worked for long feature films for europacorp, nwave.... He's just released an art book "coverama", and is currently working on several projects such as long feature movies, and doing some concept art for video games, as a freelancer.
179168.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Marc Simonetti

179169.name: Time Hunters
179169.description:
The Time Hunters is a planar organisation endorsed by all the known pantheons, they are the first and last line of defense against the abuse of the time flow. In this book Tiny Gork explains how the Time Hunters is structured and what their function is in the multiverse. Also included in this book is a class description for Time Hunters.

- From Publisher website.

179170.name: Galens Gamble
179170.description:
Galens Gamble is a short adventure built around 5 encounter ideas, your party is to assist a Time Hunter named Thyrgion in preventing a mercenary band from killing a priest. This priest is destined to sacrifice his own life in order to banish a Demon Lord who is being summoned by a secret cult of worshippers. By martyring himself he is supposed to transcend to become a Demigod, this is supposed to happen in the regular timeflow, but someone wants the mercenaries to kill him and allow the Demon Lord to enter the mortal realm.

Inside Galens Gamble you will find:
•An introductory overview of the adventure.
•A flowchart of the adventure.
•A systemless story adventure taking place in a rural region close to a big mountain range.
•A chapter dedicated to studying potential loose ends following up on the Aftermath of the story.
What would happen if the Demon Lord was not banished and what happens if he is?How would the Mercenaries and Assassin regard the heroes when all is set and done?How could this all be tied in with the Shadow Council story ?•A short intro to a mercenary band called the Howlers.
•A short intro to a secret cult named “The Order of the Rotten Diamond”
•The Time Hunter systemless character class, complete with duties, role, ideas to skills, feats/talents and spells.

- From Publisher website.

179171.name: Gork Stuff: Sketches #1
179171.description:
I hope people will find a use for these sketches/drawings, they served me as a player and game master and I hope they will serve others in the future. I have more sketches and drawings I wish to share in future…

- From Publisher website.

179172.description:
Build the city’s greatest theme park, whatever it takes!

Mix your favourite themes, from Pirate, Robot, Vampire, Jungle, Ninja, and Gangster. Build attractions and upgrade them to match blueprints, stack up towering rides, or simply make the most cash.

But watch out - your competitors may pay off the safety inspectors to close your rides or hire hooligans to vandalise your park! How will you get revenge?

Whatever happens, it’s bound to be Unfair.


Over the course of 8 rounds, you play Event cards to help yourself and hinder your opponents, build Attractions and Upgrades using Park cards, and match your park to Blueprints.

Your goal is to build the highest-scoring park at game end, using three main ways to score:

building your park to match Blueprints
building impressively tall Attractions with lots of Upgrades
buying your way to victory with good old fashioned cash




You might hire staff to help you, or build a Super Attraction with a unique ability. Bribing officials and blackmailing politicians is also possible, but entirely optional.
179172.name: Unfair
boardgamepodcastepisode: #26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
#27: The Networks review, Friday on-tap; The Beer Traveler: Asheville
16 Devon Dice Podcast Scythe summer nights
Best Games of BGG.con
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 025 – Gen Con 2016
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 027 – End of Year One
Episode 95- RobbCon 2017
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 130
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 142

179173.name: Princess Debut
179173.description:
From the back of the box:

Step into the shoes of the princess of a magical kingdom!

Can you master your dance moves and find true love?

Waltz into the crazy and often hilarious life of royalty in this romantic dance adventure! You have 30 days to get ready for the big ball. Woo one of six charming princes to be your partner, then take your date out on the dance floor! Use the Touch Screen to guide your character gracefully across the dance floor while matching your partner's rhythm. Do you have what it takes to win one of the prince's hearts?

179174.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Boundless Hate
179174.description:
Description from the publisher:

“Your shrines will burn, your streets run with blood, your false idols shattered, your people slaughtered by the thousands, your very planet torn apart… and the barest fraction of my hatred will be satisfied.”
–Ba’ar Zul the Hate-Bound

The legions of Chaos pour forth from the Kaerux Erameas in Boundless Hate, the second War Pack in the Planetfall cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest! As part of the Planetfall cycle, this War Pack gives new meaning to the type symbols on each planet. Your armies will fight harder than you thought possible when you battle on a planet with symbols that align with your faction’s goals.

Of course, in addition to a new focus on the planets of the Traxis sector, this expansion offers new cards to swell every faction’s armies, including the Tyranids faction introduced in The Great Devourer. A new Chaos warlord invites you to fight for the glory of Khorne, while a Dark Eldar archon warlord allows you to capture slaves from key planets. Spread war across the Traxis sector with the Boundless Hate War Pack!

179175.description:
From the publisher's website:

Drain your enemies’ strength with Heralds of Dreadfall, an Army Pack expansion for BattleLore Second Edition. The Undead faction grows as mighty Death Knights, disembodied Wraiths, and a flying Barrow Wyrm join the Reanimates and Skeleton Archers to wage war against the living. A Plagueland hex and new Blight mechanic weaken your enemies, while a complete twenty-card lore deck provides you with an arsenal of cunning tactical tools. Use two army cards featured in Heralds of Dreadfall to deploy powerful armies or invent others designed for your strengths as a commander– everything you need to field a terrifying Undead army is included. You can also combine the units of Heralds of Dreadfall with those of Terrors of the Mists to muster Undead armies beyond your foes’ imaginations.

Heralds of Dreadfall contains:

Thirty-seven sculpted plastic figures representing five different Undead units
9 Reanimates
12 Skeleton Archer
9 Death Knights
6 Wraiths
1 Barrow Wyrm

Everything necessary to send these units into battle
Two army cards suggesting complete fifty-point Undead armies
A deck of twenty lore cards focused on the Heralds of Dreadfall units
Six scenario cards and four terrain tiles to transform the landscape of the battlefield
179175.name: BattleLore (Second Edition): Heralds of Dreadfall Army Pack

179176.description:
Description from the publisher:

Command the Undead with the Terrors of the Mists Army Pack expansion for BattleLore Second Edition. Terrors of the Mists introduces a new faction to this game of brutal fantastical combat, with five Undead units taking up arms against the living. Diabolical Necromancers command legions of Bone Horrors and Reanimates, while charging Barghests and a horrifying Banshee terrorize your foes. This Army Pack contains everything necessary to deploy an army of Undead, including graveyard terrain tiles, new scenario cards, and a complete lore deck full of horrifying tactical surprises.

With the units of Terrors of the Mists, you can muster the two armies suggested by the included army cards, or devise armies specifically suited to the battle at hand. You can also combine these units with those of Heralds of Dreadfall for innovative and unique Undead deployments.

Terrors of the Mists includes:

Five Undead unit types with thirty-seven sculpted plastic figures
9 Reanimates
12 Bone Horror
9 Necromancer
6 Barghest
1 Banshee

Everything necessary to send an Undead army into battle
Two army cards suggesting specialized, fifty-point armies
A complete deck of twenty lore cards enhancing the abilities of Undead units
Six scenario cards and three terrain tiles to transform the landscape of the battlefield
179176.name: BattleLore (Second Edition):  Terrors of the Mists Army Pack

179177.name: Luxembourg-Shopping
179177.description:
Promotional Monopoly-style game featuring shops and services of Luxembourg. Instead of houses and hotels, there are card board markers which increase the rent to be paid. If you roll doubles, you draw 2 cards. If at least one of them mentions a business (Monopoly: street) you already own, you are entitled to add the marker.

If you land on an own business, you can create a "shopping center" by placing 3 of your owner cards (your choice!) together and paying the base rent of each.
If you land on an own business, you may merge 2 of your own shopping centers by placing the cards together and paying each shopping center's value.

If you land on another player's business, you must pay the rent. If the business is part of a shopping center, you must pay for all cards belonging to that shopping center.

If you land on an own business, you receive the "rent" from the bank.

You win if you own a certain number of markers, if your largest shopping center consist of a ceertain number of businesses or if all other players are bankrupt.
You can decide to stop the game after an agreed time. The player with the most markeers wins. There are 4 tie breakers mentioned.

179178.description:
The Peloponnes Box contains all previously published expansions for Peloponnes along with the brand new "Victoria" expansion. The components in the Peloponnes Box allow up to three more players to join the game, meaning that you can play Peloponnes with up to eight players.

The new Victoria expansion allows each player to purchase one additional tile during the game.

Note: the base game is required to use the Peloponnes Box!
179178.name: Peloponnes Box

179179.description:
Tingo Tengo Ecuador is a set collecting and memory card game. The aim of the game is to collect the majority of the four-card sets of fourteen cities of Ecuador.

The game is played in two phases: in the first phase the players try to guess which other players have the cities they are dealt at the beginning (with a correct guess the player receives the card; with a wrong guess the turn goes to the next player); in the second phase the players try to remember which four-card sets the other players have collected in order to steal the cards fro the other players. The first player to get all four-card sets is the winner.
179179.name: Tingo Tengo Ecuador

179180.description:
101.1 is the first expansion set for One Zero One - a fast-playing but highly tactical card game set in the world of 1980s computing.

101.1 adds new command cards to add to the One Zero One base game. These cards can be interchanged with other command sets or simply added to the base game for a larger experience.

In summary, these cards are:

- END & CONT: (4 cards) Playing an END card disallows players from playing future cards to a program row! Playing CONT re-opens a locked row!
- GOSUB: (4 cards) A card alongside a GOSUB command can be moved to any row with at least three cards in it by the active player!
- GET: (2 cards) Playing your GET card allows you to take and flip a card from your opponent's hand, adding it to yours!
- NEXT: (2 cards) After playing a NEXT card, your opponent must play their next card to the program display alongside the card you just played!

The expansion pack also includes:

- The CPU: (1 card) This card serves to run the CPU of the game, allowing players to play One Zero One solo!
- 60: (1x 60 card, 1x control card) Now you can extend the length of your program and put even more points up for grabs!
- 2x player aid cards

179182.description:
In a mystical land, far away from here, two prestigious martial arts tournament have been held since the ancient times: the White Lotus Tournament and the Black Lotus Tournament. These two tournaments are the most important show of legendary martial arts used by powerful athletes. Extraordinary masters are always looking for new talented athletes that will be forged into the ideal of the Perfect Warrior by exhausting training and life experiences that will fortify body, mind and soul.

"Dojo Kun" means "Dojo Rules" and is a set of principles that guide the physical and spiritual development of the martial art practitioners. Dojo Kun is a game in which each player heads one of the four dojo (Tiger, Crane, Bear, Cobra). The main goal is to train your athletes and attract new ones, buy new training machines, expand your dojo, find adventures, and eventually lead your athletes into winning the martial arts tournament.

The game is divided into two seasons. During each season there are three preparation turns based on worker placement mechanics in which you will manage your dojo and train your athletes.

During the season, the athletes can also learn special techniques by visiting one of the ancient masters hidden in the central part of the board. Each season ends with the martial arts tournament, where each dojo can send up to two athletes. In case of empty slots in the tournament, athletes from the fifth dojo (the Skull Dojo) will attend. (These athletes are managed by the game and can even win the tournament!)

Combat between athletes is simulated by throwing a set of custom dice. There are four different dice, one for each fighting technique. Players will roll dice according their athlete's experience level (Dan): the higher the Dan, the higher the chance of winning the match! Before a fight, the players that are not attending can predict the winner of that fight to gain prestige.

The tournament ends with the grand final in which a new champion will be crowned. At the end of the second season the Dojo with most Prestige Points will win the game.
179182.name: Dojo Kun

179183.name: Dervish
179183.description:
From publisher blurb:

The OSR Dervish is a new class for OSR games. A sub-class (or variant) of the Cleric, the Dervish is unarmored religious warrior whose dancing and gyrating give him or her an improved unarmored armor class similar to that of a monk. They also fight with bladed weapons.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert edition, and the cyclopedia edition.

179184.name: Tomb Robber
179184.description:
From publisher blurb:

The OSR Tomb Robber is a fighter sub-class (or variant) largely meant to replace the thief, able to pick locks and deal with traps, while still being reasonably competent in a fight.

Although primarily intended for first advanced edition, it also contains tables for other popular versions: original edition, basic and expert edition, and the cyclopedia edition.

179185.name: Prestige Bloodlines: Aberrant
179185.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first in a series of ebooks that detail a prestige class for one of the sorcerer bloodlines. Why should draconic sorcerers have all the fun!

This first book in the series looks at the aberrant bloodline. The book includes:

The tainted adherent prestige class.
A pair of NPCs created using the new prestige class.
A new set of bonus spells for sorcerers with the aberrant bloodline, taking into account spells from other core books.
21 new spells especially suited to sorcerers with the aberrant bloodline and tainted adherents, though they can be used by any wizard or sorcerer. Many of these spells are based on tentacles.
12 new feats for aberrant sorcerers and users of tentacle spells.




Prestige Bloodline is a class sourcebook compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and suitable for GMs and players of any level.

179186.description:
This set includes four new Survivors for Zombicide: Black Plague, designed by Paul Bonner. The four new survivors include:
Inquisitor Mizar
Genevieve
Lord Bazak
Klom

Paul Bonner, a Yorkshire ​born Englishman, has lived in Copenhagen since the early ‘90s. After earning his degree in Illustration at the Harrow College of Art, he illustrated many children’s books on a freelance basis​ in London​, then spent three years with the Games Workshop Design Studio. After moving to Denmark, he continued his relationship with Games Workshop, and also contributed to such titles as Mutant Chronicles, Rackham’s Confrontation, Shadowrun​ and Riotminds​.
179186.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Paul Bonner

179188.name: Meditations of Jade
179188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expanding upon Meditations of the Lotus, Meditations of Jade adds 10 more meditation feats for your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This book contains a total of 18 Meditation Feats: 3 feats from the original source and 10 all new ones useable by any class.

Reckless Clarity: Using moment of clarity grants those that rage combat meditation
Flow like Water: Switch combat styles between strikes with ease.
Self Reflection: Gain a clear understanding of your actions and how it will interact with the world.
Tummo: Cold weather can no longer thearten you.
Dim Step: Learn the secret of ninja shadow traveling.
Identify Imperfections: Hone in on an enemies weak point.

rpgseries: The Open Gaming Store Free RPG Day 2016
179189.name: Cults and Cultists
179189.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doomsday cults. Snake cults. Cthulhu cults. Cults devoted to aliens, musicians, or politicians. Even cults devoted to cargo gods. There are cults dedicated to just about anything you can think of. So why not include more of them in our roleplaying game sessions?

No matter what flavor of cult you need, you can probably find one in our world or just about any world and genre you roleplay a character in. But sometimes you want something unique. That's where Insta-NPCs #9: Cults and Cultists comes in!

Cults and Cultists includes ten separate tables for everything from determining the size of your cult and how long they've been around to what they're after, how isolated they are, their level of commitment, and more! It also includes five different example cults and four NPCs you can use right out of the box, plus a worksheet you can print any time you want to go through the process quickly.

Included are

The Brotherhood of the Spade and Bertram Greyne (Fantasy)
Sisterhood of the Long Summer and Malda Obret (Fantasy)
Confederacy of Five Points and Father Singh (Fantasy)
The Moreau Ideal and Sako Mashai (Modern/Cyberpunk)
and the Teeth of the Dragon (Fantasy)




Plenty of ideas to start with before you even start rolling dice!

179190.name: Frontline: Road to Moscow
179190.description:
User Summary

Turn based game where you take command of the German forces at the East Front in WW-II to conquer Moscow. Emphasizes on gaming, on on simulation. Apparently this is a port from mobile.

Over 100 unique units. No multiplayer options. 30 battle scenarios which are inspired (take note: inspired) by historical missions which took place between the summer of 1941 to late 1944.

Game received pretty mixed reviews; the negatives focus on over simplified gameplay and frequent crashes.

179191.name: The Abyss (Issue 28 - Feb 1984)
179191.description:
User summary:

The Aesir; Scripts of Ysgarth; Discoveries at Gezireh-Taban; Silent Tongues; Gun Misfires

179192.name: Of Shifts So Deep the Cheeselight Speaks
179192.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thrumming plain. Its energy-rich grassland nourishes herds of grazers milked for the making of a lambent cheese, the firecurd. Rinds spark and the Flare spreads, setting minds ablaze.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted plain as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including residents, the grassland, dairies, cavern complexes and an anomaly.

The dairies could be detailed using Pseudohistorical Buildings on 2+ Dice and the cavern complexes simplified or extended using one or more of the maps in the Location, Landscape & World bundle. Grazers also feature in Location: Crawling Gorge.

179193.name: The Abyss (Issue 29 - Apr 1984)
179193.description:
User summary:

Undeath; Surviving the Middle Passage; The Jottun; Quest for the Bogon

Fiction by Janet Fox

179194.name: Scrabble Interactivo
179194.description:
The LCD shows the word that players need to find out, and clues are given, while the time to respond is counted. The device is passed from hand to hand with the correct answers.

Two game modes: individual or team. Individual has the option for easy or difficult (so there is really 3 modes). After choosing the options, start the game.

Individual mode: The first question appears on the screen. For example: words beginning with "A" and containing the letter "N". From that time it begins to count time (which leads the device). The player with the device in hand says a word with those conditions, and if you do, the device passes to the next player quickly, which should be another word that has not been said already. When the time expires, an alarm sounds and the player with the device on hand at the time (in this moment), is eliminated. New question appears on the screen, repeating the same cycle with the players that are left. The goal is not to be eliminated, as when only one player is the winner.

Team play is quite different. The question appears on the screen, and each of the teams will discuss among its members the number of words that are able to say with those conditions, in 60 seconds. It's like an auction. The team that makes the best bet, will play the first round of 60 sec. and each of the team members will be saying a word and pressed his team number on the device (1 or 2) so that it takes account at the end of 60 seconds. If successful you will get the first point, otherwise, the point is for the other team. Then comes another round of 60 seconds. with new question and following the same mechanics.

When starting the game will have agreed how many rounds will be played or how long the game. Once completed, the device itself will tell how many points each team leads, and whoever has the most points is the winner.

179195.description:
A set of three Survivors and one necromancer for Zombicide: Black Plague designed by Carl Critchlow. The three survivors include:
Thrud the Barbarian
Persephone Pursuivant
The Black Currant

And the necromancer is:
To-Me Ku-Pa

Carl Critchlow is a UK based illustrator and comic book artist.

He first created the character of 'Thrud the Barbarian' while still at art college in 1981, Thrud went on to feature in his own comic strip in Games Workshop's 'White Dwarf' magazine for five years during the 1980s and in a series of Eagle Award winning self-published comics in 2002 - 2007 (now available as a collection from Titan publishing).

As well as Thrud he has worked for many companies in the UK and US including DC comics, 2000AD and has illustrated over 200 individual cards for Magic the Gathering.
179195.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Carl Critchlow

179196.name: Das Wild-West Spiel
179196.description:
There are 3 games included:
The Gold Transport Raid: One player has 4 indians which whom to capture the gold transport and get it to the edge of the game board. The other player has 4 cowboys, which try to escort the gold transport to the fort.
Cattle Raid: The indians try to steal as many of the 6 cattle as they can, while the cowboys try to get the cattle from the waterhole to the farm.
Cowboy-Lotto: Up to 8 Ppayers get a cowboy or an indian to occupy the picture on the game board, which corresponds with the number on their playing piece. Movement is clockwise and determined by a die. The words on the pictures are covered by the letter token. When a player gets on a picture, he may take a letter token (if available) he needs to form the word from his starting picture. The first player to complete his word wins the game.

179197.name: Tupilak
179197.description:
Translated from back of the book:
Tupilak - The game of arctic death
Place: Greenland island in the North some hundreds of years ago
Players: Inuit shamans with strong sorcerous knowladge
Goal: Eliminate others as conveniently and surely as possible
Difficulty: Long distance, difficulty to move out of sight, everyone knows everyone.
Solution: Tupilak

Create Tupilak. Summon a spirit into it. Strengthen it with spells. Say teh name of teh target. Send it on it's way...

Tupilak is extremely easy, quick and exciting "party game", in which you only need this rule book, couple of regular dice, pen and paper.

Back of the book in finnish:
Tupilak - Peli arktisesta kuolemasta
Paikka: Pohjoinen Grönlannin saari joskus satoja vuosia sitten
Pelaajat: Inuiittishamaaneja vahvoine loitsutietämyksineen
Tavoite: Eliminoida muut mahdollisimman näppärästi ja varmasti
Vaikeus: Pitkä välimatka, vaikea liikkua salaa, kaikki tuntevat
Ratkaisu: Tupilak

Valmista Tupilak. Manaa se henkiin. Loitsi sille voimaa. Lausu kohteen nimi. Ja lähetä se matkaan...

Tupilak on äärimmäisen helppo, nopea ja jännittävä seurapeli, jonka pelaamiseen tarvitset ainoastan tämän sääntökirjan, pari tavallista noppaa, kynän ja paperia.

179198.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 20 - May 2015)
179198.description:
Tiny Gork has the honour of hosting the 20th installment of the Warlocks Journal wandering contest. The Journal is drawing from Tiny Gork’s library on a very specific subject this time, time is exactly what it appears to be interrested in.

The Journal is gathering information on Chronomancy, the term that time magic has been stamped with, magical spells, rituals, ceremonies and abilities to manipulate or exploit the concept of time. While the Time Hunters have been known to hunt down as many recipes for time manipulation as possible, many still survive scattered across the multiverse.

To participate in the Warlocks Journal May contest 2015, design in max. 250 words a Chronomancy Spell/Ritual/Ceremony, your submission is to be free of system rules and stats.

- From Publisher Website.

179200.description:
SET Mini Round plays just like SET, but with only three elements — color, number, shape — to consider instead of four. Each card contains 1-3 objects, with all of the objects on a card having the same color and shape, e.g., two purple shaded ovals. Colors and shapescome in three different types: green, purple and red; and oval, diamond and squiggle.

All players compete simultaneously and try to claim sets of cards in a single pass through the deck. A set consists of three cards that are either all alike or all different in each attribute. For example, if all three cards have the same number of objects, but three different shapes and colors, then those cards are a set; if two of the cards have a common attribute that is not shared by the third, they are not a set.

To play, one person takes the deck and lays out nine cards face up. The first person to spot a set collects those three cards; if the player was mistaken, then this player cannot claim a set until after another player has done so. After someone has claimed a set, the cardholder lays out three more cards. (If all players agree that no sets can be claimed, then the cardholder lays out three more cards. These cards aren't replaced after someone claims a set.) Whoever claims the most sets wins!
179200.name: SET Mini Round

179201.description:
Description from the publisher:

Your goal in Karma Mini Round is to get rid of all your cards, although in this elimination game everyone wins except for the last player holding cards.

Each turn, you must play a card of equal or higher number to avoid picking up the entire discard pile. Move through your cards faster by playing doubles. The deck includes four types of Karma cards; they can get you out of a jam, but be careful because in this game what comes around goes around...
179201.name: Karma Mini Round

179202.name: Jim Sterling Simulator
179202.description:
Have you ever wanted to experience the life of Jim Sterling?

Well now you can!

Save the gaming industry and free steam of bad greenlight games.

Will you succeed?

Source: The Developer Website.

179203.name: Quiddler Mini Round
179203.description: The challenge in Quiddler Mini Round, a smaller version of Quiddler, is to arrange your entire hand into words. Players draw and discard in turn, trying to use their high point letters and not get caught with them in hand. You can play using everyday words, and a bonus is given for the most words created in each round as well as for the longest word.

179204.description:
Five Crowns Mini Round is a five-suited rummy-style card game that's a smaller version of Five Crowns with fewer cards, although the fifth suit of stars and a rotating wild card are still present.

Your goal is to combine all of your cards into sets and runs, be the first to go out, then watch the others scramble as they get one last chance to cut their losses. With each round, the number of cards dealt increases and the wild card changes keep players on their toes.
179204.name: Five Crowns Mini Round

179205.name: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierter Sonderdruck Tag des Gesellschaftsspiels
boardgamecompilation: The Castles of Burgundy: 5th Expansion – Pleasure Garden
179205.description:
A single punch board containing expansions for 4 different games - Castles of Burgundy, Rokoko, Helios, and Limes.

Expansions are:

The Castles of Burgundy: 5th Expansion – Der Lustgarten (Pleasure Garden)
Rokoko Erweiterung - Edle Kleider (Fancy Dresses Promo)
Helios: Riese und Ballonfahrerin Erweiterung
Limes: Der Leuchtturm (The Lighthouse)

It was released for the Stadt Land Spielt event that took place on September 14, 2014 throughout Germany.

Note that the Rokoko expansion is misprinted and thus unusable (see the relevant thread here)

179206.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 8 - May 2014)
179206.description:
The strange and mysterious wandering journal of a long forgotten warlock has once more found its way to the tinkering room of Tiny Gork.

This time the journal reveals to us the nature of a very destictive beast, a beast born of the time flow. The beast is particularly feared and respected by the time hunters who frequently travels the time flow in hunt of time meddlers.

Only a few hunters have ever faced this beast and lived to tell about it, only one of them killed it.

Entries should include the following:

Name of the beast

Physical description (image optional)

Origin story

Behavior of the beast

At least one unique power description

Special: as part of any of the above should be mentioned WHY the beast is so feared by Time Hunters.

Max 450 word limit, Name of the beast does not count towards the word limit.

The entry is to be system neutral. No stats are required, but you may add system-specific details as a bonus Appendix to your entry, if you wish.

- From Publisher's Website.

179207.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 3 - Dec 2013)
179207.description:
We have now had a contest in creating items of power at the Warlocks Sanctum and the creation of a faction/organisation at Tales of a GM.

This time the pages of the journal has opened on a paiting, it looks like a woman trapped in ice. But who is this woman? Why is she trapped in the ice? How did she become trapped in the ice? Will she be set free or break free? Dig into your imagination, use this image to create the woman in ice. Is she a goddess? An npc? A villain? A heroine?

Because i hoping for hundreds of entries to the contest i will have to set a word limit. Bear in mind this is not a word requirement, it is merely a word limit. You are free to use less words, just not more than 300 words.

Let your imagination run wild…

•Max 300 word limit.
•The entry is to be system neutral. No stats are required, but you may add system-specific details as a bonus Appendix to your entry, if you wish.

- From Publisher's Website.

179208.name: Warlock's Journal (Issue 14 - Nov 2014)
179208.description:
You must design the current manifistation of the 3rd Sepharil fragment.

here are some questions for you to consider, these are not contest criteria:
What shape/form/body/essence has it taken this time ?
What are the properties of the 3rd Sepharil fragment on its own.
How is the fragment enhanced when combined with one or more fragments.
Where is the fragment located, is it hidden away or in someones possession.

Max 500 word limit‚ Name/Title does not count against word limit.

The entry is to be system neutral. No stats are required‚ but you May add system-specific details as a bonus Appendix to your entry‚ if you wish.

- From Publisher's Website.

179209.name: Essential Shadow Council Origins #1
179209.description:
The Essential origins ebooks is a few introductory monologues by Tiny Gork where he shares the general history of the Shadow Council. They are a great start if you wanna aquaint yourself with the core story of the Shadow Council.

Tiny Gork has written down his thoughts and knowledge of the Shadow Council in a few short volumes.

First issue: The essential Shadow Council origins part #1
in this issue Tiny Gork goes back to the beginning and talks about the creation of the council and how mistrust slowly creeped into it. He also explain briefly how they created their own worst enemy and how he planned to move against them.

- From Publisher Website

179210.name: Essential Shadow Council Origins #2
179210.description:
The Essential origins ebooks is a few introductory monologues by Tiny Gork where he shares the general history of the Shadow Council. They are a great start if you wanna aquaint yourself with the core story of the Shadow Council.

Tiny Gork has written down his thoughts and knowledge of the Shadow Council in a few short volumes.

Second issue: The essential Shadow Council origins part #2
in this issue Tiny Gork continues his story about the councils nemesis and his plans for their doom. The Council tries to take pre-emptive actions, exploiting a possible weakness while the nemesis moves closer and closer to his end goal.

- From Publisher Website

179211.name: As Above, So Below
179211.description:
From publisher blurb:

Covert insertion, a HALO drop into enemy territory. There are some things the spooks can't handle, some problems that can only be resolved through superior firepower. Even though you're going up against unknowable horrors, you don't have the luxury of fear, because lives are on the line here.

An emergency senior committee meeting in an anonymous briefing room in Whitehall. The shuffle of papers, low murmur of voices. The minister wants a proposal on his desk by 9. Army liaison confirms they have assets in place. Not that they know what's really at stake. They not cleared for what you know, but lives are on the line here.

When the going gets tough, the Laundry calls in the professionals. This sourcebook gives rules and guidelines on incorporating special forces missions into your games of The Laundry Roleplaying Game. The spies have done their grubby work – now it's time for the SAS to drop in and put down the alien horrors with courage and high explosives. Visit alien dimensions and the most remote, unfriendly regions of our own world, meet interesting locals, and kill them before they kill you.

The decisions that matter aren't made in the field – they're made in conference calls, in committee meetings. This sourcebook add a political dimension to your games of The Laundry Roleplaying Game, letting the players climb the ladder of promotion and take charge. Management isn't always a bad thing – it's power by another name, and bargains with ministers and Auditors work just like bindings with eldritch entities. Sorcery is the continuation of politics by other means.

Two sourcebooks in one, exploring two very different facets of the Laundry.

The military, and the political.

The sharp end, and the hand that guides.

As above, so below

This 128-page, black and white supplement contains:

Background on Special Forces organisations.
Rules for creating Special Forces characters.
Advice for running Special Forces scenarios, including Occult Engagement Protocols.
Advice for running Political Games, including rules for pay grade, status, promotion, mentors and committee meetings.
A new mini-game for playing high-level meetings.
Three new scenarios, using the new play-styles introduced in the book

179212.name: Mail Call: An Extended White Box SciFi  Encounter
179212.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Science Fiction Extended Encounter Location for old school games, specifically designed to be compatible with Barrel Rider Games, White Star. Delivering the mail is a good way to pick up a few extra credits, meet new people and have a few days to relax. Nothing could go wrong. . . could it? An adventure designed with 4 to 6 3rd to 5th level adventurers in mind.

This product includes a layered PDF with both color and printer friendly maps, as well as separate maps in the zip file including layered pdfs and jpgs suitable for VTT use

179213.name: Daevic
179213.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bind energy to your chakras with the secrets held in Akashic Mysteries!

In Akashic Mysteries, the veilweaving system of magic is introduced, where akashic energy is wielded by new classes like the vizier, daevic, and guru, who form this energy into veils that they bind to different chakras on the body. Inspired by Arabian and Indian myths, the mystical veils woven by these new classes imbue the veilweaver or the equipment they carry.

Each release in the series will contain different parts of the veilweaving system.

In this 30-page release is the daevic, an akashic knight who is bound in a symbiotic relationship with daeva, beings of pure akasha energy. In addition, included in this release are dozens of new feats for using veilweaving, the rules for veilweaving, and all of the veils a daevic can use.

If you want to get the entire book, be sure to instead pick up the on-going product that includes all individual releases like this release, as well as the final PDF combining all the parts of veilweaving into a single book!

179215.name: The Silven Trumpeter (Issue 1 - Aug 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Chasing Your Prey - A Guide to Tracking
Come Out and Play: Gender Equality at the Gaming Table
179215.description: Gender equality at the gaming table; Crafting the Ultimate RPG; A Guide to Tracking; Interview with Gary Gygax

boardgameimplementation: Wonky: The Unstable Adult Party Game
179217.description: In Wonky, players try to get rid of the cards in their hand by stacking blocks on top of one another, ideally setting up the blocks so that someone else takes a spill and gets stuck with more cards in hand. The trick to doing this are the special blocks in the game: nine blocks — with three each in small, medium and large sizes — with three of the block sides being flat and three being curved. Set up the blocks in the right way, and you can block an opponent's path to victory.
179217.name: Wonky
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 107-- Gen Con 2015 Wrap up and La Granja Review
Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest
Episode 64- Tail Feathers & 2016 Predictions/Resolutions
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 127

179219.description: Funemployed: Seasonal Help, an expansion deck for Funemployed, contains over 100 holiday-themed jobs and qualification cards (e.g., Mall Santa).
179219.name: Funemployed: Seasonal Help

179221.name: Titenic
179221.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




User Summary

Titenic is a Famicom game based off of the 1997 film Titanic. The game was first known to be on an ABAB 3-in-1 multicart and was later found on a 15-in-1 separated into two separate games.

The misspelling of the title for this game appears to be done on purpose; uncompiled code in the Super New Year Cart 15-in-1 refers to the game as "TITANIC". The misspelling was most likely done to avoid trademark infringement.

179222.description:
From the back cover of the rulebook:

Panzer Squash is a not so serious clay combat game between WWII tanks that you design!

Players craft their vehicles and combat to the death.

Completely compatible with the other Squash series games by Tri Tac Systems.
179222.name: Panzer Squash

179223.name: Super Tank
179223.description:
From the back cover of the rulebook:

This game details super tank combat in the late 21st and early 22nd centuries. This is a stand alone game. It may also be used with the Cassiopeian Empire role playing game as optional rules for tactical combat.

No map is included. You the player make your own map using the outline that is provided. This makes the game different every time you play.

This is a diceless system. Combat is done on a offense vs defense chart. Two vehicle sheets are provided. This gives you two of each type vehicle. Items needed for play. Blank paper, several different colored markers and a ruler. For two or more players.

179224.name: PrisMix Card Game
179224.description: PrisMix is a color spectrum card game. Players mix and match 12 prismatic colors to create 30 colorful scoring combos with prisms. Players want to strategically create color mixing combos to play multiple cards from their hand at a time to quickly play out all the cards in their hand first to win. So even though a player may have more cards in their hand... they can surprise their opponents by creating color mixing combos with 2, 3, or even 6 cards in a single play. May the best color mixer win! Quick prismatic fun with family and friends is what you will have when playing PrisMix.... let's play!

179225.name: Mortal Combat
179225.description:
[My own opinion:] Rulebook (and possibly only item) for the Mortal Combat fantasy role-playing game. Published in 1979, it is certainly a product of its time: fairly complicated and detailed combat system, lots of charts and tables, everything included in a single 62-page rulebook.

[From the front of the game chart insert card:]

Playable: Easy to pick up, fast to use, the rules can be explained to any newcomer in a matter of minutes. There is no unwanted over-complexity, as with some rules. Melee is divided into three segments: attack and defense are factored for the throw-to-hit, followed by the damage throw and optional hit location throw. Three dice rolls... the minimum necessary for a comprehensive combat system.

Realistic: The rules describe a convincing world, where commonsense and initiative count for a great deal. There are no superhuman characters carving up a dozen men single-handed-- just ordinary mortals with some skill in swordplay or sorcery, trying to use their wits to stay alive.

Clear: Presentation is lucid throughout. At a glance, you can see the range or duration of a spell, the attack factor of a creature, the cost of distilling a potion, etc. For quick reference during play, the essential combat charts are reproduced on back of this sheet;

Adaptable: The book presents a logical and consistent representation of "sword and sorcery" reality, so that any concept from fantastic literature can be readily fitted into the structure. The rules are designed for flexibility, and with a minimum of effort can be adapted for use with other FRP games. There is no need to start a whole new campaign to reap the benefits of MORTAL COMBAT.

[end of quote from game charts insert card]

179226.name: Starion Tactics
179226.description:
User Summary

Four rival powers go from planet to planet on different quests for victory. For some it is collecting artifacts while for others it is complete extirpation of the rival team. It can be played two against two or as a free-for-all. There are more boardgame-oriented modes as well as modes that include fog of war and neutral combatants. With resources obtained on conquered planet you can build new ships of various types, remembering that there is a large asymmetry in speed of building and ship power. As well there are cards that can be turned in for resources or played for special battle or random actions.

179227.name: 3 Seeds: Reap Where You Sow
179227.description:
Intro:
In 3 Seeds, your goal is to earn the most points by placing your limited seeds into crops with high returns. To win, you will need to observe the actions of others, remember obtained insights, and strategically use powerful abilities.

Watch carefully though! Crops and their values can change when you least expect it. Adapt to changes and alter your strategy to come out the victor. With only 3 seeds in hand, where will you sow?

Gameplay:
Each player is given a deck of 6 Seed cards consisting of 2 time, 2 money, and 2 labor cards. During your turn, you will draw the top 3 Seed cards from your deck. You will try gain insight into one of the return/harvest values assigned to the crops in play. With that information and the seeds you have in-hand, you will play 2 of the 3 seeds in your hand on any of the crops in play. Special earned event cards may also be played during your turn to further your success.

The seeds you play on crops will be returned to you once the crop receives enough seeds on it to be completed/harvested. Once a crop is completed, players will receive points equal to the crop's harvest number multiplied by the number of seeds they played on that crop. Once a crop is complete, a new Harvest and Crop card is drawn.

Game ends when the a crop is completed and there are no more Crop cards in the deck. The player with the most points at the end wins.

179228.name: Grim
179228.description:
In Grim, players must compete against each other in a dice game of Grim's own design in an attempt to save themselves from a GrimFATE in the AfterRealm.

Players are given 10 tokens, strike counters, a scorecard, and 1 GrimFATE card to begin.

The object of the game is to be rid of all your tokens, either by turning them into Grim, or giving them to your opponents. Players must roll three dice to earn the ability to turn in tokens, and may also choose to save them up for a chance at using "Grim's Hand" to pawn off tokens on their opponents.

Once a player has been rid of all their tokens they must face Grim in a one-on-one duel to achieve victory. If they win, all other players are hauled off to the AfterRealm, and must read their GrimFATE cards aloud -- if they lose, they are given another 10 tokens by Grim and must continue to compete for victory.

The game is won when Grim has been defeated.

Grim is designed for 2 to 6 players and can be played in about 15 minutes.

179230.name: The Strange XP Deck
179230.description:
Track and trade XP without wearing a hole in your character sheet!

In The Strange, exploration and risk are everything. Players earn experience points not for killing monsters, but for making discoveries and facing unexpected challenges. You might rack up your XP between sessions, but most commonly you receive experience points during play, when events take an unexpected turn or you make a remarkable discovery. And XPs are a sort of currency, often changing hands between players.

The Strange XP Deck gives you a set of tangible tokens to represent experience points. They’re great for granting, tracking, and trading XP, and the card format makes your tokens easy to slip into your book alongside your character sheet between sessions. This 30-card deck is a useful, elegant tool at the game table.

- From Publisher Website.

179231.name: The Strange Cypher Deck
179231.description:
Save time at the game table and in prep with these super-handy cards!

In The Strange, a cypher is a small device that can create a single, often spectacular effect. A cypher may look ordinary, but each one is something special—a manifestation of the Strange that we don’t fully understand. Players will regularly use cyphers to accomplish their missions. Hoarding cyphers is imprudent and a waste of needed resources; replacement cyphers are always around the next corner.

This deck of 120 full-color cards allows GMs and players to randomly generate cyphers on the fly. Twenty item cards describe the physical form the cypher takes, depending on the laws of the recursion in which it appears, while each of the 100 power cards offers multiple power options to match the device. Skip rolling on the tables and save time and effort, at the game table and while prepping your game, by simply drawing a card, which you can then hand to your player to keep until the cypher is used!

- From Publisher Website.

179232.name: True Story: a game of true tales told to friends – unleash your inner storyteller
179232.description:
