True Story gets players telling true stories from their lives and teaches storytelling skills in the process.

Gameplay: Each players draws a Theme Card from the deck and tells a true story inspired by that theme. Theme Cards are memory cues to help you think of a story, from your own life, that you feel good about telling, e.g. Unknown Territory: wandering off the map, wild beasts & lands await, words not yet invented. With each round come new theme cards and new stories, plus new story challenges like longer stories, vivid descriptions, suspense, and self-reflection.

Goal: Players earn points telling a series of increasingly complex stories that include specific story elements. At the end of the game, points turn into votes (called Award Points). The player who receives the most Award Points is declared Master Storyteller.

179241.name: Townsmen
179241.description:
Townsmen is a game for 1 to 4 players where you have to manage a small Town in the Colonial age.

Players have their own Personal Board with many special actions to activate and a deck of cards.

Every turn each player have to play 4 cards and, at the end of their turn they have to replenish their hand with 4 new cards from his deck. Each card provide two different actions to choose from. Some of them give you resources and other give you actions that are used with the personal board to add new cards to your deck or to develop these cards with more powerful cards, etc.....

There are also buildings to build, that give the player new special actions to activate every turn.

Players interact each others by attacking their Towns or buying resources from their markets.

179242.name: NeaGox
179242.description:
User Summary

Neagox is a game for Commodore 64, released on a cover disk for the magazine Commodore Disk Users in 1990. The game is a sidescrolling shoot'em up, were the played control a space ship, shooting down enemies, set on the players invaded planet Neagox in 2092. The aim is to save the population in Neagox five worlds, by completing the five levels.

179243.name: World Series: The Season
179243.description:
User Summary

World Series - The Season was an interesting baseball arcade game released in 1985. It was a follow-up to Cinematronics' World Series title with additional play options including fairly fine-grained statistical high-score tracking. The World Series games are notable for their unique spring-loaded flick joysticks that simulated the speed of a pitcher's arm and the timing and strength of a batter's swing.

179244.name: Rage (1990)
179244.description:
User Summary

Rage is a game for Commodore 64 by Amok in 1990. The game is a two player only game. Each played controls a space ship, and the aim is to shoot down each other. it takes 20 hits to shoot down the other players ship, and the first to get 20 hits is the winner and the game is over. The game is set to a single screen, with scrolling stars in the background, where it's not possible to fly off screen.

179245.name: World Championship Russian Roulette
179245.description:
Congratulations, you've made it to the world championship! Unfortunately, it's the World Championship of Russian Roulette. In this press-your-luck bluffing game of simultaneous play where no player has to wait for their turn, you play the part of a captain of a Russian Roulette team.

You are competing against the world's best Russian Roulette teams. The team that wins is the first team to accrue 15 victory points or the last team with their brains still intact. You earn victory points by bidding on how many pulls of the trigger you will survive.

Any time you lose a teammate, you earn a severance package in the form of an action card. Action cards allow a player to peek at the top three cards of their gun deck before bidding, shoot at another player instead of at themselves, change a bid, or more.

But there's more! This is a bluffing game. At the beginning of every round, players place one of their gun cards into their "pocket", providing them the opportunity to cheat by pocketing their bullet card. Careful though. Get caught cheating and the penalty will blow your mind.

179246.name: Raid (1986)
179246.description:
User Summary

Raid is a game for Commodore 64 by Paravision Company. The played controls a space ship, and the game scrolls vertical. On each level there is a wave of alien ships flying against your ship. The waves has different colors and flies faster for each level. To complete a level you have to stay alive for a certain length of time. The aim is to complete as many levels as possible.

179247.name: Extraordinary Voyages
179247.description:
Race around the world with Phileas Fogg and his faithful companion Passepartout. Explore the depths of the world's oceans with Captain Nemo. Set forth today on your own extraordinary voyage!

Extraordinary Voyages is played in a series of rounds, over multiple boards using each player's individual deck. A player may draft a card, play up to three cards from their hand, or go adventuring.

Around the board will be various goods you need to acquire while adventuring, but the main goal is to finish any one of the three maps before any of your opponents!

179248.name: Wanderwoods
179248.description:
From publisher blurb:

You’ve always had restless roots. While other intelligent trees are content to remain in the deep woods, you long to wander the lands. You seek out other restless spirits, and hope to accomplish great deeds with them. One day, you plan to bring back the stories of your adventures to the Meeting of the Trees.

This supplement allows you to play a Wanderwood, living trees who protect the forests and the good peoples of the world. Inside you’ll find:

A full character class description (including new special abilities), for use with old-school games including LABRYRINTH LORD
Helpful charts to take your Wanderwood from level 1 to 10
Suggestions for incorporating Wanderwoods into your campaign.
Pregenerated characters at first and third level. Just print and play (or use them as NPC’s)

179249.name: 17 Golems
rpgseries: Cast of Cards: On-Call RPG Characters
179249.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: 17 Golems

Golems are works of art as much as they are works of magic. Wizards, sorcerors and craftsmen with enough knowledge can create these mindless servants. Here are 17 golems for your player group to take on!

179250.name: Medieval Tavern
179250.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 24 x 20 inch, full color battlemap of a Medieval Tavern .

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT), and include a 360 degree view of the interior.

“Someone has poisoned and killed the winner of tonight’s tale telling contest, Brad. No one leaves until the city guard gets here and can begin their investigation.”—Fireside Tavern Barkeep

Medieval Tavern is a combination of the interior of a medieval tavern and the exterior grassland surroundings outside. The product includes a 360-degree panoramic view from inside the tavern.

Medieval Tavern is intended for use in fantasy and medieval historical period settings.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Tale Telling Contest: The Fireside Tavern has a contest on Saturday nights. Meat is roasted in the center of the inn, usually pork but sometimes beef. While the meat is cooked, a tale telling contest is held around the fire. The bard with the best tale gets a free cut of pork or steak. The combination of the smell of roasting meat and anticipation of a good meal paired with ale and mead paired with good stories being told packs The Fireside on Saturdays.

The group may visit The Fireside to rest after an adventure. A bard or troubadour character might even be actively part of the contest. The night goes as planned until the winner of the contest, Brad, eats his free steak, becomes violently ill, and drops dead. The barkeeper seals The Fireside to prevent the killer from leaving and waits for the city guard to arrive and begin an investigation.

The group may be able to convince the barkeep to allow them to head the investigation until the city guards arrive provided they were not part of the contest and their reputation is good. Everyone in the tale telling contest is a potential suspect as well as the kitchen staff. The assassin who poisoned the steak is still in the tavern and the group should be given a chance to ferret him out before the city guards arrive. If they do figure out who is the assassin, they have to deal with a powerful poisoner who loves to use envenomed light weapons to deliver his deadly venoms to his victims.

Who ordered the hit on Brad? A fellow bard who lost the contest too many times and hated his rival enough to kill him? A rival tavern sick of the Fireside’s Saturday night dominance determined to ruin the reputation of the storytelling contest?

179251.description:
Discover brand new game mechanisms for tactical Modern Warfare!

Urban Operations uses blocks to simulate the Fog of War, and blocks rotation to show units hits.

3 campaigns (16 scenarios) including some famous fights:

Fulda - NATO vs Warsaw Pact (6 scenarios)
Mogadishu (6 scenarios)
Four Aces - elite units of 4 nations
US Marines in Fallujah (04)
French Foreign Legion at Kolwezi (78)
Russian Paratroopers in Groszny (99),
British Desert Rats in Bassrah (03)





Game system: simple but efficient

From the very beginning the development of Urban Operations, all the complexities that occur in urban warfare have been taken into account. On a classical game board, terrain symbols on the map and specially designed rules help to represent weapons effects, which are one of the main sources of casualties during urban fightings.

In the same way, the map system allows the management of distant fire, even from building to building, as well as close quarter battle from room to room. When explosives are used to breach walls, or when a shell hits its target, collateral effects of the explosion are taken into account. It was also critical to integrate one of the major players of today’s conflicts, which is the civilian population. The presence of non-combatants often complicates the way forces can use their weapons, especially against irregular opponents.

In addition, the presence of tactical leaders is a real asset for assault squads. And combat service support teams can deliver logistical support on the frontline, in order to enhance the operational status of any element.

Components:
• Boxed game
• 5 maps: Four 72cm x 54cm and one 72cm x 13cm
• Two 24cm x 30cm game map (underground)
• 199 die-cut counters
• One 82 et one 74 stickers sheet
• 160 wooden blocks
• Rules booklet
• 3 Campaign rules booklet
• 16 scenario player aids
• 2 player aids in english
• 1 set of 144 playing cards
• 2 dices
179251.name: Urban Operations

179252.description:
Description from the publisher:

It just doesn't feel like a dungeon worth exploring without hordes of undead! Munchkin Undead adds fifteen new monsters, curses, and items all dealing with the formerly living. Get your pointy sticks and your chainsaws ready because it's time to kill them all over again!
179252.name: Munchkin Undead

179253.description:
Description from the publisher:

You can't clear thousands of dungeons without making a few frenemies...so that's what we did! As long as your imaginary frenemies are safely stored inside their blister, they help you in combat — but if you release them to get at the cards inside, you can't use their rule anymore. Oh, temptation!

As long as the Munchkin Imaginary Frenemies package remains unopened, you may keep your imaginary frenemies in front of you as a +2 combat bonus. It cannot be lost to Curses, Bad Stuff, or theft, and stays with you even if you die.

At any time, you may open the package, releasing your frenemies, and draw as many Treasures as there are players in your game. Keep one of the Treasures for yourself and give each other player one each. Sign the two Door cards inside, and put them in your hand as well. When you play a card that you have signed, it has double effect. Save this card so you remember this rule in the future!
179253.name: Munchkin Imaginary Frenemies

179254.description:
Outrun your formula rivals on the city freeway!

The excitement of the arcade racer comes to the table top. 2-4 players compete in open wheel racing on the city freeway. Reach top speed, dodge traffic, pass junctions and turbo in a battle to tame the Formula Freeway!

GAMEPLAY
Race by selecting High or Low gear followed by drawing one of two movement cards from the race deck. Decide to play this card or to move another racer in the hope that the second card will be better strategically. Win by driving through all freeways of the race distance and crossing the finishing line first.

FEATURES
Switchable double-sided mats creating an infinite rolling freeway and randomly closed junctions with traffic cones. Selectable gears, turbos and moving traffic vehicles. Choose to race less junctions or tackle the full distance of all five freeway junctions.

INCLUDES
Two double-sided mats, four race cars with turbos, ten traffic cars, two cones, gear & movement cards and rules.
179254.name: Formula Freeway: 4 Player Edition

179255.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Ancient Uprising has been put down, and a fragile peace again holds in the galaxy...but suddenly, everything changes. Several new factions rise to disturb the status quo. The Unity nanomachines bend energy and matter to their will. The Shaper ships tear the spacetime fabric apart, while insignificant Octantis factions take a developmental leap after leap forward. It almost seems like the base laws of the universe no longer apply.

Eclipse: Shadow of the Rift introduces several new mechanisms to Eclipse, including Time Distortion, Evolution and Anomalies, as well as several new Rare Technologies, Developments and Discoveries. It includes two new player boards with three new different alien species from which to choose. Due to its modular design, you can use all of these additions or just some of them in any game of Eclipse according to your preferences and play style. The expansion does not require the Rise of the Ancients expansion, but is fully compatible with it.

As the shadows unfold from the rifts of spacetime, can your civilization stand unbroken?
179255.name: Eclipse: Shadow of the Rift

179256.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Adrian Smith, and come from his highly acclaimed graphic novel The Chronicles of HATE. The survivors include:
Cul'Nar
Jorvak
Sha'Keel
Gurbak

Adrian Smith (born 1969 in England, United Kingdom) is a illustrator/concept designer living in Scotland.
Best known for his work with Games Workshop and numerous similar companies, Adrian has also done concept design work for computer games companies such as THQ , EA, RIOT, Gameloft and others. Other credits include a short comic series in France written by Pat Mills and book illustrations alongside renowned artists from around the world.
Recently Adrian has been self publishing, the first project being his art book “Illuminations”, and a series of graphic novels called ‘Chronicles of HATE’, book 1 came out to great reviews and book 2 is on the way. More recently he has been working with a board game company called Guillotine games. In addition to personal projects, he still finds time for freelance work with various companies.
179256.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Adrian Smith

179257.description:
Blood of Rome is a board game of gothic horror in ancient Rome. Rome will burn, Rome will bleed!

In Blood of Rome, supernatural factions fight a secret war in the streets and catacombs of Rome. Vampires, Werewolves, Gargoyles, Witches, and Slayers form alliances and vendettas in their conflict over the soul of the empire. Each player secretly belongs to one of the five Factions, with the goals of dominating the most locations on the City Board, and slaying the agents of factions with which they have a Vendetta.

Players take turns placing cards from their hands onto the limited slots at the various board locations. Each card belongs to a different faction, and has special abilities which can: add new agents to a location, transform agents from one faction into another, trigger a combat vote, make an accusation against another player, and more. Any player can play a card from any faction on their turn, thereby manipulating their enemies into doing their dirty work for them. A Calendar of Auguries tracks the cycles of the sun and moon, triggering a location's bonus ability when the proper faction card is played.
179257.name: Blood of Rome

179259.description:
There's an epic battle of wits being slyly waged among you and your roommates. No one speaks of it, or even acknowledges its existence, but when it comes to taking out the garbage, it's all about the art of the dodge. In the pursuit of avoidance, each dexterously stacked banana peel represents a small victory. That candy wrapper hidden in the deep recesses of your room is a silent success. But the greenish milk carton you secretly stashed under your roommate's bed, that was a stroke of genius! That is, until you get caught making a mess while everyone else pretends they would never be so childish — as to get caught. Be careful and be cunning because only the champion can gloat in a hammock while everyone else lugs out the trash on garbage day.

In Garbage Day, players take turns stacking garbage cards one at a time onto the overflowing garbage can, or stashing garbage cards in their rooms. But once a player's room gets too full, they must clean it by stacking all the cards from that room on top of the garbage can, very carefully, one by one. If garbage cards fall off the garbage can during your turn, place them in your overflow pile. If your overflow pile gets too big, you're eliminated from the game. If all other players have been eliminated, you win!
179259.name: Garbage Day!
boardgameexpansion: Garbage Day: "Will You Marry Me?" Promo
Garbage Day: Gen Con Promo Pack
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 33 : Gencon 2016 Recap + Interview with Ryan Bruns (Mayday Games)
Episode 78- My Village and GenCon 2016 Preview
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

179260.name: Indie Mixtape Volume 3
179260.description:
Publisher summary
Indie Mixtape: Volume 3 is a mixtape-inspired anthology of short games by a mixture of veteran and up-and-coming indie designers -- each inspired by a song that the authors might put on a mixtape to send to a friend going through hard times.

All proceeds from this anthology will be donated to members of the indie games community facing medical problems or other challenges that have put a strain on their resources.

The included games are:

SIDE A
01. Jackson Tegu — Overture (after “Strange Overtones” by Brian Eno and David Byrne)
02. Liz Gorinsky — Lioness (after “Lioness” by Songs: Ohia)
03. Kira Magrann — Strict Machine (after “ Strict Machine” by Goldfrapp)
04. Brie Sheldon — Spread 'Em (after “Dangerous” by Big Data ft. Joywave)
05. Dylan Nix — Unboxing Day (after “Moanin’ ” by Art Blakey & The Jazz Messengers)
06. Tayler Stokes — Sleep and His Half-brother Death (after “Threnody for the Victims of Hiroshima” by Krzysztof Penderecki)
07. Vivian Abraham — Happiness is a Warm Gun (after “Happiness is a Warm Gun” by The Beatles)
08. Noam Rosen — Closer (after “Closer” by Corinne Bailey Rae)
SIDE B
09. Orion Canning — Resistance (after “Resistance” by Muse)
10. Stras Acimovic and John LeBoeuf-Little — Save the Date (after “Ironic” by Alanis Morisette)
11. Hannah Madrone — ROAR! (after “Roar” by Katy Perry)
12. Josh Jordan — Summer Song (after “Summer Song” by Wavorly)
13. Mo — Drive (after “Drive” by Melissa Ferrick)
14. Christopher Weeks — Pleasure Burn (after “Girl U Want” by Devo)
15. Graypawn — A Lovely Place to Be (after “A Lovely Place to Be” by Patrick O’Hearn)
16. GremlinLegions — Sparkle Hero (after “Zettai Muteki Fallin’ LOVE” and “Moonlight Densetsu”)
17. J.Walton — Super Clashland (after “Hexadecimal Genome” by Bit Shifter)
'Bonus track': Tobie Abad — Songs

179262.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 1 - Winter 2014)
179262.description:
Entradilla de la revista:

Crítico 01

Publicado en invierno de 2014

Versión física. Versión digital.

60 páginas a todo color

Incluye:

Estrellas de alquiler: Una aventura para Shadowrun escrita por Diego López y que nos trasladará a un caro burdel.

Los Daoine Ainmhí: Una aventura con el sistema de La Puerta de Ishtar, escrita por Fran Vidal, que enfrentará a los personajes con un culto horrible que practica una forma de esclavismo particularmente cruel.

La Guerra en Europa: Una ayuda para Z-Corps, escrita por Guillermo Rubio Martín, que traslada la acción al viejo mundo.

Generación de trasfondos: Una ayuda de David Monedero (Scribble) para todo tipo de juegos de fantasía.

El taller de Loman: Álvaro Loman nos da algunos consejos sobre el diseño de juegos.


Issue 01

Published in Winter 2014

Physical version. Digital version.

60 color pages

It Includes:

Stars for hire: An adventure for Shadowrun 4th edition written by Diego Lopez. It will take us to an expensive brothel.

The Daoine Ainmhí: An adventure for La puerta de Ishtar, written by Fran Vidal in which the characters will face a horrible cult that practices a particularly cruel form of slavery.

The war in Europe: A game aid for Z-Corps, written by Guillermo Rubio Martin. It moves the action to the Old World.

Background generation: A game aid from David Monedero (a.k.a 'Scribble'), useful in any fantasy game.

Loman's workshop: Álvaro Loman gives us some tips on game design.

179263.name: The Beholder (Issue 26 - Jun 1981)
179263.description:
User summary:

The Beholder - Incorporating The Aerial Servent

179264.name: The Beholder (Issue 27 - Jul 1981)
179264.description:
User summary:

The Beholder - Incorporating The Aerial Servant

Mentions Game Fair, the first TSR convention in Britain, as having passed.

179265.name: Double Feature: Everyone's a Critic
179265.description: Double Feature: Everyone's a Critic is an expansion for the Double Feature base game in which all you need to know are the movies you've seen!

179266.name: Flip the Bird
179266.description:
In Flip the Bird, players gain points by being the first to play all of their cards in a single round. The first player to score 200 points wins!

In more detail, deal each player eight cards at the start of each round, with all players taking a turn at being the dealer. Two cards are flipped face up to form two different trump piles. If an Action or Condition card is flipped, then discard the card and flip another card as only cards with numbers or birds can be used to start the trump piles.

Different birds have specific numeric and color value, but things get crazy as action and condition cards can change the rules of the game. Watch out because just when you least expect it someone will flip the bird...and reset the card pile!

179267.name: Glory That Was Greece, Volume 1: The Battles of Leuctra and Mantineia
179267.description:
The Glory that was Greece is a series of games depicting several battles from the ancient world. The games are introductory in level and complexity, designed for fun and competitive play, while also depicting the history of the battles. This first volume in the series depicts the battles of Leuctra and Mantineia.

After the Peloponnesian War, Sparta was the uncontested military leader of the Greek poleis. For almost three decades the Spartans were considered nearly invincible in an open field battle due to the strength and tactical organization of their hoplites.

Beginning in 378 BC a coalition of cities from the northern part of Greece, led by Athens and Thebes, began to challenge Spartan power and for a short period of time, under the leadership of two great generals, Pelopidas and Epaminondas, the small city of Thebes achieved a lasting place in ancient history, making the acropolis of their city (called Cadmea and for a long time subject to the control of a Spartan garrison) a sort of paladin of freedom against Lacedaemonian power.

The game’s battles of volume 1 in the series, Leuctra and Mantineia, depict the rise and fall of this short "empire", serving as an eulogy to one of the greatest military leaders of all time, Epaminondas.

179268.description:
Solo expansion for Dolmen.

In solo play you play against three virtual players. Your goal is to achive as many vicorty points as possible, to beat your highscore and to increase the amount by which you beat the best virtual opponent.

Adds 36 new cards to the game.
179268.name: Dolmen: Lone druid

179269.description:
Expansion for Dolmen that adds 10 tomb tiles and one black stone to the game.

The tomb tiles are placed in the center of each octogonal stone circle. If you are the first player to place a stone in that stone circle you get to take the tomb tile and keep it secret in front of you. When and how the tiles' ability can be used depends on the tile itself.
179269.name: Dolmen: The chamber tombs

179270.description:
Expansion for Dolmen that adds ten ritual cards to the game.

Before starting the game shuffle and deal each player two face down cards. Return any spare cards to the box. The ritual cards are goal cards that may give additional victory points in the scoring round at the end of the game.
179270.name: Dolmen: The rituals

179271.description:
User summary

In this platform fighting card game that emulates videogames like Super Smash Brothers, players take turns revealing action cards to move and attack. Damage adds CRASH cards to each players deck and they are eliminated after a set number are revealed, or if they're knocked clear of the map.

This game was included in PNP format within the RPG bundle Indie Mixtape Volume 3.
179271.name: Super Clashland

179272.name: Rox 64
179272.description:
In game instructions

Rox 64 [is] an arcade-style game for Commodore-64. Defend your lunar module by firing off rockets to intercept incoming meteors. Too many ground impacts result in an earthquake! Survive 60 meteors for bouns and rescue by mothership!

179273.description:
Objective: be the first transporting 5 l sea cow milk (=Seekuhmilch)to hungry shark babies through the stormy sea

Players take turns moving their pawns according to the number (0-4) rolled on a six-sided die, transporting milk. Board with 29 spaces has 4 'traps' which you should avoid - otherwise you'll loose your milk due to stormy weather and must start again.
179273.name: Die Seekuhmilch-Rallye

179274.name: Save Satellits
179274.description:
User Summary

Save Satellits is a game for Commodore 64. The game is set in space, where the player needs to protect a satellite. The player controls a telescopic sight, and needs to shoot down aliens so the satellite can fly to the next sector (level). The aim is to complete as many aectors as possible. Each sector having different aliens that attack.

boardgameintegration: One Deck Dungeon: Forest of Shadows
One Deck Dungeon: Forest of Shadows
boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Cooperative Game Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
179275.description:
One Deck Dungeon is a card game "roguelike" — a dungeon delve that is different every time, difficult to survive, with a character you build up from scratch. The deck consists of various foes to combat and other perils from the dungeon. Each card, though, depicts both the obstacle to overcome and the potential rewards for doing so. When you defeat a card, you claim it as either experience, an item, or a skill, tucking it under the appropriate side of your character card to show its benefits.

The longer you take exploring the dungeon, the deeper you'll delve, and the difficulty will scale up quickly! If you make it far enough, you'll have to fight the dungeon boss. Survive, and you'll be a legend!

One Deck Dungeon is designed for 1-2 players. With multiple sets, you can add more players.
179275.name: One Deck Dungeon
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 103 - Burgle Bros.
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 020 – Reasons to Sell a Game
Episode 37 - Our 2016 Enthusiastic Seals of Approval!
Episode 53- Elysium and GenCon 2015 Preview
Episode 55- Viceroy and On-Line Gaming (CONTEST WINNER!)
GenCon 2015 - Asmadi Games
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016
Table for One Episode 23 - One Deck Dungeon w/ Chris Cieslik
Vox Republica 136: Creating A Gaming Cafe

179276.name: 1001 Odysseys
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Table for One Episode 23 - One Deck Dungeon w/ Chris Cieslik
179276.description:
1001 Odysseys is a game of fantastic space adventures. A human ship, the Odyssey, sets out to explore a new sector of the galaxy after finding an operational alien stargate. Players take on the roles of the Odyssey's bridge crew, as they find planets, meet strange new aliens, and eventually try to find the way back home!

Each time the group sits down at the table, they'll play through an Episode -- one co-operative adventure that will span several scenes with different story choices and conclusions. The game comes with over a dozen episodes, telling the story of the Odyssey's adventures. No two playthroughs of a given episode will be exactly alike, as your choices will impact the outcome of both scenes and how the episode's story turns out.

The stories and scenes are contained in two books. The Adventure Log contains a different scene on each page, and is placed on the table as the playing-area for tokens and actions to be placed. Activities within a scene will cause a paragraph to be read from the Book of Events, and these paragraphs will give additional information and inform how the scene proceeds. Crew members have an array of card based abilities that will let them collaborate and complete these activities.

179277.name: Dirty Neighbors: This Game is Not For You
179277.description:
Dirty Neighbors is a party game for mature audiences. The game combines everyone's wit, humor, and personal problems to expose things you never knew about your friends. The more dirt you have on your friends, the more your jaw will hurt from laughing. But, then again... this game is not for you.

How to play?
The first player takes a card.

That card will tell you the dirty neighbor of this round.

Then, everyone, except the dirty neighbor, will fill in the blanks with their most creative, dirty, witty, or brutal
answers and hand their answers to the dirty neighbor.

The dirty neighbor gets to choose their favorite answer and decides who wins that round’s card.

First player to collect five cards wins.

179278.name: The Nightmare Cooperative
179278.description:
User Summary

Moving through castle levels, you awake allies and seek to avoid monsters. Monsters can be killed by making contact but an equal amount of life is deducted from you or your ally. By picking up life 'hearts', potions, and gold you can increase your abilities before finding the level exit.

179280.name: Trivial Pursuit: World of Harry Potter
boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
179280.description:
Trivial Pursuit: World of Harry Potter

This Trivial Pursuit bitesize edition contains 600 questions based on the Harry Potter films, some of which would challenge even the smartest of wizards! Test your trivia from the following topics: The Dark Arts, Hogwarts, Magical Spells & Potions, Magical Objects, Magical People and Animals & Magical Creatures. The handy game requires no board and can be carried around in its bite-size wedge case.

179281.name: Parhelion Card and Board game
179281.description:
The underlying concept in this game is that you, as a player, have all means of employing strategies, controlling the movement of your troops and tactical insight in order to win.

The goal of the game is to destroy your opponent’s base, but how you can achieve this is left to the player.

You play the game with cards on a map, each card has their own strengths and movement speeds. Strategic and tactical gameplay are a necessity to win!

179282.name: Close Combat: Gateway to Caen
179282.description:
Overview: Close Combat: Gateway to Caen is the latest release in the critically-acclaimed Close Combat series, and the final release of the current game engine. Gateway to Caen focuses on the largest, concentrated British offensive since the Normandy landings in an attempt to penetrate the German lines west of Caen and cross the Odon River to get the stalled advance moving again.

With Close Combat: Gateway to Caen you can play at the strategic and tactical level, putting yourself in the boots of both the generals and the platoon commanders. You can move or combine your battlegroups on the strategic level and decide the outcome of battles on the tactical level. You will command squads in close combat situations, using small arms, mortars, machine guns, armored cars, and tanks to triumph against the enemy. You command artillery and mortar barrages and even air strikes. You will get to know individual solders, platoons, battalions, and the larger brigades and battle groups which they comprise.

Players can experience the desperate situation of the outnumbered, but well-armed Panzergrenadiers, or the daunting offensive mission of the fully-supported British infantry advancing across the treacherous Odon Valley. At your command are Churchill, Cromwell, Firefly, Sherman, Stuart tanks and more. Panther, Tiger, Stug, and Mk.IV tanks will arrive to support German Panzergrenadiers as they try to hold the line against a concerted British attack.

The historic scope of Operation Epsom is captured in single battles, operations, and the grand campaign. The strategic battlefield offers over two dozen individual battlefields with over three dozen accurately portrayed German and British battle groups. British infantry regimental history is reflected in name among the various battalions. You can deploy your battalions as they actually fought in the struggle for the Odon. The game includes all new maps and a range of upgraded effects.

The Setting

With the success of the Allied landings at Normandy and their domination of air and sea, expectations were high that the momentum would continue on land. It was not to be so. Though initially surprised and overwhelmed, the German Army quickly recovered, mobilized, and, counterattacked. Field Marshal Rommel formed a capable defense in Normandy that made the Allied advance costly. Superior Allied artillery and air power failed to crack the German lines. Though the Norman City of Caen was originally a British D-Day objective, its capture would elude and frustrate Montgomery’s 21st Army for weeks to come. Operation Epsom was Field Marshall Montgomery’s first concentrated attempt to go around the city and the Odon River, and break through the strengthening German bulwark. The newly-arrived British VIII Corps, supported by 700 guns of the Royal Artillery made a go of it along a four-mile front between Rauray and Carpiquet. Defending that front was the infamous 12th SS Panzer Division. Though reduced by weeks of heavy fighting they remained a potent and experienced foe. The Germans had offensive plans too, but the British struck first, and the 2nd SS Panzer Corps, the last of Germany’s offensive reserves in Normandy, was instead committed to stopping the British breakthrough along the Odon. Can you, as Montgomery and his commanders, re-chart the course of the Normandy campaign and prevail against Germany’s SS Panzer divisions? Can you as the Germans, once again stop Montgomery, or eclipse history and push the British back entirely?

Source: The Publisher Website.

179283.name: Deadline Saloon
179283.description:
In a godforsaken town in the wild west a new saloon has opened. Citizents are scrambling for the admission in hopes of free booze. With wise and smart decisions you need to help them to achieve their goals and at the same time impede on other players as much as you can. Each citizen has unique capabilities supporting their admission but your decisions and tactics can make them succeed in this entertaining card game.

Setup: At the beginning sort all the cards by color. Each players chooses a certain color. The optional characters (negative numbers) can be used or can be excluded from the deck at your will. For the first few playthroughs, until you get familiar with the characters and game mechanics, it’s best to play without the optional characters. Each player shuffles all of their cards, deal out 4 cards for their hands and placing the rest face down in front of them. Place the Entrance card on the table and in clockwise order the players begin to put their cards one-by-one next to the Entrance card.
Gameplay: (each step is mandatory)

Place a card
Execute the action for character of the placed card
Execute starred characters’ actions in the queue from back to front. In every turn each character executes their action once, hence if a starred card is placed during the turn then its action won’t be executed again.
Draw a card if you have less than 4 cards in hand.
If there are at least 5 cards in the queue then the first 2 cards enters the Saloon. At the end of the game (even if Thief is in the queue) when all of the cards are played out the first card of the last queue enters the Saloon and the others go to the Cemetery. Cards are collected facing down.
If the color of the last card of the queue doesn’t match the color of one of the cards which enters the Saloon then the last card walks sadly to the Cemetery. Optional rule: The player whose character walked to the cemetery is allowed (but not compulsorily) to draw one card from one of their opponent’s hand if this opponent holds at least 4 cards in their hand. The player puts the drawn card facing up in front of the opponent. The opponent must play out this drawn card in their next turn. Card can not be drawn from opponent who already has a drawn card in front of them.




Ending: Game ends when all of the cards are played out. The player who has the most characters in the Saloon wins. If several players end up with a tie then the player whose characters in the saloon have the lowest overall values wins.

179284.name: Torpéo Inanem
179284.description:
From publisher blurb:

Torpeo Inanem is a story roleplaying game about existentialism and the surreal realities of the human mind. Players take on the roles of characters inside the subconscious of a comatose woman — Tanya Bennett — who has been asleep for over 10 years. These characters spend their existence trying to wake her from unending dreams and nightmares, while simultaneously warring with Hekate for her soul. In the end, can they stop Hekate? Or will the end come without Tanya ever knowing she was part of such a hellish game?

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

179285.name: Thrilling Powers
179285.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thrilling Powers offers you lots of inspiration for your next campaign of Worlds in Peril. This supplement features dozens of pre-made powers for you to use as presented or to tweak to your own preference. Following the powers section there's a team of four pre-generated heroes, each with a fully-fleshed nemesis as well as an arch-villain to defeat.

A time travel-themed campaign outline gives you, the EiC, a place to start with a group of new players. This book is designed to provide enough inspiration for you to take the story in whichever direction you desire!

Thanks to the intuitive nature of the powers from Worlds in Peril, GMs of virtually any game system can use this book for their own supers game.

179286.name: A Subtle Change
179286.description:
From publisher blurb:

There could be one standing beside you and you'd never know it. Walking the subtle path through life, doppelgangers have a reputation for being cruel, but is it one that is earned?

New feats, spells, alchemic discoveries, and lore all designed for doppelganger ponies!

179287.name: Gods and Monsters
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
179287.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is young and majestic, and humans eke out a living and dream of civilization.

But you are not like them: you are a god. A primal creature, your soul a blazing font of power, your body an expression of your nature. The more extreme your behavior the greater the power you can wield—but it is easy to become lost in a single facet of your existence and cross the line from god to monster.

Perform mythic acts, skirmish with rival pantheons, and walk the line between power and control in this Fate World of Adventure by Chris Longhurst.

Gods and Monsters requires Fate Core or Fate Accelerated to play. This 50-page supplement contains:

A new campaign structure that separates play into tales, allowing for gameplay to affect the world at large




World creation ideas, with basic structures for sub-regions and communities

Character creation systems for gods, including divine mantles, intention, and epic stunts
A sliding scale of opposing approaches allows characters to change during gameplay
A variety of introductory tales to get you started




Gods and Monsters. What will your legacy be?

179288.name: The Rocker
179288.description:
From publisher blurb:

What does your White Star game need? ROCK AND ROLL, BABY!
A Rocker inspires a crowd to REVOLUTION with a Crimson Arachnid on bass and Doktor Hailstorm on drums, but can the group escape a dread Space Mummy in time to face a corrupt Void Rocker in a galactic Battle of the Bands? Buy this supplement to find out!

The Rocker contains a new player character class and four new aliens inspired by THE POWER OF ROCK for White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying, Swords and Wizardry WhiteBox, and any other old school game, particularly those with a modern or science fiction flair! Or cross genres, because a Rocker is way more awesome than any bard!

This supplement is perfect for fans of Subatomic Party Girls, Rock and Rule, Operation: Mindcrime, Buckaroo Bonzai, Gwar, Doctor Octagon, Silverhawks, Kidd Video, Limozeen, Metalocalypse, Ziggy Stardust, Jem, and, yes, even Josie and the Pussycats in Outer Space! And that's just for starters! Buy now, or listen to elevator music in the Void for eternity!

179289.name: Wolfsbane Hollow
179289.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shielded to the north by the lofty peaks of the Vurdfell Spine and protected from the hordelands of the east by the Greatshadow Gorge, the town of Wolfsbane Hollow has persisted in relative isolation for hundreds of years. Seemingly a simple border town, a dark shadow hangs over this hard, rough settlement. For here, the rule of law is tenuous at best, and the mayor is but a figurehead. The true power of Wolfsbane Hollow is the shadowy thieves’ guild and their monstrous, bestial guild master who lurks in his lair carved from the fallen bones of an ancient empire.

179290.name: Sea Bitch
179290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perched hard against steep cliffs and protected on the landward side by an earth ditch and berm, the small fishing village of Sea Bitch is a windy place. Founded fifteen years ago by the all-female crew of the eponymous pirate vessel, its inhabitants are famed for the trained eagles they use to hunt the seabirds nestling in the nearby cliffs.

Sea Bitch is known all along the coast as a place of shelter for women of all races fleeing from brutish, bullying husbands. But now the village is under threat–a warlike tribe of orcs have taken up residence in an ancient fortress in the nearby woods and Sea Bitch’s spiritual leader, the druid and ex-pirate Allindra Squallweather, has been spreading rumours of lost orcish treasure in the hopes of attracting fearless adventurers to the village.

179291.name: Trade Town
179291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features, NPCs and minor encounters to add to the trade towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Trade Town is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Trade Town presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the sights and sounds of a trade town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample business found in a trade town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample folk found in a trade town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

179292.name: Sins of the Father
179292.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon Games is happy to make your life a bit more horrible…

Seven centuries ago, the Christian kingdoms of Denmark, Poland, and Sweden conducted a series of crusades against the pagan lands around the shores of the Baltic Sea. These kingdoms were aided by Catholic military orders from Germany. When the Latgalian tribe decided to side with the crusaders, their leaders converted from the Eastern Orthodox church to Roman Catholicism. However, there were those among the tribe that still clung to their traditional religion and refused baptism. The medicine man Izcacus was one of the pagans who resisted the crusaders, and he paid a terrible price for it.

179293.name: Its Ravenous Light Craves All Things
179293.description:
From publisher blurb:

A blazing islet. The incandescent beacon which now rages atop its lighthouse is an unsetting sun throwing deep shadow for leagues and raising a wind which draws into its swirling haze the unsecured, the inquisitive and the opportunist.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted islet as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including various arrivals, a weakened lighthouse, vessel and floor contents and a liminal material.

The surrounding airs and waters could be detailed using Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid, while the seafarers could be developed using Character: More or Less Promising Olde Worlde Adventurers.

179294.name: The Samsonoids (Supers!)
179294.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planet X is a peaceful wilderness worlds. However, its placid existence is often threatened by space pirates lurned by rumors of its abundant resources and its mysterious ancient ruins.

Who will defend Planet X from these invaders?

The Samsonoids!

Adelar the thunderbird
Kamex the massive rock bear
Yasho the psychic T-rex
Vreem the Shapeless




With Zardrok their leader, they unite to protect their home, Planet X!

These SUPERS! characters are ready for use in your cosmic ICONS games immediately as heroes, allies or antagonists.

179295.name: Lord Krang (Supers!)
179295.description:
From publisher blurb:

Krang is the despotic ruler of the Krobon Space Empire.

He rules his territory with an iron fist -(although he secretly enjoys the chaos that the occasional revolt brings.)

A cunning and intelligent adversary with a vast intellect and massive resources at his command - Krang is ready to be an engaging villain in any cosmic SUPERS! game.

Included in this issue of Space Supers are Krang, Krobon Stormtroopers, Moloid Attendants and Krang's telepathic head of Secret Police - Colonel Asoriz

179296.name: Starburst Sentinels (Supers!)
179296.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need some Ooga-Chaka in your game? Well - The Starburst Sentinels are a rag-tag band of cosmic adventurers. They're statted up and ready for action in your SUPERS! game as PCs, allies or even antagonists.

Meta-Prince - Roguish former pirate who leads the Sentinels
Cosmic Coati - Fuzzy, cute and very dangerous
Klim - Sentient tree who is the heart of the Sentinels
Vaxon - A stern warrior on a mission of vengeance
Barata - One of the most deadly assassins in the galaxy

179297.name: Random Aliens!
179297.description:
From publisher blurb:

Alien Brutes and Alien Mystics are fine and dandy, but you’re going to want some more aliens to flesh out your galaxy. White Star is a great tool kit, and this is another tool for you to add to that kit!

This supplement provides a step-by-step series of random tables to create new aliens for use by players or Referees. It also includes five pregenerated and illustrated sample aliens created using that very system for you to use in your campaign.

The Hyperspace Messenger is a series of short supplements designed for use with the White Star role-playing game, though it uses simple concepts which can easily be integrated into any OSR-style science fiction game. The goal is to deliver quality supplements exploring a single concept all within the span of only six-to-twelve pages. Okay - I guess I got a little carried away with this one and went to 16 pages, but only because I was having fun rolling up aliens!

179298.name: Smuggler Guide
179298.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whenever people and goods are hindered from crossing a border, there are smugglers trying to bypass such control. The smuggler guide leads small groups of creatures through dangerous territory to their goal. This is useful to both freedom fighters and criminals, and the line is often hard to draw.

Prestige Class: Bellflower Tiller.
Build Classes: Ranger.

Role: Smuggler guides lead small groups of travelers in the wilderness, keeping them hidden and protecting them from danger.

179299.name: Stalwart Defender
179299.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stalwart defenders are masters of claiming an area and refusing to relinquish it. This behavior is more than a tactical decision for stalwart defenders; it’s an obsessive, stubborn expression of the need to be undefeated. When stalwart defenders set themselves in a defensive stance, they place their whole effort into weathering whatever foe, conflict, or threat comes their way.

Prestige Class: Stalwart defender from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Player’s Guide.

Role: Stalwart defenders are masters of melee combat, striving to prove that the best offense is a good defense. Stalwart defenders are normally found on the front lines of battle, holding a position to cover their allies, leaping into breaches of opposing formations and holding them open for others, and guarding more vulnerable allies by acting as mobile fortifications, stable points in the everchanging chaos of battle.

179300.name: Permafrost (ICONS)
179300.description:
From publisher blurb:

An experiment gone wrong transformed a mild mannered scientist into a dynamo of super powered cold. The mishap also twisted his mind as he now sees his new powers as motive and means to continue his twisted research as Permafrost!

Enemy Strike Files are character packs detailing a villainous threat for your Icons Assembled games. The Enemies are extensively detailed so that they can be seamlessly integrated into your games; from a one-shot to an ongoing campaign.

179301.name: Goblins in the Brewery
179301.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beer, Blood, Fire and Vomit!

A SPECIAL CONVENTION ADVENTURE

Goblin thirst drives an army of raiders to the Causeway Hill brewery temple of Ninkash with torch and blade. Who could have brought so many tribes together and what other savage plans do they have for the people of the Smolten Hills?

Our heroes must face fierce goblin cavalrymen as fire lights the town in an orange glow as the raiders run amuck and make no secret they are there to steal the beer.

The PCs journey into the brewery where the goblins are beginning to focus more on drinking the kegs than carrying them off. Up through the basements they travel as screams of the tortured and burning brewer-monks fill the night. The raid leader is a new monster, a one-horned goblin oni that lives only for her next drink and acts of sadistic violence.

If the PCs do not stop her, she will make off with most of the year’s profits, wagonloads of brew, and leave the small town to starve. The PCs must save the brewery’s monks in this hopsfilled Pathfinder RPG module designed for four 1st-level characters.

179302.description:
Fatesworn is an expansion to Foretold: Rise of a God in which players take on the role of a deity who gathers followers, builds a temple and then smites rival gods. Foretold is a deck-building game with a tower defense element. During the game you may purchase cards or tiles from the Marketplace to grow your followers and your temple. Players may raid a rivals temple and if they get past defenses, roll a mighty smite die to deal damage. You win the game if you build a full set of 4 aligned Fate Relics or your rivals life points drop to zero.

Fatesworn features a number of new and exciting additions to Foretold: Rise of a God including cards that count as having every Fate alignment type and powerful new relics. It adds a new game mechanism called Decree. While a card with Decree is in the Marketplace, its Decree ability is active and affects game play.
179302.name: Foretold: Fatesworn
boardgamepodcastepisode: CnC - Interview With Jay Semerad

179303.description:
In Cthulhu Realms, each player tries to reduce their opponents to insanity or have more sanity than their opponents when the deck runs out.

Each player starts the game with a small deck comprised of initiates, goons and followers. Five cards from the deck form a row of available cards on the table; with more than two players, place three available cards between each pair of players.

Each turn, you start with five cards in hand, playing those cards in order to put locations into play, boost your own sanity or reduce that of others, collect conjuring power to acquire new cards, and remove cards from the game. You can use the power of your locations once each turn. At the end of your turn, discard any cards still in hand and all entities and artifacts that you played.

If you lose all of your sanity, you're out of the game. If you're the only one at the table who's still sane, you win. Otherwise, the game ends when the deck runs out and whoever has the most sanity wins.
179303.name: Cthulhu Realms
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice - Ep. 63 - The Space Between
Ep. 13.5 Board Game Blitz
Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists
Episode 52 - The Prodigals Club
Episode 59- Dark Darker Darkest and Gamer Profiles
Play 2016: le novità ludiche – Il Dado Incantato #5
Vox Republica 103: Spooky Gaming
Vox Republica 104: You Can't Resist Us
WIPNcast 086

179304.name: Fisticuffs!
179304.description:
Fisticuffs! is a free-for-brawl fighting card game created by The Nerdologues, a bunch of people you don’t know but could totally be friends with. Four to six players engage in head-to-head (-to-head-to-head) constant combat until the frenzy peaks and one player emerges victorious.

Set in an alternate 1920s, an eclectic collection of some of the world’s greatest fighters are pitted against each other by the magnanimous Baron Reginald Fistcuffington Smythe aboard his monolithic floating airship. Baron Smythe, inventor of the new super-element Hydrolium, offers the winner of his "Fisticuffs Bouts" the granting of a single wish, whatever their heart desires most. The surviving fighter will get their wish fulfilled - and become champion of Fisticuffs!

Gameplay is simple. Each player picks a fighter from our cast of characters, each with their own backstory and special move. The stable of fighters include a sky pirate, a flapper, a saxo-magician, the son of a slain Chicago mayor, and a robot built by Baron Smythe himself. Every player gives their fiercest battle cry, and whoever’s is best begins the game.

Each player starts with five cards from the Punch Card deck. These Punches will be a fighter’s offense and defense. On a player’s turn, they throw a Punch against any opponent - but that player can Block if they are holding a Punch of the same name. This leaves the attacking player open for a Counter, allowing the defending player to attack with a Punch that is the same color as their Block.

Combat continues until a Punch goes un-Blocked or a Block goes un-Countered. When an attack successfully lands, the defending player loses health. Everybody starts at 12, and when they reach 0, they’re knocked out for the rest of the match. Every remaining player gets a turn each round.

Once a full round (one turn for everybody) has been completed, the fighters return to their corner. This is when you draw new Punch Cards - and when you get a Round Card, a special action that will help provide a tactical advantage by giving you more attacks, depleting an opponent’s defenses, or giving you the edge you need in the middle of combat. The new round begins to the left of the person who started the last round.

The rounds keep going until there are two boxers left, at which point they enter Close Combat - no more rounds, no more Round Cards, just two boxers fighting over one dream. The fighter that is left standing is the winner of the bout and the champion of Fisticuffs!

179306.name: The Silven Trumpeter (Issue 2 - Sep 2003)
179306.description: Gaming tips, Review of NWN: SoU; The Warrior's Edge

179307.name: The Silven Trumpeter (Issue 3 - Oct 2003)
rpgissuearticle: The Annals of Jushaén of Ravenscar
The Ins and Outs of Evil
179307.description: The Ins and Outs of Evil; The Seven Blades of Samanume; Alternative Rewards for Roleplaying; Star's Night - Part 2

179308.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 2 - Spring 2014)
179308.description:
Entradilla de la revista:

Crítico 02.

Publicada en primavera 2014.

Versión física. Versión digital.

60 páginas a color.

Incluye:

Underground: Un metro y Z-Corps. ¿He de decir más? Escrito por Jose Manuel Palacios.

La niña: Una aventura para Fragmentos escrita por Diego López y en donde los jugadores conocerán a una niña de ojos tristes que es más de lo que aparenta.

Fragmentos de la Atlántida: Una aventura con el sistema Hitos, escrita por Javier Fernández Valls. Los jugadores tratarán de salvar a una expedición polar y encontrarán todo un mundo nuevo.

En río revuelto: Una aventura sin sistema, escrita por Fabián Plaza Miranda y ambientada en la Hispania romana.


Publisher blurb

Crítico 02

Published in Spring 2014.

Physical version. Digital version.

60 color pages

It includes:

Underground: The tube and Z-Corps. Need I say any more? Written by Jose Manuel Palacios.

The girl: An adventure written by Diego López for Fragmentos in which the players will know a girl with sad eyes that is more than she appears.

Fragments of Atlantis: An adventure for the Hitos system, written by Javier Fernandez Valls. The players will try to save a polar expedition, finding a whole new world.

In troubled waters: An adventure without system, written by Fabian Miranda Miranda and setted in the Roman Hispania.

179309.name: Syberia: Complete Collection
179309.description:
User Summary

A remastered collection of the two games.

179310.name: DUST Adventures Roleplaying Game
179310.description:
Publisher blurb

The core book features:
- Lots of never-before-seen information on the DUST universe
- Full roleplaying rules including simple character generation for classic archetypes such as soldiers, adventurers and scientists
- Guidance on how to run exciting roleplaying adventures in the DUST universe
- Details of new and existing organisations that the players can be working for or facing in the field
- How to use vehicles and walkers in your games
- Tons of plot seeds and much more
- Introductory Adventure, the prequel to Operation Apocalypse!
- Use your DUST miniatures in the roleplaying game (not required)

179311.name: Norn9: Var Commons
179311.description:
User Summary

There are branching story paths and 24 possible endings.

179312.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 3 - Summer 2014)
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
179312.description:
Entradilla de la revista

Número 03

Publicado en verano 2014

Versión física. Versión digital.

60 páginas a color.

Incluye:

A través de tus ojos: Una aventura para Cthulhu Actual, escrita por Pedro Miguel Perea Cerro, en la que los jugadores tendrán que sobrevivir a un mundo onírico.

Trucos sucios: Consejos para darle emoción a tus partidas de terror. Por Pedro Miguel Perea Cerro.

Place Manor: Una aventura para La Llamada de Cthulhu de Juan Fernando Martin que nos transporta a la América profunda.

A fondo perdido: Una aventura para Tenga, escrita por Vicente J. Pons, donde que unos bienes desaparecidos esconden una ambiciosa conspiración.

En cuerpo y alma: Una aventura para 'Tierras Muertas, escrita por Jorge Mir y David Bueno, que llevará a tus jugadores a un casino en donde perder su dinero será el menor de sus temores.

El tesoro del Torreón Negro: Una aventura para Aventuras en la Marca del Este, escrita por José Francisco Riera, en la que un abandonado torreón resultará no estar tan abandonado


Publisher blurb

Crítico 03

Published in Summer 2014

Physical version. Digital version.

60 color pages

It Includes:

Through your eyes: A Cthulhu Now adventure, written by Pedro Miguel Perea Cerro, where the players will have to survive a dream world.

Dirty tricks: Tips to give excitement to your horror games. Pedro Miguel Perea Cerro.

Place Manor: An adventure for Call of Cthulhu, by Juan Fernando Martin, in that it takes us to the American heartland.

No refunds: An adventure for Tenga written by Vicente J. Pons, in which some missing property hide an ambitious conspiracy.

In Body and Soul: An adventure for Classic Deadlands, written by Jorge Mir and David Bueno. It'll take your players to a casino, where lose their money will be the least of their worries.

The Black Tower's Treasure: An adventure for Adventures in the East Mark, written by José Francisco Riera, where an abandoned tower will be not be so empty.

179313.name: Pipe Trouble
179313.description:
PIPE TROUBLE takes a clever new spin on an arcade classic and puts players in the middle of Big Oil & Gas. In this over-the-top satire you're tasked with building your own pipeline, and trying to balance the financial demands of using the least pipe to make the most money against the impact on the local environment and neighbouring farms.

Source: The Developer Website.

179314.name: DUST Adventures – Operation: Apocalypse
179314.description:
publisher blurb

From a London invaded by Axis forces to the pre-Mayan ruins in the Amazon jungle, from the secrets of the Grand Canyon to a mystery as old as The Bible, Operation: Apocalypse takes you on a whirlwind campaign pitting an elite Allied team against the Axis, SSU, remnant Nazis and a mysterious cult in search of the legendary Seven Seals. Mysteries never before revealed about the Dust backstory are uncovered by the player character’s as they discover new parts of the Dust world and secrets mankind has forgotten for twelve millennia.

Highlights include:
-Details on Dust nations such as America, Turkey, Thailand and the Philippines.
-An expansion on the Dust background and introduction of a new alien species fighting the Vrill!
-The secret history of the two species and their intergalactic war.
-New information on all three blocs including an epic action set-piece on a top secret Axis aircraft carrier.
-Full compatible with Dust Tactics, you can play some of the larger military battles in the game with your miniatures and Dust Tactics or Dust Warfare rules.
-An expansive, deep campaign in the tradition of Masks of Nyarlathotep, Operation: Apocalypse will satisfy old fans and new alike.
-Pre-generated characters to get you playing right away

179315.name: The Talos Principle - Road to Gehenna
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Expansion of the Year Nominee
179315.description:
User Summary

Road to Gehenna is a new story set in the world of The Talos Principle. You play Uriel, Elohim’s messenger, as he explores a hidden part of the simulation. You must free the souls of the damned – even if it requires a sacrifice. Road to Gehenna will consist of 4 episodes.

179316.name: Crítico: La revista de Rol (nº 4 - Fall 2014)
179316.description:
Entradilla de la editorial

Número 04

Publicada en otoño 2014.

Versión física. Versión digital.

68 páginas a color.

Incluye:

La Tumba. Durante unas obras en la gran Constantinopla del siglo X un peligroso monstruo de los tiempos antiguos queda liberado. ¿Se atreverán los personajes a vérselas con él? Una aventura para RuneQuest 6 por M. Alfonso García.
Balas sobre Los Pozos. Un inocente puede ser linchado por un grupo de cowboys en esta aventura para Deadlands Reloaded escrita por Fran Vidal y ambientada en la vieja California.
Lado oscuro. ¿Alguna vez has querido conocer el reverso tenebroso de la fuerza? En esta aventura para Star Wars d20, por Miguel de Andrés, podrás hacerlo.
Nuevas habilidades y trasfondos. Ayudas para La Llamada de Cthulhu por Dani Guzmán.
La vieja canción del Faraón (I). Jorge Mir-Bel y David Bueno nos trasladan al antiguo Egipto para esta aventura de dungeon-crawling para Savage Worlds al más puro estilo old school. En este número veréis la primera parte de la aventura, la segunda saldrá en Crítico 05.


Publisher blurb

Issue 04

Published in Fall 2014

Physical version. Digital version.

68 color pages

It Includes:

The Tomb. During construction works in the great city of Constantinople, turning the 10th century, a dangerous monster of ancient times is released. would the characters dare to stand up? An adventure for RuneQuest 6 by M. Alfonso Garcia.
Bullets Over Los Pozos. An innocent can be lynched by a group of cowboys in this adventure for Deadlands Reloaded written by Fran Vidal, and set in the old California.
Dark side. Have you ever wanted to know the dark side of the force? In this adventure for Star Wars d20, by Miguel de Andrés, you'll do it.
New skills and backgrounds. Game aid for Call of Cthulhu by Dani Guzman.
The old Song of the Pharaoh (I), By Jorge Mir-Bel and David Bueno. It transports us to the ancient Egypt int this dungeon-crawling adventure for Savage Worlds in the style of old school. In this issue you only will see the first part of the adventure, the second will come in Critical 05.

179317.name: The Talos Principle: Deluxe Edition
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
videogamecompilation: The Talos Principle - Road to Gehenna
179317.description:
User Summary

Comes with the main game and its expansion.

179318.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 5 - Winter 2015)
179318.description:
Entradilla de la editorial

Número 05

Publicado en Invierno de 2015

Versión física. Versión digital.

72 páginas a todo color

Incluye:

Corte de picos, plumas y garras. Un encuentro fortuito dará a los personajes la oportunidad de trabajar para el Rey de las Águilas. Una aventura para El Anillo único por Enric Muraday.
El Gran Golpe. Un sistema de reglas genérico que te ayudará a planificar una partida en la que los jugadores deban robar algo. Por M. Alfonso García.
El Sistema d13. Mediterranean’s Thirteen. Este número introducimos una tira cómica, basada en uno de los artículos de la revista, en este caso El Golpe. Por Joan Tretze.
Travesía al olvido. Una serie de sospechosas muertes en el lago Ontario mostrará a los jugadores más horrores de los que pueden imaginar. Esta aventura resulta ideal para iniciar una campaña en las tierras de los sueños. Una aventura para La llamada de Cthulhu, por Gica Sabinescu.
El rincón del experto: Incendios forestales. Iniciamos una nueva sección decidida por los socios. En cada número tendremos a un experto en algún área que también sea rolero y que nos hable de como tratarlo de una forma seria y sencilla. Este número contamos con Diana Damas de Diego, ingeniera forestal y jugadora de rol desde hace muchos años que nos hablará sobre los incendios forestales y como tratarlos en una partida de rol.
La vieja canción del Faraón (y II). Finaliza la aventura iniciada en Crítico 04, para Savage Worlds y escrita por Jorge Mir-Bel y David Bueno


publisher blurb

Issue 05

Published in Winter 2015

Physical version. Digital version.

72 color pages

It Includes:

Court of Beaks, Feathers and Claws. A random encounter will give the characters one opportunity to work for the King of Eagles. An adventure for the One Ring RPG by Enric Muraday.
The Grand Heist. A set of generic rules that will help you plan a game in which the players must steal something. M. Alfonso Garcia.
The d13 System: Mediterranean's Thirteen. This number introduce a comic strip based on one of the articles of the magazine, in this case The Grand Heist. By Joan Tretze.
Cruise into oblivion. A series of suspicious deaths in Lake Ontario show players more horrors than they can imagine. This adventure is ideal to start a campaign on the Dreamlands. An adventure for The Call of Cthulhu by Gica Sabinescu.
The Expert Corner: Wildfires. We started a new section determined by our subscribers. Each issue will have an expert in some area and roleplayer. He'll talk easely and understably about its work and RPG's use. In this number, we have Diana Damas de Diego, forestry engineer and roleplayer for many years that will talk about forest fires and how to treat them in a game.
The Old Song of the Pharaoh (II). Ends the adventure started in Crítico 04 for Savage Worlds. Written by Jorge Mir-Bel and David Bueno.

179319.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 6 - Spring 2015)
179319.description:
Entradilla de la editorial

Número 06

Publicado en Primavera de 2015

Versión física. Versión digital.

68 páginas a todo color

Incluye:

Operación Salamandra. Los estudios sobre tecnología alienígena de un científico japonés ponen en peligro el avance aliado durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Aventura homenaje a las antiguas máquinas recreativas para Savage Worlds, por M. Alfonso García.
Infierno en Gaza. Un grupo de palestinos se ven envueltos en antiguo conflicto que podrá cambiar sus vidas, y la de su pueblo, para siempre. Aventura sin sistema por Jorge Coto Bautista.
La torre de los siete jorobados. Un profesor universitario gaditano se ha suicidado… Una muchacha inocente se enfrenta a un terrible destino. ¿Podrán los personajes evitarlo? Una aventura para El Rastro de Cthulhu por María Robledo Catalán.
El Sistema d13: Saber prohibido. Una tira cómica de Joan Tretze.
El rincón de los expertos: El arquero en el rol fantástico-medieval. Dos ilustres roleros y arqueros nos aclaran mitos y realidades sobre este arma. Por Pablo Ruiz Múzquiz y Angela Rivera Campos.


Publisher Blurb

Issue 06

Published in Spring 2015

Physical version. Digital version.

68 color pages

It Includes:

Operation Salmander, adventure for Savage Words by M. Alfonso García. Studies on alien technology from a Japanese scientist endanger the Allied advance during World War II. Homage to the old arcade machines.
Hell on Gaza. Generic Modern Horror adventure by Jorge Coto Bautista. A group of Palestinians are caught in old conflict that can change their lives, and that of his people, forever.
The tower of the seven hunchbacks. A professor from the Cadiz University has committed suicide ... An innocent girl facing a terrible destiny. Can the characters avoid it? An adventure for The Trail of Cthulhu by Maria Robledo Catalán.
The d13 System: Forbidden Knowledge. Comic Strip by Joan Tretze.
The Expert Corner: The archer in the fantasty or medieval world. Two illustrious roleplayers and archers clarify myths and realities about this weapon. Pablo Ruiz Muzquiz and Angela Rivera Campos.

179320.name: High Command Rapid Engagement
179320.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Iron Kingdoms, where magic and technology have combined to shape the course of history, the imperialistic nation of Khador wages war against the enigmatic Circle Orboros in a clash of steel and gunpowder versus fang and claw. Only one will claim ultimate victory.

High Command Rapid Engagement is a two-player deck-building card game in which players raise and lead mighty armies to capture strategic objectives across the Iron Kingdoms. Leverage your resources and command your forces to set your banner above all western Immoren!

This box contains game rules and 132 cards, including:

2 Pre-constructed Army Decks: Khador and Circle Orboros
1 Winds of War Deck detailing the events that shape the continental conflict
1 NEW Location Deck featuring key cities and landmarks across the Iron Kingdoms

179321.name: The Silven Trumpeter (Issue 4 - Nov 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Earl Munster on the Glorius Nature of Curses
Will, the Word and the Way
179321.description: Antipodean Adventures: Ned Kelly; Todd Lockwood Interview; Through the Lens of History

179322.name: Healing Blade: Defenders of Soma
179322.description:
The world of Soma is under siege by the Lords of Pestilence. Hideous invaders like Anthrax, Pertussis, Cholera, and the Black Death are running rampant inside the country’s borders, attempting to murder innocents. The only hope for these helpless villagers is that the Apothecary Healers, their god-like saviors, will save them. Led by ancient warriors Penicillin, Cipro, and Tetracycline, the Apothecary Healers rush into battle, destroying wave after wave of attacker just in the knick of time. Yet it’s not that simple: the Apothecary Healers have different specialties, and must be deployed in a sophisticated manner. And worse: the invaders learn quickly how to resist and evade the Apothecary powers, and some become even stronger when they are struck down.

Healing Blade: Defenders of Soma immerses you in a fantasy realm that represents the real world struggle against infectious disease and bacterial resistance. It’s a two player card game wherein one player attacks with bacteria, and the other defends with antibiotics. The game requires no prior knowledge of medicine, yet accurately reflects the current state of actual antibiotic use against the most common and most feared bacterial infections. Designed in a collaboration between hardcore gamers and practicing physicians, Defenders of Soma offers a complex strategic gameplay experience, while also increasing familiarity with today’s medical quandries in the face of waning antibiotic effectiveness.

179325.name: Red Rock Valley
179325.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 256th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features part of a rocky desert landscape.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

179326.name: Monster Slayers: The Champions of the Elements
179326.description:
From the publisher's web site:

Monster Slayers: The Champions of the Elements captures the flavor of the Dungeons & Dragons tabletop roleplaying game in one fast-paced, action-packed package for kids who want to learn the fundamentals of the game. It’s also a fun diversion for experienced players who need their D&D fix, but don’t have the time for a full-length game.

The Champions of the Elements requires no previous knowledge of Dungeons & Dragons, and all you need to play is included in this adventure, aside from a few dice, pencils, and some future roleplayers to play it with.

179327.name: Business 2000
179327.description:
Business 2000 is a board game you can play with the whole family or with friends. The game was first released in 1989. The rules of the game are very similar to the well-known series of Monopoly board games . Therefore, a person who had ever played Monopoly, will quickly adapt to the rules of Business 2000.

Business 2000 is an economic strategy that contributes to the development of logic and observation, responsibility for decision making and ability to predict results.

It is a roll-and-move game, where the participants throw the dice and walk around the perimeter of the playing field. They buy or sell various properties, companies and even entire industries. The players can also develop their property.

The players have the right to trade and negotiate with each other at any time. The ultimate goal is to drive opponents into bankruptcy. The main differences from the Monopoly series are special fields and action cards, that have specific rules, namely the "Casino" and "Hippodrome" fields and the "Shares" special action cards, that increase a player's income every turn.

179328.name: Lethal League
179328.description:
In Lethal League, up to four players face off against each other in an arena. The goal is to hit a baseball back and forth, and have the ball hit other players until there's only one player left. With each consecutive hit, the ball will speed up more, making it harder for the other players to not get hit and hit the ball back.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lethal League", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179329.name: Her Story
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee

2015 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee
