2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Best Story of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Sprite Award Nominee
2016 Emotional Games Best Mobile & Handheld Winner
2016 Emotional Games Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2016 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Winner
2016 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Winner
2016 SXSW Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2016 SXSW Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
179329.description:
In 1994 a British woman is interviewed seven times about her missing husband. This is her story.

Her Story is the new game for PC, Mac and iOS from Sam Barlow, creator of Silent Hill: Shattered Memories and Aisle. A crime fiction game with non-linear storytelling, Her Story revolves around a police database full of live action video footage. It stars Viva Seifert, actress and one half of the band Joe Gideon and the Shark.

Source: The Developer Website.

179330.name: Star Tech: Space Ship, Sci-fi, and Alien Equipment and Guidelines
179330.description:
From publisher blurb:

Star Tech is a supplement for the Covert Ops™ Role-Playing game rules that makes it easy to add outer space and Sci-Fi elements to your game, or to run a more Sci-Fi type of campaign. The equipment, weapons and guidelines in this supplement; when combined with the rules and mechanics in Covert Ops™, will allow you to take your role-playing into space with ease. Create and battle with upgraded space vehicles, outfit with new sci tech equipment and weapons, make droids and alien characters. Take your game to the stars.

179331.name: Cardain's Creature Collection
179331.description:
From publisher blurb:

30 New creatures for use with the BareBones Fantasy Role-playing game. Each with stats and information in the spirit of the BBF core rulebook. Add more varitey and diversity to your BareBones Fantasy adventures with some new monsters. Now with a quick visual index of the creatures. Including creatures that are suitable for many different types of areas and that can be easily modified.

179332.name: The Silven Trumpeter (Issue 5 - Dec 2003)
rpgissuearticle: The Annals of Jushaén of Ravenscar
179332.description: Chris Pramas Interview; RPG Comedy; Best Served Cold - Monsters that'll make you shiver

179333.name: Yargo
179333.description:
Yargo is turn-based, strategic battle game for two players. Each player controls a ship with one captain, a pirate crew, and a cheeky monkey. Fight from ship to ship and find out who is the true master of the seas. Basic gameplay structure as follows:


Players start every turn with 4 coins
On your turn, spend your coins on actions from the action menu
Many actions require you to flip a coin to determine outcome
Once you've spent all your coins, it's your opponents turn
The winner is the last crew standing

179334.name: Ninja Schoolgirls Vs Zombies
179334.description:
A horde of zombies has invaded your secret ninja school. Many fellow ninja students have died all around you. You ran and found shelter for a brief moment, and have now gathered your Ki Energy and your resolve to escape from your current hiding place. Before venturing out into a potentially hostile world overrun with undead you are determined to gather some items to build your confidence to face the nightmare. Grab some things and get out as soon as possible. Good Luck!

The game is designed to run on Six-Sided Dice and can be played in a solo/survival mode. Each player will want to have 2 Six-Sided dice to use as counters on their Character sheets, 1 for Ki Energy and the other for Zombie Stalkers that are looking to rip the Ninja Schoolgirl into itty bitty pieces if only they could get their hands on the lithe and sneaky Ninja.

A community of 3-4 Six-Sided Dice can be shared in turn order to the active player. The typical Action Roll will use 2 Six-Sided Dice. The extra Di can be purchased with Ki Energy Points that are gained mostly through successfully eliminating a Zombie Stalker.

After that it is up to you to run around the school acquiring items that give you Confidence enough to leave the school. Whoever has the most Confidence at the end, wins the game! Who will be the most Confident Ninja? If anyone actually lives that is…

179336.name: Neko Atsume
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
179336.description:
User Summary

Neko atsume roughly translates to "cats collected" and this is an apt summary of the game. Players have a backyard typical of suburban Japan; by setting out food and cat toys, various (around twenty different) neighborhood cats come to do what cats do: play, sleep, and generally hang around. Players can take and collect photos of each cat in a notebook. Cats visit whether the player observes them or not, and they "pay" the player in sardines–the in-game currency–left behind when they leave (sardines can also be purchased with real money via microtransactions). Sardines are used to buy new foods and cat toys to attract more cats.

At this time the bulk of the game's text is Japanese with a peppering of English, but thanks to a tutorial and a graphics-heavy interface, it's easy to pick up and learn without any reading necessary.

179337.name: Gods of Adventure
179337.description:
In Gods of Adventure players take on the roles of classical Gods who together influence the motivations and emotions of a group of eight fantasy adventurers, slaying creatures and overcoming obstacles. However, unlike many Richard Launius games, Gods of Adventure is not a coop.

The game plays either 3 or 4 players. Every God's (player) deck is identical except for color and another small but important detail: the spoken words on the cards for each hero (divided by color) are all different, reflecting your temperament based on the God you are playing. Each player will have a unique power associated with your temperament. The four temperaments are associated with Greed, Good Fortune, Aggression, and Deceit.

179341.name: Europa Universalis IV: Common Sense
179341.description:
Common Sense is the fifth major expansion for Europa Universalis IV and focuses on diplomacy and the internal development of nations. This addition allows you to peacefully develop your nation and build a 'tall' empire, whilst also giving you the tools to execute grand diplomacy. Game changing religious features add depth and intriguing complexity to the gameplay.

The ability to work closely with your subjects and better control them through interactions and decrees should make common sense for anyone with designs to get to terms with the internal struggles of constitutional monarchies.

Main Features:

New Religious Gameplay: New mechanics for Protestants and Buddhists deepen the religious gameplay. Protestants acquire the ability to create their own national church by gaining religious tradition, whilst Buddhists must maintain balance between high and low karma (high karma ruler becomes detached from the world, while a low karma ruler loses trust of their soldiers)
Devotion: Theocracies have Devotion based on how closely they adhere to their faith, with high Devotion increasing prestige, papal influence and tax income. Theocracies choose their successors from 6 different alternatives, such as an influential preacher or a noble's son.
Subject Interactions: Over 15 new special actions that can be taken towards subjects, such as installing your own dynasty on the thrones of your vassals.
Parliament: Parliamentary rule for constitutional republics and monarchs, and a special parliamentary government for England. Grant your provinces seat in parliament and bribe them to vote on issues that strengthen your nation.
Provincial Improvements: Develop the tax, manpower and goods production of your empire by spending monarch power.
Free Cities of the HRE: Small nations in the Holy Roman Empire can be granted the status of Free City.
Government Ranks: All nations are ranked, from small Duchies to great Empires, and can increase their government rank as they grow in power.




Source: The Publisher Website.

179343.name: Crusader Kings II: Horse Lords
179343.description:
The sound of hoof beats echoes across the plain, and you can see the dust kicked up by their approach hours before the first arrow falls. You have heard about this demonic army of master horsemen for years, laying waste to everything before them. Sheikhs and Caliphs and Tsars have failed to stop their progress. The tumult can only mean one thing.

The Horse Lords are coming to Crusader Kings II.

The nomadic invasions of the Mongol and Turkic steppe tribes transformed the history of Europe, the Near East and much of Asia. Genghiz Khan built the largest contiguous land empire the world has ever seen. And now Paradox Development Studios brings you the clan politics, the mighty hordes and the migratory push for new lands that will bring this exciting and vibrant culture to life.

Source: The Publisher Website.

179349.name: Abenteur Tierwelt
179349.description:
Find the right animals! What are those with hairs? Which can swim? Listen carefully! To which animal belongs every cry: was it a wild boar or a seal? Become trackers purposes! Which animal has left these footprints? Categorize the animals by various characteristics. Is a frog heavier than a mouse? What maximum speed can reach the elephant?
With tiptoi, young zoo visitors develop their knowledge of domestic and wild animals!

Retrouve les bons animaux ! Quels sont ceux qui ont des poils, lesquels savent nager ? Tendez bien l’oreille ! À quel animal appartient chaque cri : était-ce un sanglier ou un phoque ? Devenez de fins pisteurs ! Quel animal a laissé ces empreintes ? Classez les animaux selon diverses caractéristiques. Une grenouille est-elle plus lourde qu’une souris ? Quelle vitesse maximale peut atteindre l’éléphant ?
Avec tiptoi®, les jeunes visiteurs du zoo développent leurs connaissances sur les animaux domestiques et sauvages !

179350.description:
Bretagne is a worker placement game in which players must build lighthouses on the coast of Bretagne in the 19th century.

On each turn, players take actions, such as using resources to build; trading resources, cards or money; or hiring workers or engineers.

Players can choose to score points immediately when they build or decide not to do it and to participate in the final evaluation of the lighthouse. If they score immediately, they have guaranteed themselves some points; if they wait, they could reach higher scores or send workers to harbors to earn extra bonuses for the remaining rounds.
179350.name: Bretagne
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 81 -- Eating Cake in Bellevue (Part B, the Second)
Episode 83 -- All Ramshackle and Worry Free
Essen 2015 - Post Scriptum
Garrett's Games 500 - Best of 2015 + Contest Resolution!
Heavy Cardboard Episode 41 – Lignum

179351.name: Deadly Puzzles: Toymaker
179351.description:
"Deadly Puzzles: Toymaker" is a hidden object game featuring challenging hidden object scenes and a thrilling crime story about a quiet town shaken by a series of murders.

When a mysterious serial killer begins murdering young women, authorities are left running in circles trying to figure out the madman’s devious games. His grim calling card is the strange toys he leaves at the crime scenes, leading the media to nickname the killer “Toymaker.”

The detective leading the investigation sees no hope in catching the madman, until everything changes when he receives a package from the killer himself containing a video.

To find the psychopath, our heroine must examine crime scenes for clues left by the killer, and find the plot connecting each of the Toymaker’s victims.

Does accepting the killer’s challenge mean taking on a race against time she is sure to lose? Will she discover the killer’s identity and stop him from committing another gruesome murder? Or has she only put herself in his sights?

Source: [http://www.artifexmundi.com/page/toymaker/# The Developer Website].

179352.name: Raising the Flags
179352.description:
After a long journey crossing never-ending wild seas, the colonies reached a wonderful and prosperous island… The rush of power began quickly after… And, the battle for conquering the island to prove who was the master of this mysterious island… Colonies started to expand their own territories by acquiring more lands… And, to flourish by harvesting resources... However, the resources were limited … And, industrialization was inevitably ahead… So, at a glance, the faces of tiny villages have been changed to modern cities… Colonies rapidly developed new cities, built massive factories, used airplanes to collect the resources, and scratched the sky with their high-rise business centers... The danger of foreigners was always around… Hence, the incomers funded the costly militaries to protect their people… War was not always an option… Thus, they established diplomacy and started trading with their neighbors… Famine lead to demand for more lands… So, the settlers were convinced to invade new lands and raise their own flags on them… And now this is the question: whose flags will remain waving on the horizon?

Raising the Flags is a strategic board game where every player is a leader of a colony. The winner of the game is the one who creates the most prosperous territory. The game occurs on an island containing various lands and cities. Each player begins the adventure by selecting a capital city and raising the main flag on it. Players should expand the territory with the construction of new buildings such as farms, houses, factories, airports and business centers, and by harvesting crude resources including, food, wood, stone and oil. The players also experience negotiation and trading with neighbors, tricking and attacking them…
The game board is an island which contains four different tiles, including sea, resources, lands and cities. Each player starts the game by selecting a city as the own capital city and raises the main flag in that capital city. Then, it is time to expand the territory, construct the buildings, generate and trade resources with other players based on some pre-determined rules. The players expand their territory and raise the land flags on them. Then, they start to construct new building on the own territories. Simultaneous with construction of every new building, the player must select a building flag and raise it on the top of that constructed building. Selection of a flag is according to the player’s own decision, which can be aimed by the logic of probability. When a player rolls two dices, the summation of both dices will make a number. If this number is matched with any flag number on top of any player’s building, the owner player will receive the income of that particular building. Therefore, the territory of each player is expanded according to the optimal construction of the buildings and efficient way of raising the flags. During a gameplay, management of resources/money, planning to expand lands and cities, effective negotiation with neighbors, wise decision to attack other players, defending territory, and of course having a bit of luck will make a player closer to the final victory.

179353.name: Cifra
179353.description:
User summary:
In this game, players advance 1-9 pieces to their opponent's side to compete with all their pieces.

The movement of pieces is determined by the pattern of the tiles making up the board. Prior to playing the game, players randomly shuffle the tiles and create a 9x9 board. This is the most distinguishing feature of the game.

As in Chess, players are able to remove　their opponent's pieces from the board, so the strategy involves moving pieces along the board in coordination with one another. A player is able to gain control over the game by reading the pattern of the board and competing in a location that is advantageous to themselves.

Like all games produced by Logy Games, this game is made with ceramic pieces which results in it weighing nearly 2kg.

Publisher's summary:
1～9点の駒を敵陣地まで到達させてその駒の合計点を競うゲームです。
駒の動きはボードタイルのパターンによって制御されるので、プレー前に9×9マスのタイルを自由にシャッフルしてボードのパターンを作るのが最大の特徴です。
チェスのように敵の駒を取ることができるので、駒を連携させながら動かすのが戦術です。
ボードパターンの読んで自分の有利な場所で戦えれば、ゲームをコントロールできます。

179354.name: One Mile of Deception
179354.description:
From publisher blurb:

One Mile of Deception is a story roleplaying game about quiet desperation and its final realization. Characters are 20-something people living in a small, American rural town, which is on the downturn economically and culturally. As the characters piece together their confused and unguided lives, they will face their own fates together… or alone. In the end, they must all walk one mile…

179355.name: Psionics
179355.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add the mystical powers of the mind, Psionics, to your White Star or Swords and Wizardry campaign!

Includes the full Psion character class.

A completely new, non-Vancian systerm for handling psionics.

Communicate with your allies in orbit with your Telepathy.

Consult the Akashic Overmind about the true nature of reality around you!

Burn the brains of your foes with your Mind Assault!

Unlike most OSR based power systems, this system is built to make the Psion able to function side-by-side with characters who have miraculous tech at their fingertips.

179356.name: For Who Dares Cheat Fate Lies in Store
179356.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mouldering pit. Below the wreck of its sculpted capstone a stair winds sodden into gloom where a rancid sump rises, over walls sunk with hollows of life in death. Gibberings echo, and words in unknown tongues.

Condensed to one page for slipping in among other materials, this sandbox-oriented content is intended as an easily absorbed framework for improvisation to be adapted by the user as preferred for a wider setting and specific system.

It presents core ideas and key numbers to fall back on, with general approaches that can be applied in other situations.

The content covers map generation on the fly for an abstracted pit as well as suggestions for aspects of the locality, including occupants, pit structure, a potentially transformative slumber, a surviving builder and accelerated decay.

The pit could be detailed using Elaboration: Structure & Surface and possibly Being: More or Less Fantastical Olde Worlde Technologies, the sump using Elaboration: Atmosphere & Liquid.

179357.name: Crisis in Alfheimer
179357.description:
From publisher blurb:

With Hel's plot unearthed, the Nine Worlds beckon, for somewhere beyond Midgaard lies Odin AllFather's scattered Fimbulwinter Runes! And to stop Hel and bring peace to King Hrolfr's realm, it is left to the intrepid to fetch the runes and return them to Valhalla, before any take note!

From the dark shadows of Svartalfaheimr the trail leads to Alfheimr, the land of the fabled Light Elves, where the Vanir God Freyr reigns! A perpetually spring-like world, surrounded by endless miles of crystalline blue oceans, scenic skies, filled with flocks of birds and a wilderness of high mountains is ill prepared for the chaos of the Fimbulwinter Runes!

Freyr is unaware that two of the Runes have fallen into his world. The adventuring party must find their whereabouts before he or the others in this serene world do, or have the wrath of those who might be following them wreak havoc on them all.

Things in this world are not what they seem, and with the Runes' influence they are even worse. Continue on the journey of the Nine Worlds Saga and plunge into the fabled lands of Alfheimr!

179359.name: Camera Obscura
179359.description:
User Summary

Camera Obscura is an innovative platformer that has a unique "afterimage" mechanic allowing the player to temporarily freeze the world around, using it as additional platforms to help you traverse the tower.

179360.description:
Armor

Traits:
Light Armor
Dragon
Mythic

Check to Acquire:
Constitution / Fortitude 5

Powers: Reveal this card to reduce Fire damage dealt to you to 0, then roll 1d12. On a 1, banish this card.

Bury this card and expend a mythic charge to add 1d20 to your check to defeat a monster.

Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if proficient with light armors, bury this card instead.

"Rawr! I'm a scary dragon!" -Goblin in kobold costume

179366.name: Find It, Say It
179366.description:
Βρες το Πες το (Find It, Say It) is a party game similar to Taboo.

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time. If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game.

There are rules for 2 players as well.

179367.name: Find It, Say It For Children
179367.description:
Βρες το Πες το για παιδιά (Find It, Say It For Children) is a party game similar to Taboo.

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time. If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game.

There are rules for 2 players as well.

179368.name: Find the Word
179368.description:
It's an excellent party game similar to Taboo!

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time! If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game!

179369.name: Historical Ships of Clement Sector 1: Trent Class Destroyer
179369.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the first in a line of products dedicated to the great ships of the Clement Sector setting's past.

The Trent-class destroyer is a reaction drive vessel used by the United States Space Navy in the early days of colonization into Clement Sector. The 1500-tonne destroyer was launched in 2185 to provide security and to protect the United States' fledgling interstellar colonies. The Trent-class was the most capable of the first generation reaction drive interstellar warships.

Historical Ships of Clement Sector 1: Trent comes complete with beautiful views of the Trent as well as full deckplans and statistics to make your use of the product simple, easy, and fun. The book also comes with deck plans and views of the ship's boat and work pod. Also included are adventure seeds to help Referees get their characters involved with the action immediately. Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, the Trent could easily be used in any Traveller setting.

Get on board! Adventure awaits!

179370.name: Secret Spirits
179370.description:
From publisher blurb:

Commune With Exotic and Powerful Spirits

No one knows better than shamans the importance of knowing the right spirit. This class, first introduced in the Advanced Class Guide, communes with spirits on a daily basis, gaining strange and otherworldly powers, as well as access to new and unknown spells, depending on what spirit they choose to commune with. As a result, those shamans who are able to make contact with more spirits have a distinct advantage over those limited to the same spirits known to all shamans.

That’s where this book comes in. Inside, you’ll find three brand new shaman spirits, including the ravages spirit, the rest spirit, and the time spirit. Hateful and venomous things, ravages spirits are embodiments of pestilence, poison, and decay in all things. Use their power to enhance and create poisons and diseases, and to level powerful curses upon your enemies. By contrast, spirits of rest are jolly and agreeable things, that bring comfort and respite. Use them to put your foes to sleep, or to ensure that your party recovers fully from the wounds and fatigue of battle. Finally, the elusive and mysterious time spirits allow shamans to speed themselves and their allies, slow their foes, and even make quick trips through time, including summoning their future self to fight by their side!

179371.name: Advanced Merfolk
179371.description:
From publisher blurb:


Explorers Beneath the Waves

As curious as they are adventurous, merfolk are a race with an insatiable thirst for knowledge. Members of this race constantly explore and seek new discoveries. Now you can play this mysterious race that lives in the waters of your game world. Face new dangers and seek new perils like never before!

Book of Heroic Races: Advanced Merfolk gives you everything you need to play a merfolk character. This 22-page supplement features:

Standard Racial Traits for playing a merfolk, 2 playable subraces, and 6 alternate racial traits to customize your character for this unique play experience
4 New Character Class Options including a new archetype, a new rogue talent, and new bloodrager and sorcerer bloodlines
4 New Feats granting you superior maneuverability and perception underwater
5 New Aquatic-Themed Spells and Psionic Powers
13 New Mundane Items, Alchemical Items, Magic Items, and Artifacts
A New Deity, dedicated to undersea life, the bounty of the sea, and the destructive power of the waves
Details on merfolk adventurers as well as suggestions on how to incorporate this race into your world




Be Heroic with This Advanced Race Today!

179372.name: Aetaltis Bestiary Collection: Owlbear
179372.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a 1,500 pound owlbear rears up on its hind legs in a fighting stance, it stands close to 10 feet tall. Its thick hide is covered with a mixed coat of brown, black, and gray fur and feathers. Each of the creature’s massive paws ends in claws sharp enough to disembowel an unarmored foe with a single swipe. Its body looks like that of a large bear, but its head has the appearance a giant owl’s. Like an owl, the owlbear can extend its neck and turn its head more than 180degrees to seek prey.

179378.description:
In Planetareum Football Star, a Web-Based sports management and simulation game, each user controls a player, deciding what club to join, setting up training schemes, interacting with team mates and shopping at the city to improve their skills, lifestyle and morale in order to become the best football player the world has ever seen!

Users can also later choose to become a club owner, team manager, a reporter or a sports agent.

Source: The Publisher Website.

179380.name: Wer andern eine Grube gräbt ...
179380.description:
The first player to get his two pawns from space 1 to space 90 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6, the player moves a pawn and gets to place a pit to trap his opponents. But beware, some pawns may fall into their own pit. Pawns that fall into a pit have to start at the beginning again.

The game was published between 1922 and 1938.

The first big change is that we will only be releasing...every quarter [March, June, September, December]...issues will be...twice the size...[and] no longer be available as a free download..."

179384.name: Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 Game Master Screen Inserts
rpgitemversion: Landscape GM Screen Insert(s) Print Version
179384.description: Game Master screens that can be slid slid landscape in to a screen holder. Colored.

179385.description:
Description from the publisher:

Rome: City of Marble is a Euro-style tile-laying game set in Ancient Rome during the reign of Augustus Caesar in which players are powerful Patrician families competing to secure the prestigious title of Architect of Rome.

As leading citizens in this great city, they influence and direct the construction of an ever-expanding metropolis through shrewd development of neighborhoods by constructing civic buildings, temples for worship, baths for health and camaraderie, theaters for philosophy and the arts, and arenas for entertainment. Build more and gain Imperium, the measure of real power in Roman society. As Civic buildings are constructed, influential players score points representing their success. Players score extra points for building Bridges, Aqueducts, Fountains and their wealth, with bonus points awarded for Imperium. Veni, vidi, vici!
179385.name: Rome: City of Marble
boardgameexpansion: Rome: City of Marble – Patriarchs & Wild Tiles Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Garrett's Games 493 - R&R Games' Rome: City of Marble and Mombasa

179386.description:
London Markets puts players in the roles of merchants and assistants trying to earn the most profit for their goods. The player who can navigate the markets with ease, being in the right place at the right time to earn the most profit, will become the most respected merchant of the London markets.

The game is a revised and re-themed edition of Dschunke, which was nominated for the German game of the year award in 2002.
179386.name: London Markets

179387.name: Dawn of the Carnosaur
179387.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play carnivorous humanoid dinosaurs.

Animal Races: Dawn of the Carnosaur presents a new race of playable humanoids whose members resemble carnivorous dinosaurs. Noble allosaurids, deadly maniraptors, or brutish megaraptors can all be created using customizable racial traits and racial feats, allowing you to play a wide range of dinosaur-themed humanoids called carnosaurians.

Also included: bestiary entries for the monstrous royalty of the carnosaurian race and a brief history of their wicked empire. A dangerous force in the ancient world, this nation was ultimately destroyed by the gods, but even in campaigns set after the carnosaurians' apparent extinction, they may yet return, revived by imperial necromancers for whom death is but a temporary inconvenience.

179388.name: Dawn of the Cerapod
179388.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play herbivorous humanoid dinosaurs.

Animal Races: Dawn of the Cerapod presents a new race of playable humanoids whose members resemble herbivorous dinosaurs. From agile Bird Feet and surly Bone-Heads to militant Horn-Heads and armor-plated Shield-Bearers, customizable racial traits and racial feats allow you to play a wide range of dinosaur-themed humanoids called cerapods.

Also included: a look at the cerapod race as it existed in ancient times and numerous suggestions for reviving that race in campaigns taking place after its apparent extinction. Worship the collective consciousness of an ancient empire. Visit an extraplanar menegerie designed by mysterious outsiders. Revive a dead race with powerful magic. The history of the cerapods has just begun.

179389.name: Subrace: Tylwyth Elves
179389.description:
From publisher blurb:

The tylwyth are a subrace of winged elves who exude magic in the form of pixie dust. Relatively weak at a young age, the tylwyth grow in power until they gain full use of their wings & the ability to soar through the air. They hail from fantastic, nigh-impossible lands only accessible through magic & the helpful hand of an elfin guide.

179390.description:
Setting: The Year is 2078. The world has changed and will not return to it’s previous state. In 2052 Umbratech, the first major corporation to rise from the ashes of the ecological wars of the mid 40’s grew in power and ambition. With their invention of the world’s first Planetary Core Reactor, located on the undersea Mid-Atlantic Ridge, it was hoped that the world would never again rely on non-renewable sources of energy. However, things did not go as planned. With no knowledge of the deepest crusts scientists blindly drilled to reach the intense heat of the Earth’s Core, relying on theoretical data on the makeup of the Earth’s layers. They were wrong, and a rapid reactor failure ensued, allowing the Earth’s mantle to bleed through the crust. Massive continental shift occurred, along with earthquakes and a total disruption of oceanic ecosystems. A new continent emerged from the ridge, born in a matter of months. Midatlantia, as it was called, was both rich in resources and hotly contested. New ocean currents, melted icecaps, and the worldwide destruction of cities launched a new era on the Earth as world powers fought bitterly for the new and old land alike.

This war was known as the Mid-Atlantic War. By 2057 the war was over, and an alliance of the warring states had been formed to share the land. However, shortly after colonization the Mid-Atlantic Alliance ceded from their mother nations and declared independence, causing worldwide uproar. The troubles of creating a new nation were soon soothed by the vast wealth of Midatlantia, and the world was quickly ready to begin trade despite misgivings about the legitimacy of such a nation.

In 2064, the world’s first, large scale underwater research station was created under the mantle of international cooperation. Recognizing that the ocean held untold secrets which would ultimately benefit mankind, the major nations of the world came together to form the International Maritime Collective. Together, they created the International Oceanic Observatory and Research Facility, often referred to as “The Dome”. This underwater facility was built on the floor of the Mariana trench in the Atlantic Ocean, thousands of feet beneath the surface. It has now been operational for fourteen years. Numerous scientific advances have been achieved through its research and thousands of new species have been cataloged and studied, resulting in cures for many diseases and new technologies that improve the lives of people everywhere. But rumour has it that scientists aboard the station have been conducting unauthorized research as well.

Overview: Fathoms is a cooperative adventure game with miniatures in which a group of players fight against hordes of undersea monsters controlled by a game master. Gameplay is designed to pit players against a changing environment as monsters swarm and water pours through hull breaches. Players advance their characters skills and armament by gaining experience. The game can be played in campaign mode in which a series of missions unfold a storyline, or as one-shot scenarios.

Gameplay: Fathoms begins by one player assuming the role of the Fathom Master, while the others pick from a selection of characters. Both the Fathom Master and the other players earn experience points. Players use it advance their character in skills that benefit either themselves or the whole team and to buy equipment. The Fathom Master uses it to unleash increasing terrors upon the players, such as more monsters or events like hull breaches. Players gain experience when they explore, kill monsters or use computer terminals to perform various tasks. This experience may be used between missions or at equipment lockers. The Fathom Master gains experience by damaging players and may spend it on his turn.

The game board functions as a grid and the line of sight rules are relatively simple. Each player receives two actions which may be divided any way they choose. In any order or repetition a player may move, attack or use an item/door/skill. Turn order is determined by rolling for initiative. Each player has 1 miniature which they maneuver through the rooms on the game board. When new rooms are opened, the Fathom Master places units depending on the number of players he opposes. Some of those units are predetermined while other may be bought with experience to add variability. Each round the Fathom Master follows the mission guide to keep the game evolving.

Modes of Play:
Fathoms offers two modes of play: Campaign mode and Scenarios

There are 7 missions in Campaign mode, all of which are meant to be played sequentially as the story unfolds. Scenarios are one-shot missions that represent possible scenarios that could have occurred over the course of the storyline.

Game End: The game ends when players complete either the Campaign storyline or a one-shot Scenario. The game also ends if all Players are killed during a mission. Players that don't work well with others die, quickly.

Unique Elements: What makes Fathoms different than other adventure games is its use of water as an important game element. As the players progress through the game they encounter pools of water and hull breaches that will flood the map room by room. One simple rule guides the flow of water from room to room, making it simple to work with and compelling in the way it changes the battlefield. In water, weapons may become stronger or weaker, some skills may cease to be effective, and monsters grow stronger and more formidable.

Fathoms also has high-ground, which can give tactical advantage whether a room is dry or flooding with water.
179390.name: Fathoms
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 089 - Sylvion

179391.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by the Italian artist Gipi. These four survivors are from Gipi's card game Bruti. The survivors include:

Donna Carlotta
The Little Prince
Clelia La Santa
Pipino, the Humongous
179391.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Gipi

179392.name: The Collected Magic of Palladium Books
179392.description:
What you hold in your hands is the collected eight issues of "MOP" - better known as The Magic of Palladium Books.

In some ways, MOP was a forerunner to The RifterTM. Like The Rifter™, it had news, coming attractions and special sourcebook type features. The BIG differences were that MOP was only 16 pages, printed on newsprint (a tabloid), a bit smaller than 8 1/2 x II, and cost only 50 cents. It was an inexpensive "give-away" promotional item sold to distributors at below our cost, given to stores and handed out free or sold for 50 cents to garners.

In a lot of ways, the Collected Magic of Palladium is a time capsule. It carne out sporadically from 1988 to 1991. We've reproduced them exactly as they originally appeared (minus the color), including the old advertisements, press releases and everything. The end result is a look back at what we were saying, doing and planning TEN YEARS AGO!

Kevin Siembieda, 1999

-- Part of description from the book Introduction.

179393.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 155 - Jan 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Holiday Mischief (Or, Where Did Jimmy Run Off To?)
Infinity: A Brief Guide to Start Collecting Infinity Part 2
Reiner Knizia’s The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Board Game
Star Wars: The Card Game — The Hoth Cycle
179393.description:
From publisher blurb:

Game Trade Magazine is the leading consumer guide to the Adventure Hobby industry. With previews, reviews, and sneak peeks at upcoming games.

179394.name: General
179394.description:
English:
As a general, each player rules over the regions of influence of his continent. By employing their regions of influence in a carefully considered manner, each general can optimise the fighting power of the army under his command. In battle, each general commands the individual combat units and thereby influences the action. His strategic and tactical conduct determines victory or defeat. The objective is to conquer all regions of influence.

Deutsch:
Als General herrscht jeder Spieler über die Einflussgebiete seines Kontinents. Durch überlegten Einsatz seiner Einflussgebiete optimiert er die Kampfkraft seiner Armee. Im Kampf befehligt er die einzelnen Kampfeinheiten und beeinflusst so das Kampfgeschehen. Sein strategisches und taktisches Vorgehen entscheidet über Sieg oder Niederlage. Ziel ist die Eroberung aller Einflussgebiete.

179395.name: Dragon Kings: Ambientazione
179395.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nei gloriosi tempi che furono, i Re Draghi regnavano benevoli sul mondo di Khitus. Le cittàstato attorno ai Mari Interni prosperavano sotto la loro ala protettiva. Essi consentivano a ogni nazione e a ogni civiltà di sviluppare la propria cultura e tutti i popoli liberi vivevano senza affanni e senza timore.
Ma oggi quei giorni giacciono sepolti sotto una coltre di polvere e di sabbia.

Con il passare dei secoli, i Re Draghi si sono gradualmente allontanati dal mondo, e in loro assenza le forze del male hanno preso il sopravvento. Avidità, guerra e pestilenza affl iggono le terre. I giorni di prosperità sono solo un ricordo sbiadito. Ora dei Re Draghi si parla solo sussurrando, nel timore di incorrere nella loro ira. Il mondo di Khitus viene saccheggiato e privato di ogni cosa di valore. I predoni si impossessano di ogni cosa, dai metalli alle gemme, dalle armi al cibo, e conducono via i deboli dopo averli ridotti in catene. E ora i Re Draghi fanno uso di potenti magie per deviare il corso di interi fi umi e reclamare il possesso delle stesse nuvole, trasformando il mondo in una desolazione inaridita dove regnano le ossa dei defunti e la disperazione.
Khitus è un mondo in cerca di eroi, ma chi è disposto ad affrontare i perfi di Re Draghi?

Dragon Kings è un’originale ambientazione fantasy incentrata su un nuovo genere di lotta tra il bene e il male e su una disperata missione di sopravvivenza in un mondo morente, letteralmente prosciugato delle sue risorse.

Dragon Kings è un’ambientazione indipendente. Il mondo di Khitus, i suoi abitanti e le sue storie sono descritti in termini puramente narrativi e di ambientazione. Tutto il materiale relativo ai sistemi di gioco e alle statistiche è incluso in appendici separate che consentono di usare l’ambientazione per il sistema di gioco di ruolo di vostra scelta: Pathfinder GdR o Savage Worlds. Una formula ideale per chi desideri immergersi puramente nelle atmosfere narrative dell’ambientazione, per chi intenda applicarla al proprio sistema di gioco preferito e per chi voglia esplorare nuove esperienze di gioco.


Translation courtesy of Google:

In the glorious days gone by, the Dragon Kings ruled the world of benevolent Khitus. The cittàstato around the Inner Seas prospered under their wing. They allowed for every nation and every culture to develop their own culture and all free peoples lived without worries and without fear.
But now those days lie buried under a blanket of dust and sand.

Over the centuries, the Dragon Kings have gradually moved away from the world, and in their absence the evil forces have taken over. Greed, war and pestilence affl inflict lands. The days of prosperity are just a faded memory. Now the Kings Draghi speaks only whisper, for fear of incurring their wrath. The world Khitus is looted and deprived of everything of value. Raiders took possession of everything from metals to gems from weapons to food, and leading off the weak after being reduced in chains. And now the Dragon Kings make use of powerful magic to divert the course of entire rivers and reclaim possession of the same clouds, transforming the world into a parched desolation reigns where the bones of the dead and despair.
Khitus is a world in search of heroes, but who is willing to face the perfi of Dragon Kings?

Dragon Kings is an original fantasy setting focused on a new kind of struggle between good and evil and on a desperate mission to survive in a dying world, literally drained of its resources.

Dragon Kings is a setting independent. The world Khitus, its people and its stories are described in purely narrative and setting. All material relating to gaming systems and the statistics is included in separate appendices on how to use the setting for the system role-playing game of your choice: Pathfinder RPG or Savage Worlds. An ideal formula for those who want to immerse themselves in purely narrative atmosphere of the setting, for those who intend to apply it to your favorite gaming system and for those who want to explore new gaming experiences.

179396.name: Dead Things in the Walls
179396.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dead Things in the Walls is a roleplaying game about modern horror and the price we pay for greed. Based on films like Dark Water, The Fog, The Grudge, Hellraiser, and Ringu, this game explores the lives of people trapped in a vicious cycle of terror. Players take on the roles of characters replaying the horrible events that once took place in an aged, and obviously haunted, house. And while they can leave and go on with their lives any time they wish, the cycle cannot end until the dead things in the walls are fed.

179397.name: Victory's Vault Volume 1, Issue 11
179397.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

You can call her "Miss" Wonderra... she represents the Victory Corporation, and if you've got the cash, she'll give you access to their vaults. They've compiled quite a stock of items with one thing in common; they've all proved their value in battle by being on the winner's side. Every item has been literally touched by Victory! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Miss Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

179398.name: PUTREFACTION
179398.description:
User Summary

Putrefaction is a shooter with horror elements, heavily inspired by old-school shooters.

179399.name: Alone in the Dark: Illumination
179399.description:
The game is an up-to-four player cooperative experience with four distinct player characters working together to solve a mystery in an action-horror setting. Some characters wield firearms where as others use magical abilities. Players will make their way through levels with randomly generated elements such as enemy locations, locked doors, or even room layouts to make their way to a safety vault at the end of the level. Throughout it the players will have to fight off various types of enemies by means of firepower and creating light-sources to defeat them.

Source: Wikipedia, "Alone in the Dark: Illumination", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

179401.name: Star Hammer: The Vanguard Prophecy
179401.description:
The Universe is a Dangerous Place

In the 22nd century, we left a dying earth so that a fortunate few could settle the new home we call Novus.

In time, we would learn that life on a frontier colony is neither prosperous nor peaceful. Our first encounter with the nautilid started with hostilities and confusion, and ended with sacrifice. Fourteen years later, our leaders remain politically entangled and unable to see the threats that linger, both afar and within our own walls…

Star Hammer: The Vanguard Prophecy is a game of 3D tactical space battles. Play your part in the Second Contact War in a campaign with a branching story and over 60 missions, or create your own scenarios in skirmish mode battles.

Give your orders, and watch the results in explosive pausable real-time. Tailor your arsenal of crew abilities and assault class ships as your fleet grows with your command. Exploit the enemy’s weaknesses with superior positioning and flanking manoeuvres to inflict devastating damage.

Six classes of assaults ships are yours to command. Make precision strikes with the swift Swordfish Raiders, or lead from the bridge of a hulking Kraken Dreadnought. Change your tactics as you order reinforcements with stun guns, guided missiles, unmanned fighter drones and single-focus DEW beams.

The nautilid threat is as varied as it is innumerable, however, and they will not surrender. Use your wits to overcome the threat of disruption fields, bio-missiles and proximity mines. And not all opposition to your command comes from outside. Raise the shields of your capital ships and engage in devastating broadside combat with the renegade military conspiracists who call themselves the Remnant.

Will you obey the chain of command and strengthen Novus’ defenses, or take your opponents head-on by yourself?

Source: The Publisher Website.

179402.name: Numenera Cypher Deck 2
179402.description:
Cyphers are among the most common type of numenera devices in the Ninth World. Usually single-use and frequently cobbled together or used in ways completely unrelated to their original intent, cyphers are a great opportunity for characters to discover and use the numenera as one-time weapons, wearable devices, quick heals, and more.
The 120 full-color cards in the Numenera Cypher Deck 2 allow GMs and players to randomly generate cyphers on the fly. Twenty item cards are lavishly illustrated with different device types, while each of the 100 power cards offers multiple power options to match the device. Simply draw an item card to determine the cypher device type, then draw a power card and choose one of the powers given—voila! You’ve generated a cypher in seconds. And the player can hold onto the power card to keep the cypher’s power description handy.

The Cypher Deck 2 draws its cyphers from those in Technology Compendium: Sir Arthour’s Guide to the Numenera, and includes the biotech item type not included in the first Numenera Cypher Deck.
This deck is completely compatible with the first Numenera Cypher Deck. Use either deck, combine them, or choose cards from each to make your own selection of random cyphers. (The Numenera Cypher Deck 2 does not duplicate any content from the first deck.) And if you have the Numenera Cypher Chest, a printout of this deck stores nicely with your other decks in one of the available storage slots.

- From Publisher Website.

179403.name: Steam Wars
179403.description:
User summary:

Steam Wars is an abstract territory-occupation game for two players. Your goal is to earn victory points by expanding your territory while making your opponent lose their territory.

You initially control a territory with three hexes and one robot token on the hexagonal grid board. Each turn, you move one of your robots to expand or secure your territory. A robot can move to any hex within your territory or one hex outside, including hexes marked by your opponent, except for a hex adjacent to or occupied by your opponent's robot.

After movement, place one of your occupation markers on the destination hex if there isn't a marker there already. This hex is now part of your territory. If the hex was your opponent's, they lose control of it, and if this causes their territory to be split, they lose control of all hexes not connected with their robot. Discard all their occupation markers on these hexes.

Your opponent's robots cannot move to one of your hexes adjacent to or occupied by your robot, so secure your territory by moving your robot wisely.

Some hexes have a higher value but have a special requirement to control. As you expand your territory, you will be able to deploy more robots and fulfill the requirement to control these hexes.

The game ends when either player uses up their 30 occupation markers. Add up your victory points earned by hexes you control and occupation markers your opponent discarded. The player with higher total wins the game.
English rulebook is now available.

Publisher's summary:
２人用アブストラクト陣取りゲーム
研究所の地下で２体のロボットが戦うゲーム。
勝利条件：どちらかのプレイヤーの歯車タイルが０枚のとき、勝利点の多いプレイヤーが勝利。
勝利点はボード上の歯車タイル＋獲得した相手の歯車タイル。
ヘックスのボード上でロボットを動かし、自分の陣地を示す歯車タイルを置いて陣地を広げていく。
ロボットは陣地の周り１マスに移動でき、相手の陣地も攻められる。
ロボットの周り１マスの同陣営の歯車タイルは相手のロボットに攻められない。

179404.description:
War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth includes Ents, Dead Men of Dunharrow, Great Eagles of the Misty Mountains, Corsairs of Umbar, Wild Hilmen from Dunland, and Giant Spiders, and with this new expansion for War of the Ring (second edition), these warriors and creatures of Middle-earth – previously featured only as special Event Cards – will become an essential part of the game, with unique figures and specific abilities.

Warriors of Middle-earth also presents new mechanisms to enhance the game. Faction Dice and Faction Events, used together with the new figures, open up new and exciting strategies and make the War of the Ring (second edition) even more challenging and fun.
179404.name: War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth
boardgameexpansion: War of the Ring: Warriors of Middle-earth – Tidings Not Burdens Mini-Expansion

179411.description:
Ptolus (Feature Story)
Articles, Reviews, Fiction, Interviews, Previews

Included exclusive free mini-game from Bad Baby Productions in an associated ZIP file.

This was the first of five issues that were sold (previous issues had been available as free downloads).

The "Volume 4" indicates this issue starts the 4th year of publication of the magazine.

179412.name: Silven Trumpeter (Volume 4, Issue 2 - Jun 2006)
rpgissuearticle: The Domination of Computer Role-Playing Games
179412.description:
The Domination of Computer RPGs (Feature Story)
Exalted 2nd Ed. and Storyteller's Companion reviewed
True Sorcery excerpt
Articles, Reviews, Fiction, Interviews, Previews

179413.name: Battrick
179413.description:
In Battrick, You manage a team of cricketers against other human managers from all over the world. You can log in at any time of the day, or night, to check on your club, expand the ground, buy and sell players, set match orders for upcoming matches and much, much more. Each team is involved in a limited over (50 overs) league, some countries also have a First Class (3 day) league and there is a limited overs cup tournament to compete for, too.

Source: The Game Website.

179414.description:
The fate of Wayword has always been in the hands of the Ancients, beings of unimaginable power, playing their game for centuries. Making lands, raising peoples, all for their games.

The rules are simple. Select your champions... then make them battle it out in the shadow dimension!

Hunters: Enter the Darkness is a team based, player-vs-player, tactical board game that allows the greatest minds to draft characters, then battle it out in different modes of play like the lane pushing "Assault" Mode or the all out brawl that is the "Arena" Mode.

As games progress, players will earn money to upgrade their characters dashboard with new equipment, skills and feats, all unique to that character, allowing for different builds and tactics with each champion and team!

Only the strongest and smartest champions will prevail, hunter or the hunted? That's up to you as these epic battles unfold!

Hunters: Enter the Darkness features:
- Incredible Miniatures
- Action Point turn system
- Unique development of your character
- Modular Boards
- Custom die for the combat
- Mechanics of popular MOBA video games like DOTA, DOTA 2, League of Legends and Heroes of the Storm
179414.name: Hunters: Enter the Darkness
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 24: Creating a World With Miniatures

179415.name: DragonFlame: Fury of the Dragon – Promo card
boardgameversion: DragonFlame: Fury of the Dragon - Promo card (First Edition)
179415.description:
The Fury of the Dragon card was a stretch goal in the DragonFlame Kickstarter campaign.

The card is worth 3 Glory Points and reads:
"When you place the last fire token onto a village, take this card and place it in your hoard."

179416.description:
Dracovalis is a game about dragons attacking, capturing, and destroying cities. The players send dragons to attack or defend cities in order to control as many cities as possible. Players can also cast spells to strengthen the beasts. Aside from the pure joy of burning your friend's cities down or forcing his dragon to turn tail and run, Dracovalis features simultaneous play, so you'll be guessing where your opponent will go every turn.

During your turn, you will secretly decide what towns you wish to attack, or which of your towns are vulnerable and need defending. Once all players have decided, everyone moves simultaneously and the battles begin. Combat is resolved through a simple multi-round dice-pool mechanic that feels like combat and resolves quickly.

You will have a limited number of spells that you can cast during your turn, and the spells can be cast in multiple ways. Will you burn many spell components to ensure your spell goes off properly, or will you risk spell failure to hold some components in reserve?

At the game end, the player who controls the most territory wins.
179416.name: Dracovalis

179417.description: Orleans: Neue Ortskarten N°1 ("Place Tiles N°1") is a mini expansion for Orléans that consists of three new place tiles: Bakery, Goldsmith, and Lair.
179417.name: Orléans: Neue Ortskarten N°1

179418.description:
Pigskin is a game of card drafting and color combos. In each round, players will draft their team and play out four quarters in an attempt to score the most touchdowns. At the end of the fourth quarter, the coach with the higher score wins the championship!

Using quarterbacks, offensive players, and defensive players, you will either score or prevent touchdowns; how these players interact with each other is why it's all about the draft!

Draft five players each round and play four of them for your lineup. The color combo system gives you multiple ways to link cards together in order to pull off special plays and out-think your opponent.

BLUE 42! HUT, HUT, HIKE!
179418.name: Pigskin

179419.name: Sovereign Stone Game Master's Screen
179419.description:
From the screen:
This accessory for the Sovereign Stone Game System includes one three-panel Game Master's Screen.....
Sanctuary, a 32-page adventure by Jeff Crook, is included.

179420.name: Una Spada Chiamata Tentatrice
179420.description:
From the back of the book:
Inizia una saga ispirata ai racconti di Michael Moorcock, autore della leggendaria figura di Elric, il principe albino e della sua spada maledetta, Tempestosa

English translation:
A saga inspired by the novels of Michael Moorcock, author of the legendary figure of Elric, the albino prince and his cursed sword, Stormbringer

179421.name: Whistling Captures
179421.description:
Whistling Captures is a two player abstract strategy game played on a large hexagonal board. You win by capturing all of your opponents' pieces. You capture opponent pieces by sliding past them in an adjacent row; hence, the name "Whistling Captures."

The rules to the game can be found in a post to the Rules Forum on this page.

179422.name: Free Hack (Issue 3 - Jan 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Caves are Hazardous to Your Health
Song of Arthur and Merlin FAQ and Errata
Song of Drums and Shakos Questions and Answers
179422.description:
User summary:

Song of Arthur and Merlin Q&A
Song of Blades and Heroes Q&A, scenario
Dispatches from the Rad Zone

179423.name: Free Hack (Issue 4 - Jul 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Chromeknight's Guide to Song of Blades and Heroes Profiles
Painting a WWII United States Infantryman
179423.description:
User summary:

Fear and Faith Zombie Scenario
Painting Tips
Song of Rooks and Pawns - chess variant
Hobgoblins and Housecats

179424.name: Small Fry
179424.description:
The chase is on! Swim for your life as the tiny fish Finley “Small Fry” Fryer in this thrilling and action packed ocean adventure.

Swim, jump and even float though space to escape from all the perils of the seven seas. Avoid blazing fast swordfish, electric jellyfish, ink squirting octopuses, asteroids and more.
How long can you out-swim the dastardly shark, Wallace “Big Mack” Mackenzie?

FEATURES:
★ Simple one touch controls: touch and hold to dive, release to swim up
★ An all star cast of awesome sea creatures
★ Transition seamlessly from water to air to space
★ Plays like 3 unique games stacked on top of each other!
★ Awesome boosts and upgradable power-ups
★ 60+ challenges to complete
★ Achievements and leaderboards
★ Customize Small Fry with an assortment of hats, glasses and more!

179425.name: Free Hack (Issue 5 - 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Behind the Scenes Look at Power Legion
Drums and Shakos Large Battles Review and Playtest
179425.description:
User summary:

Previews, Reviews, Errata, Battle Reports, Designer's Notes, Scenario

179426.name: Card Crawl
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game App Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
179426.description:
Card Crawl is a solitaire style Dungeon Crawler played
with a modified deck of standard cards.

Clear the Dungeon of 54 cards by using item-cards, slaying monsters and managing your limited inventory. Each run you can use 5 ability-cards (mini deck building) which will give you unique skills. By collecting gold you can unlock 10 ability-cards in the basic game, or up to 40 in the full game, which enable new tactics and even better highscores.

Source: The Publisher Website.

179427.name: Ascension: Archival Expert Promo
179427.description:
Starting in June 2015, Stone Blade Entertainment announced a new incentive program for hobby retailers. The company will now offer exclusive monthly promo card kits to participating retailers.

Archival Expert is the card for June 2015.

Cost: 5 Runes

Mechana Hero

Choose One: You may acquire a Construct this turn without paying its cost OR draw a card

3 Honor

179428.name: Ascension: Lunar Matriarch Promo
179428.description:
Starting in June 2015, Stone Blade Entertainment announced a new incentive program for hobby retailers. The company will now offer exclusive monthly promo card kits to participating retailers.

Lunar Matriarch is the card for July 2015.

Cost: 7 Runes

Lifebound Hero

Gain 5 Honor
Once this turn, you may pay up to 5 rune to gain that much honor

4 Honor

179431.name: Murmelspiele
boardgamefamily: HABA Game in a Tin series
179431.description:
A children's game system based around marbles with instructions for four different marble based games.

1. Castle Marbles(Schlossmurmeln) - players take turns rolling marbes into the front gates of the castle for points.

2. Tin throwing(Dosenwerfen) - players attempt to throw marbles into the game tin for points.

3. Mini Bowling(Miniboule) - the cork marble is placed in a 1 inch circle and players attempt to roll their marble as close as possible to the cork marble without pushing it out of it's circle.

4. Pyramid rolling(Pyramidenroller) - players build a pyramid with their dice and draw an 8 inch circle around it. Another player then attempts to roll marbles at the pyramid, all marbles knocked out of the circle to to the rolling player and marbles in the circle go to the player who set up the pyramid.

179432.name: Academic Conspiracy
179432.description:
Publisher blurb:
Deep with a school are secrets best kept hidden, with devious plots and nefarious ideals veiled by the appearnace of an all-inclusive school. As the characters become caught in the web, they'll have to risk life and limb to survive and save the students. No easy choices in this adventure.

Take your players through the Academic Conspiracy and introduce them to brand new characters, both allies and enemies. In the end, only the players can save the day!

Includes:


Complete adventure for beginning and veteran players
Awesome artwork by Gennifer Bone and Jim Scanlin

179433.description:
To win the coveted Creature College Cup, you must collect more victory points than your opponents. Victory points (VPs) can be won by collecting creatures, completing missions, building your research lab, and smacking down your enemies! Creature College is played in three university terms: Spring, Autumn and Winter. Each term consists of three bidding rounds and one battle round. At the end of twelve rounds the game ends and the player with the most VPs wins.

To start the game, every player takes a player mat, a set of bidding tokens, and playing pieces in their color. Three ability cards are then dealt to each player from which they can choose one. The ability cards allow them to personalize their player a little. The ability card sits face up in the space provided on the player mat. They then take three missions and again choose one. The missions come in 15, 20 and 25 VP types and show a set of cards the player must collect to complete the mission. The mission card sits face down in the space provided on the player mat.

In the bidding round, a number of creature cards are laid face up in the play area (determined by number of players). The players bid in player order (determined by who bid highest in the previous bidding round) if someone is outbid they have to move to a different creature card. Once all bidding has been completed, the players roll two dice and either take research lab cards to fill their research lab slots or battle cards to help them in battle. If Kevin the Giga-Pig has turned up during the bidding phase, all players must now try and battle Kevin. After three bidding rounds, there is a battle round. In player order, players now fight the players either side of them by choosing one or more cards in a single suit, tapping the card (by turning it 90º) and choosing to fight right or left players first. Battle cards may be added in each battle separately, and if the attacking player wins, they get green gems; if they lose, red gems.
179433.name: Creature College
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 13 - YuGiOh & Tabletop Gaming Mag

179435.name: Hierarchy
179435.description:
Hierarchy is a highly interactive negotiation and voting game, built on top of a simple roll-and-move game, with a splash of player selected special player powers on top for spice. A game with 4 players takes 45 to 60 minutes to play.

Each player starts Hierarchy as a pawn, advancing up a simple roll-and-move track. As you advance up the track, you "promote" from pawn to rook, knight, bishop, queen, and (ultimately) king. Each promotion gives you a new special power to help you bend or break the rules of the game. Several of these powers pertain to voting.

Oh, did I forget to mention voting? Each player has a hand of cards. Some have immediate one-shot effects while others are votes. Votes introduce new rules to the game. When you propose a vote, you declare who (one, some, or all players) the new rule will apply to. If the vote passes, it stays in play one round for every vote it passed by (If a vote is 5-to-3 in favor, that vote's rule will stay in play for two rounds.). Votes can affect many different things such as movement, cards in hand or in play, votes, etc.

The first player to reach the last square of the board wins the game. With the player powers, unexpected one-shot card effects, and the possibility of sanction through votes against you from the other players, it's a task easier said than done.

179436.name: Eight-by-Eight
179436.description:
It's like Pente, but on a smaller board with a dash of luck and little press-your-luck for garnish on top! Your goal: Form a straight, contiguous horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line of at least five pieces of your color. For 2 to 4 players. Plays in 30 to 45 minutes.

You play Eight-by-Eight in the spaces of an 8x8 grid. Each column and row is numbered so every space is paired with a unique pair of numbers from 1 to 8 (ex: The spaces 4,2; 4,3; 4,4; and 4,5 are adjacent to each other and form a straight horizontal line.). On your turn you roll an eight-sided die. Now you have a choice: Play a piece in any vacant space in the row or column you rolled (ex: You roll a "6." You may play in any vacant space in the column numbered "6" or the row numbered "6.") or you can place one of your pieces on the number you rolled to "black it out" and roll again. If you roll a number you've blacked out, your turn immediately ends.

The first player to get five or more pieces in a straight line (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) wins the game. Quick, easy, and with more strategy than you'd expect.

179437.name: Underworld Ascendant
179437.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




"Far more than a dungeon crawl, Underworld Ascendant is a next-generation sequel to the legendary fantasy RPG's Ultima Underworld & Ultima Underworld 2. It not only modernizes the series' visuals and user interface to take full advantage of the today's powerful PC's, it innovates in bold new ways."

Source: The Game Website.

179438.name: Eiszeit
179438.description:
Ice Hockey trivia game.
Players use dice to move along the track. When they land on a ? space they must answer a question. If the correct answer is forthcoming, that player's pawn on the score table is moved up one row. There are 16 rows and if you get to the top first (16 correct answers), you win the game.
On the track there are also ! spaces. Land on one of these you draw an Event Card and resolve it.

179439.name: Digimon: Monster Match
179439.description:
The 36 tiles are separately placed face down on the table. The object is to collect a set of 4 characters. A set needs a Kid at first and then followed by related tiles - the In-Training Digimon, the Rookie Digimon and the Champion Digimon. These are collectively known as a Team.

The game play is easy. Reveal a tile. If you can use it, take it. If you can't use it, it is shown to the other players and returned face-down to the table.

If an Evil Digimon is revealed you must duel with another player. A duel is resolved by a die roll each, the highest thrower wins. If the challenger wins, the other player has to turn over one of his tiles. The Challenger gets the Evil Digimon as it is worth points at the end of the game. If the challenged player wins, he gets the Evil Digimon tile and the challenger turns over one of his tiles. A further advantage on winning a duel is that you can turn back a tile in front of you if it has previously been turned face down.

The game continues until there are no more tiles from the middle of the table to be revealed. Points are awarded for:
A complete team (all face-up) scores 5 points.
Any other turned up team members in uncompleted teams score 1 point each.
An Evil Digimon in your possession scores 2 points.
The player with the most points, wins.

179440.name: Vanquish Sky
179440.description:
User summary:

A 2 player card game that simulates a martial arts duel, or perhaps a typical fighting game.

Each player has a hand of Power, Speed and Technique cards (battle cards) that has a rock-paper-scissors relationship. Each player also has 18 special "moves" cards in a shuffled deck, with a few lined face up. Each turn, a player plays one of his battle cards, and the turn winner (of the rock-paper-scissors) does 1 damage. The battle cards stay turn after turn, building up a line. After winning a turn, a player can use one of his face up moves if the requirements for that move corresponds with what he has in his battle card line, to release combos, dealing more damage. Each move also has a special effect that triggers when released.

For each damage a player gets, he reveals the top card of his moves deck. So, for each damage, the player gets access to more moves.

179441.name: Space Hulk Ascension - Imperial Fists
179441.description:
User Summary

Imperial Fists is the first expansion and it adds a new campaign called 'Shield of Retribution' that has 15 main Missions and 20 flash Missions. There is also a new piece of equipment: Tarantula Sentry Turret and Imperial Fists Marines.

179443.name: Space Hulk Ascension - Salamanders
179443.description:
User Summary

Salamanders is the second expansion and it adds a new campaign called 'Ashes to Ashes' (although later changed to 'Forge of Heroes') that has 20 main Missions and 20 flash Missions. There are also new specific flamer pattern and psychic spells as well as Salamanders Space Marines (2 Heavy terminator per squad).

179445.name: Space Hulk Ascension - Dark Angels
179445.description:
User Summary

Dark Angels is the third expansion and adds a new campaign called 'Bringer of Sorrows' that adds 20 main Missions and 20 flash Missions. There are also new psychic spells, Class: Apothecary, equipment: Plasma Cannon, and Dark Angels Space Marines.

179447.name: Zhu Zhu Pets: Wild Wacky Hamster Game
179447.description: Welcome to the land of Zhu Zhu Pets and get ready for the Wild and Wacky Hamster Race! Travel along the Zhu Zhu Pets path. But this is anything but a simple race: there are many obstacles you'll encounter along the way. Some will push you ahead, some will send you back, and some can be used to slow down the other players.

179448.description: Monikers: Shmonikers is the first expansion for Monikers. It features 111 new names and rules for adding additional rounds to the game.
179448.name: Monikers: Shmonikers
boardgamepodcastepisode: #13: Shakespeare on tap, Between Two Cities, Monikers, Beer festival wishlist

179449.name: Spin Safari
179449.description:
Immerse yourself in a most exotic puzzle game! Enjoy the hours of adventure that Spin Safari has to offer in over 100 free-to-play and fun levels!

Discover different regions of the world, from the jungle to the sea ice via the savanna and the ocean depths. Round the animals up and feed and care for them to achieve the best scores and beat your friends on Facebook.

Features of Spin Safari:
• Sumptuous and detailed graphics
• Explore 100 levels
• The game is easy to play using just one finger
• Rankings among friends
• Synchronization with Facebook
• Boosters available for excessively wild levels

Source: The Publisher Website.

179451.name: Hawaiian Checkers
179451.description:
User Summary

Hawaiian Checkers - or Konane - is a more than two centuries old game and can be played on a 6 by 6 or 8 by 8 board in three difficulties mode.

179452.name: Maximus Draughts
179452.description:
User Summary

Maximus Draughts is available in 8 languages. There is a beginners level and 7 trainingslevel, so that your International Checkers skill will improve.

PDN-file (Portable Draughts Notation) format is supported.

Maximus Draughts allows a free setup and analysis of games and positions.

179453.name: Double Feature #1: Disco Ambulance and Women's Prison of the Apes
179453.description:
From the Introduction

Welcome Back, My Friends, to the Show That Never Ends!
We’re so glad you could attend, come inside, come inside. This Double Feature provides both players and DJ’s alike with supplemental material that can be added to your Spirit of 77 campaign. These included adventures can be used as a starting point or as the next chapter in your long term story. Feel free to mix and match as you see fit.

This Double Feature includes:

New Adventure: Women’s Prison of the Apes - In order to escape jail time, you’ve been tasked with breaking out a rich party girl from one of the strangest prisons in the country. Load up your bananas and hide your shivs, it’s time to break out!

New Role: Introducing the Escape Artist - Big time illusions, death-defying escapes, and the grand spotlight awaits you (provided you can hold your breath while you get out of these handcuffs).

New Adventure: Disco Ambulance - Hit the siren and the rotating disco ball as you make your way through the crowded city streets as members of the B&D Ambulance Company. Put on your scrubs and dancing shoes, it’s all about stayin’ alive.
Come inside, the show’s about to start! And as always, keep on truckin’!

179454.name: Double Feature #2: Juke Box Villains and BEAST: Bound and Down
179454.description:
From the Introduction

Hello Hooray! Let The Show Begin!

Let the lights grow dim, we’ve been ready. This Double Feature provides both players and DJ’s alike with supplemental material that can be added to your Spirit of 77 campaign. These included adventures can be used as a starting point or as the next chapter in your long term story. Feel free to mix and match as you see fit.

This Double Feature includes:

New Adventure: BEAST: Bound and Down - Breaker, breaker, good buddy. Time to barrel down the highway with Smokey on your tail and Sasquatch on your back. Gotta long way to go and wild time to get there. That’s a big ten-four!

New Role: It’s All About Being a Board Rat - Those good old days of riding the surf and boarding through sidewalks have made you an expert in taking big splashes and handling major wipeouts!

New Adventure: Jukebox Villains - It’s a long way to the top if you wanna rock and roll, with obsessive collectors, weird record store employees, and the greatest secret recording in history. We don’t need another hero, bring on the bad guys!
You’re going to love every second, every moment, every scream!

Keep on truckin’!

179455.description:
This card may be shuffled to Carrock Adventure deck.
If drawn the Prince of Eagle help You.
Roll the die:
1-2 = Look at the 2 topmost cards and put back in any order

179455.name: Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise: Fürst der Adler – Die Mini-Erweiterung
boardgameexpansion: Der Hobbit: Eine unerwartete Reise – Das Spiel zum Film

If drawn roll the die:
